loans.name: Welekema Group

texts.en:
Lorpu N. K. is the leader of a group of 4 borrowers called 'Welekema'. She is married with 11 children aged 9-29 years old, and their educational levels are kindergarten-high school graduate. She also cares for 4 nieces and nephews.

Lorpu is an illiterate due to lack of financial support. She lives and works in the Belefania community, Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong county, Liberia. Her business is the sale of general goods. She buys goods wholesale and sells retail to residents of her community near Gbarnga.

Lorpu has been running this business for 4 years, and is hoping to improve her business to a real shop. She faces problems with high transportation rates from wholesalers to her retail site. Lorpu needs this loan to purchase new goods to improve her business. She dreams of giving her family the best education to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase new goods to improve business.

loans.name: Jaquelinne

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Jaquelinne tiene 26 años y tiene siete meses de embarazo. La socia tiene dos hijos, Sandro tiene siete años y Anne tiene cuatro años de edad. La socia Jaquelinne es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra a 45 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a 45 minutos de viaje. 

La socia se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo hacer desayunar a sus hijos y después enviarlos al colegio. La socia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar tiene que ir a vender pan a la Plaza de Armas de la ciudad de Urcos. Ella nos cuenta que desde muy niña ayudaba a su mamá a elaborar el pan y a vender. Ella aprendió de las enseñazas de su mamá y ahora la socia Jaquelinne tiene su propio negocio.  Ella y sus compañeras de negocio desde hace 2 años atrás se les ocurrió crear un pan especial que lo llamaron “chuta navideña” que tiene las mismas características del pan chuta (Pan redondo blando con un olor peculiar y es un pan gigante, pan típico de la ciudad de Urcos) pero le agregaron pasas y frutas. La socia y sus compañeras de negocio solo preparan este pan “Chuta navideña” para las fiestas de navidad. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mas insumos como harina, azúcar, manteca, frutas y pasas para preparar las “chutas navideñas” para esta navidad ya que por estas épocas es donde se vende más. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jaquelinne is 26 years old and is seven months pregnant. She has two children, Sandro, 7, and Anne, 4. Jaquelinne is a native of the city of Urcos, province of Quispicanchis, and department of Cusco. She belongs to the “Qori Orcco” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa. Urcos is 45 km. from the city of Cusco, about a 45-minute journey.

Jaquelinne gets up very early to do her housework, such as making breakfast for her children and sending them off to school. After doing her household chores, she goes to sell bread in the Plaza de Armas of the city of Urcos. She says that from a young age, she helped her mother make and sell bread. She learned the lessons of her mother and now has her own business.

Two years ago, Jaquelinne and her work partners had the idea to create a special bread that they called “Chuta Navideña” [Christmas Chuta]. It has the same characteristics as normal chuta bread (a large, soft, round bread with particular smell that is traditional in Urcos) with the addition of raisins and fruit. They only prepare this bread for the Christmas holidays.

This loan is needed to purchase the ingredients for this season’s “Chutas Navideñas,” such as flour, sugar, butter, fruits, and raisins. Jaquelinne is grateful for this opportunity, and commits to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, sugar, butter fruit, and raisins for “chutas navideñas”.

loans.name: Luz Selvith

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz Selvith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Chankas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 26 años y es madre de 01 hijo,  ya independiente.

Luz Selvith, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron muy buenos resultados y hoy en día, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas, lleva 02 años en el negocio, que hoy en la actualidad, le esta dando muy buenos resultados,  se siente muy contenta por lo logrado. Se encuentra ubicada en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa, donde atiende a sus clientes, con la amabilidad y carisma, que siempre la ha caracterizado. 

Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con un capital de  S/. 200.00 y se inicio con 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Luz Selvith, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando más lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Luz Selvith, 26, is a member of the "Los Chankas" communal bank, which is in Lamas district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is married and has a son, who is independent. Luz Selvith is a woman who has been able to surpass many difficulties in her life; her desire to get ahead in life had good results: she has sold carbonated beverages for two years and, as of today, it is producing well; she is happy to have accomplished this. She has set up a well-equipped area of her house from which to take care of her customers with her characteristic kindness and charisma. She runs her own business; she has no boss or set schedule. She tells us that she began with a 200 sol investment in 5 cases of soft-drinks. As she did well, she invested a bit more each time. Now, with this 1700 sol loan she will buy more beverages like: cases of soft-drinks in various flavors, sizes and brands, as well as still and sparkling mineral water. Luz Selvith is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed help; she is responsible with her repayments and intends to continue to be so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Rasmiyya

texts.en: Rasmiyya M. lives in the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She is 34 and is single. Rasmiyya has been in business for 5 years. Noe Rasmiyya M. is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 4 calves to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up with cereals and retail them

loans.name: Vicente Narcizo

texts.es:
El señor Vicente Narcizo A. tiene ya más de diez años dedicándose a la venta y reparación llantas de autos y de partes usadas.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta variedad de mercancía y desea mejorar más el local, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del su negocio y con esta nueva inversión.
texts.en:
Mr. Vicente Narcizo A. has been working for the last ten years repairing and selling car tires and used parts. His business needs more merchandise variety and he wishes to improve the shop, but he doesn’t have enough capital to use. That is why he is asking for a loan. He plans to pay back the loan with the profits that he receives from his business and from the new money that he will put in.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and to improve his shop

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria B. is from the town of Poblacion East, Sta. Ignacia, Tarlac. She is 35 years old. Gloria is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business selling fish balls and other dim sum to the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios R. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 41 years old and married, and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Remedios operates a fishing business. He has worked at peddling and selling fish in the local community for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month doing so.

In 2010, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the first loan Remedios takes out from HSPFI. Remedios is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase more fish to sell. Remedios plans to supplement income of his family with the revenue this helps generate.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Cheb

texts.en: Mrs. Cheb R., born in 1982, is married and has three young children who are enrolled in school. To earn an income, she, along with her husband, raises pigs and crops to sell when they come to maturity. Cheb R. is now requesting a loan to buy a couple of cows to help plow the farmland to purchase a piece of land in a good location to cultivate a variety of crops for extra income. The loan will provide Cheb R.’s family with additional income and an improved standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a couple of cows and a piece of land.

loans.name: Twegatte Women's Group, Mukono

texts.en:
38-year-old N. Justine has reckoned on earnings from her ten-year-old retail shop in the heart of Kayiringuto trading center in Mukono to foster the welfare of her family. Since she took the reins of her business, she has gained enough leverage as her business, that for the most part deals in sugar, soft drinks and foodstuffs, has enabled her to support her five children’s education.

This happily married mother was prevailed upon by close acquaintances to open up her own business. Before she ventured into her retail shop, she was a secondhand-clothes dealer.

Justine has gone to extreme lengths to ensure her monthly earnings of 400,000 shillings are consolidated. In the wake of this success have been financial and other business operational problems that she has managed to stem the tide of.

Justine has not lost sight of her desire to see her business gravitate to a wholesale franchise. With enough second thought, she has been brought to terms with the fact that this loan will come in handy in helping her to buy more retail stock like rice, sugar and crates of soda.

loans.use: To buy more general merchandise like rice, sugar and sodas

loans.name: Berlina

texts.en:
Berlina D. is from the village of TINACLAAN MISAMIS, OCCIDENTAL. She is 51 years old and single. To make a living, Berlina owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operatinga  tricycle transport services. Berlina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Berlina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Berlina is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Berlina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her  family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en:
U. Zebo is an enterprising woman with a big desire to improve her family's quality of life. She is married with 3 children. Fourteen years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. Zebo began this business because she did not have a job and she needed to find an activity to support her husband with family expenses. Zebo works in a tailoring shop where she produces national dresses for women.

Zebo needs to continue expanding her business so that her children can continue with their education. She is asking for a loan of $800 USD to buy supplies to increase her production and cover her customers' demands. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for sewing women's national dresses

loans.name: Pendo Group

texts.fr:
Patricie N. est une commerçante âgée de 47ans qui habite la Commune de Rugombo en Province Cibitoke  à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de patates douces depuis trois ans au Marche de Rugombo.Elle était cultivatrice avant de commencer cette activité commerciale. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 4e année du primaire. Elle est  une veuve. Elle est maintenant  au 4e cycle dans le crédit communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 3 garçons dont 2 sont à l’école. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour augmenter  la quantité de patates douces qu’elle achète pour revendre aux clients . Elle a l’espoir qu’avec le crédit de Turame, elle pourra avoir beaucoup de bénéfice et faire ses épargnes pour résoudre ses divers problèmes financiers et s’acheter sa propre maison.
Elle reconnait que Turame lui est venu en aide au bon moment parce que elle travaillait pour les autres afin d’avoir de quoi manger mais maintenant le crédit de Turame a amélioré son mode de vie

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  communautaire « Pendo ».
texts.en:
Patricie N. is a 47 year old merchant. She lives in the town of Rugombo in the Cibitoke province in the western part of Burundi. She has been selling sweet potatoes for three years at the Rugombo market. Before starting this business, she was a farmer. She studied until the 4th year of primary school. She is a widow. She is currently in the 4th cycle of the community loan with Turame. She is the mother of 3 boys of which 2 go to school. She is requesting a Kiva loan to increase the quantity of sweet potatoes that she buys to resell to her customers. With the loan from Turame, she hopes to increase her profits and save money to solve her various financial problems and buy her own house. She acknowledges that Turame helped her at the right moment, as she worked for others in order to be able to have enough to eat. Her way of living has now improved thanks to the Turame loan. She is one of the members of the « Pendo » community group.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of sweet potatoes that she buys to resell to her customers

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna A. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old. Myrna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling dried fish and shrimp in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the  loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering.

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 64 años, es casada y vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 21 años D. experiencia en la actividad agrícola y lo que principalmente cultiva es papa y  maíz sobre extensiones D. terreno que posee en su tierra natal ubicado en la zona rural D. su localidad. Casi siempre acuD. a ver sus terrenos y  más en época D. siembra y cosecha, este ultimo es ella misma la encargada D. vender su cosecha al por mayor en el mercado local donD. tiene regulares rentas que le permiten incrementar un poco mas su inversión para la siguiente siembra, puesto que no tiene edad suficiente para continuar con esta actividad. Ahora sus hijos  trabajan mas seguido y se dedican a ver sus  terrenos D. cultivo, sin embargo Teofila no descansa en buscar buenos compradores para su cosecha, es por eso que continuara esforzándose en la agricultura. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. semillas y abono para su próxima campaña D. siembra.
texts.en:
Teófila, 64, is married and lives in her own home with her three children. She has been a farmer for 21 years. Her main crops are potatoes and corn. Her fields are located in the area where she was born in her locality’s rural zone. Customarily she visits her fields mostly during planting and harvesting times. She herself sells her crops at wholesale in the local market where her profits are satisfactory and which permit her to gradually increase her investment in the next planting. Because she is now of an age that does not permit her to continue with this kind of work, her children now work more often and see to the fields. However, Teófila works tirelessly to find good buyers for her crops and this is why she will continue to work in farming. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she can count on financial support because she has always been responsible with her repayments. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal group because all its members are responsible, very united people. She is grateful to all those who will fund the loan she is requesting that will be very useful for her business. She will use the requested funds to buy seed and manure for the next planting cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and manure for the next planting cycle.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a hardworking farmer from the town of Kitale, Western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years and sells his maize, beans, vegetables, milk, and bananas to the local market. He also earns income from his hotel and butchery which he operates in the same area. He also keeps poultry so he earns income from the sale of eggs.

Moses has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 62,400 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will help in paying school fees for his children and their health will improve since they will have enough milk for consumption.

Moses is 34 years old. He is married and has been blessed with four children between the ages of 2 and 13. Three of the children are currently attending school. In the future, he would like to own a pick-up truck to assist in the transportation of milk.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fe Luzana Group

texts.en:
Fe L. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Fe is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Fe L. Group.

Fe is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Fe is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet N. is from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Janet owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Janet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Janet plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 39 years old. She is married and has three children. Agnes struggles to sell a small quantity of goods in her small shop. She sells only a few goods in her shop, such as body lotion and salt. She has owned this shop since 2005. Her business hours are from 7 am to 7 pm every day.

Although Agnes has been in this business for about 5 years, her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully. To end this, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business by adding a large quantity of food, such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, different kinds of flours, cosmetic goods, drinks, etc.  If successful, Agnes will hopefully earn more profits than she has been and these profits will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business for better financial stability in her future.

loans.use: A variety of goods, such as food, cosmetics, and drinks

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Mrs. Rosita O. is from the Barangay (neighborhood or district) of Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married and blessed with six children of whom three are now in their adult stage and the other three are still teenagers. To make a living, she is presently engaged in dressmaking activities. She is also receiving support from her husband as a warehouse man in one of the shopping centers here in the city. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for 14 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (Php) a month from this business activity. Just this year, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita, as a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan program, was given the privilege to apply a loan. She is now requesting a loan amount of Php15,000.00 as her first loan, which will be used for additional capital for her existing dressmaking business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for a future use, paying for her children’s education, making loan repayments, purchasing insurance and possibly expanding her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperative in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing dressmaking business

loans.name: Johnstone  Mbitila

texts.en:
Johnstone is a forty four year old gentleman. He is married to Mrs Mebo and both have been blessed with four children aged 17, 15, 13 and 8 years respectively. All the children go to school. It is through the profits from the business that Mr. Johnstone has been able to educate the children.

Johnstone learned about KADET LTD through an advertisement and is one of the oldest clients of KADET LTD. He has borrowed two loans and serviced them well. With this third loan he plans to buy additional stock of the latest movie tapes and DVDs to ensure customer satisfactory and  attract more customers.

His future plan is to open a wholesale shop to supply movie tapes and DVDs to the other retailers and from the business profits, he would like to buy a plot and develop it.

loans.use: To purchase additional movie tapes and DVDs

loans.name: Constance Efia Antwi

texts.en: Constance Efia Antwi M. is divorced and has one child. She operates a bar where she sells soft drinks, bags of water and other items at Abura. Constance has been in this business for two years. She is asking to use the loan to expand her operations, thereby increasing her income. With the new profits from her expanded business, Constance plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: expand her operations, thereby increasing her income

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Ty S., age 33, makes a living by selling fish in Phnom Penh City. She sells fish that she buys from other fisherman in the local market. She currently earns an average of US $5 a day, and she has operated her business since the beginning of the year. Her husband is 38 years old and is a trailer taxi driver.  He earns an income to support her family's daily expenses.

Ty S. is the mother of two teenage children who are in school. Recently, her husband’s motorbike broke down while providing his service. Because of that, Ty S. has decided to seek a loan of $500 from Kiva, which she will use for her husband to replace the broken motorcycle.

Ty S. was not available at that day, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To replace broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Paradizo Group

texts.fr: Shamamba K. est entrepreneur, âgée de 32 ans, femme vivant seule, mère de 4 enfants.  Elle vend des habits usagers (friperie). Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre, initiée par sa mère. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ en 2008. Elle installe ses produits  au petit marché sectoriel du quartier TMK. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  1 ballon de vêtements (friperie).  En plus, elle ambitionne devenir commerçante grossiste des friperies. La cliente Shamamba K. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Paradizo est constitué de 27 membres.
texts.en: Shamamba K. is an entrepreneur.  She is 32 years old, a single woman, and the mother of 4 children.  She sells used clothing (second-hand).  She began her business with her own funds, given by her mother.  Later on, she received a loan for $50 from IMF Hemika in 2008.  She sets up her products in the small sectoral market of the neighborhood TMK.  This new loan should allow her to stock up with one ball of clothing (second-hand).  Moreover, she hopes to become a wholesaler of second-hand clothing.  The client Shamamba K. thanks Hekima for its work to help the impoverished who are excluded by classic banks.  The group Paradizo is made up of 27 members.

loans.use: To buy a ball of clothes (second-hand)

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 28 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, vive con sus padres y hermanas, Guadalupe tiene una hija de 5 años de edad, el negocio posee el negocio de ropa y vende en el centro de Corinto los días de comercio miércoles y domingo,  desde muy tempano debe prepararse para salir a colocarse en su puesto de venta.
Ella quiere surtir el negocio comprando mercadería y solicita un préstamo para realizar la inversión en prendas de vestir que estén de moda. Con el apoyo de este préstamo diversificara la mercadería para los clientes que siempre demandan nuevos estilos y colores.
Sus sueños son grandes surtir el negocio, aumentar el número de clientes, vender más y de esta manera ayudar mejor a su familia y a su hija sacarla a delante con la educación.
texts.en:
Guadalupe sells clothes.  She is 28 years old and lives in Corinto, in Morazán department, with her parents and sisters.  Guadalupe has a 5 year-old daughter.  She owns her own clothes business and makes her sales in the center of Corinto on Wednesdays and Sundays.  She has to get ready very early in the morning so that she can go out and position herself on her sales stall.

Guadalupe would like to stock her business, buying merchandise, and she is requesting a loan so that she can invest in clothes that are currently in fashion.  With the support of this loan, she will diversify her merchandise for her customers who are always asking for new styles and colors.

Guadalupe's dreams are to stock her business, to increase her number of customers, to sell more and, consequently, to be able to better help her family and get her daughter ahead in her education.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
The young woman in the photograph is Ban R., age 60, who lives in the province of Kompong Tom, which has the best land for farming. She is a married woman who is devoted to her six children, four of whom are single and the other two are married. 

Ban R. owns a farm that she inherited from her grandmother where she grows various crops. She wants to plant a peanut crop in order to earn additional income. Her husband also helps her in the farming business. The beginning of this year is the best time for her to plant her peanuts, but she doesn’t have the funds to do it yet. To solve this problem, Ban R. would like a loan to buy some fertilizers, a pumping machine, and seeds for growing.

loans.use: To buy some fertilizers, a pumping machine, and seeds for growing.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El señor Justo vive en casa familiar con su esposa en la zona alto san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, la actividad que realiza es la reparación de motores de autos, electrodomésticos,  etc. Tiene un taxi con el cual trabaja en transporte publico, esta casado tiene una hija que actualmente vive con el y su esposa, hace un mes atrás alquilo un taller de reparacion de motores y otros.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar herramientas e instalar mejor el taller porque tiene ya muchos clientes, y de esta manera conservar esta otra fuente de ingresos estable

Es cliente de impro, paga muy bien y por el carácter social puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Justo lives in his family home with his wife in the community of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz.  He repairs automobile motors, electrical household appliances, etc.  He also owns a taxi and provides public transportation.  He is married and his daughter is currently living with him and his wife.  One month ago, he rented a motor repair shop.

He will use the loan to buy tools and better equip the repair shop because he already has many customers and this will enable him maintain this other source of stable income. He is a client of Impro who pays on time and qualifies to be approved for the loan.
.

loans.use: compra de herramientas para installar su taller en mejores condiciones. To buy tools to improve conditions in his repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two computers with their corresponding desks.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 62-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a fishing business.  She lives in Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Lucia is borrowing PHP 23,000 to fund her business operations. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lucia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upom a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva,org

loans.use: Funds for her business operations

loans.name: Capuchino Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO SE LLAMA "CAPUCHINO" SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE MORELOS, MÉXICO. LA SEÑORA YOLANDA C. P. ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO, ELLA VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS EN SU COMUNIDAD, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA SIEMBRA EN EL CAMPO Y LO APOYA EN LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA YA QUE CON LO QUE GANA SU ESPOSO NO ALCANZA PARA EL SUSTENTO DE SU FAMILIA, ELLA DIA A DIA TRATA DE SACAR A DELANTE A SU FAMILIA CON SU VENTA DE SU NEGOCIO, ELLA TAMBIEN ATIENDE LAS LABORES DEL HOGAR. LA SEÑORA YOLANDA SE SIENTE MUY CONTENTA POR LA OPORTUNIDAD DE LE DAN PARA OBTENER UN PRESTAMO E INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO. OBSERVACIONES LAS SEÑORAS QUE NO SE VEN BIEN SE LLAMAN HILDA O. Y FRANCISCA B..
texts.en:
The group called “Capuchino” is located in the State of Morelos in Mexico. Sra. Yolanda C. Polbano is a member of the group. She sells fruits and vegetables in her community. Her husband is a farmer and helps her with the household expenses. However, his earnings are not enough to support their family. Day after day, Yolanda tries to move her family forward with the sales from her business. She also takes care of the household chores.

Sra. Yolanda is pleased with the opportunity she has been given through this loan so that she can invest in her business. It should be noted that the ladies whose faces are hidden are Hilda O. and Francisca B..

loans.use: To invest in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana forma parte del banco comunal “Nuestros inicios” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, vendiendo sopaipillas, empanadas, completos, mermeladas, pasteles y confites que ella misma realiza. Sin embargo ahora el kiosco en el cual vendía sus productos, se encuentra en reparaciones, ya que se desarmaron unas latas de éste. Mientras tanto sigue en el mismo rubro del comercio, pero relacionado con la picaduría y venta de leña, además de vender y realizar chocolates, mermeladas, kuchen y galletas. Su esposo e hija ayudan en el negocio, ya que ambos venden los productos de Adriana en sus respectivos trabajos. Por su parte Adriana vende directamente desde su casa, colaciones y desayunos que le solicitan sus clientes.
Su mercadería la compra usualmente en supermercados, con esto se abastece de ingredientes para sus productos. La leña la compra en casa particulares.
Con el préstamo comprará materiales de construcción para reparar su kiosco, leña, una motosierra y un lavamanos.
El sueño de Adriana es mudarse a una casa nueva, en la cuál pueda instalar el kiosco que se encuentra en reparaciones. Es por esto su motivación de continuar en el negocio, para concretar sus proyectos a fines del año 2012. Además sus hijas entrarán a la universidad y Adriana deberá costear sus estudios, para así brindarles un mejor bienestar.
Para Adriana el préstamo de Fondo esperanza ha significado un gran apoyo para su negocio, puesto que con éste, invertirá y obtendrá mayores ingresos. Respecto a las reuniones grupales, ella se siente muy a gusto con sus compañeras y asesora. Ya que existe mucha confianza y gentileza entre ellas. Por otro lado las capacitaciones han sido de gran utilidad para su negocio, ya que ha aprendido a registrar sus ingresos y salidas de dinero, con esto ha organizado mejor su negocio.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Adriana is a member of the “Nuestros Inicios” (Our Beginnings) community bank which is located in the city of Temuco.

Adriana is a saleswoman.  She sells 'sopaipillas' (a fried pastry), empanadas, 'completos' (sandwiches), jams, cakes and comfits that she makes herself.  However, the kiosk where she sells her products is currently being fixed because it is in a bad state of repair.  In the meanwhile, she continues making sales but she sells firewood as well as chocolates, jams, cakes and cookies that she makes herself.  Adriana's husband and daughter help her in her business since they both sell her products at work.  Adriana herself sells light lunches and breakfasts that her customers request directly from her home.

Adriana usually buys her merchandise in supermarkets.  This is how she stocks up with ingredients for making her products.  She buys her firewood from private homes.  Adriana will use her loan to buy building supplies to repair her kiosk.  She will also buy firewood, a chainsaw and a sink.  Adriana's dream is to move to a new home in which she can set up her kiosk.  Her motivation to continue in her business is to carry out her plans at the end of 2012.  Her daughters will start university and Adriana will pay for their studies in order to improve their well-being.

Fondo Esperanza's loan has represented a great support for Adriana's business since she will invest it and make more income.  As regards her group meetings, she feels very comfortable with her fellow group members and her advisor since they are very trusting and kind.  The training sessions have been very useful for her business since she has learned how to keep a record of her incomings and outgoings.  This has helped her to better organize her business.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía region.  The city is located 670km to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  On the outskirts of the city are a series of spas and lakeside resorts (Pucón, Villarica) and very striking flora and fauna concentrated in nearby nature parks.  This region is home to 50% of the Mapuches (indigenous people) in our country.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her kiosk and to buy firewood, a chainsaw and a sink

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 4 Group

texts.en:
Yoselin is a borrower who lives in Santiago, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres Luchadoras (Fighting Women) 4, and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Yoselin runs a successful “miscellaneous” store, mostly selling clothing and shoes. With this loan, she plans to purchase clothing, shoes, perfume, accessories, and jewelry to sell for a small profit to her friends and neighbors.

Yoselin and her long-term partner have five children and live in a simple home in Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. Urban areas of the Dominican Republic are very overcrowded and can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate health care. 

This is Yoselin’s fourth loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve the home life of her family. With the profits, she hopes to buy a plot of land to build their home and to reinvest in her business.

Yoselin hopes to continue her dream as a businesswoman; she wants to have a very improved, big store. Thank you for lending to Yoselin and the Mujeres Luchadoras group!

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, accessories, jewelry, and perfume

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es mujer trabajadora, de profesión docente con veintisiete años de experiencia, en donde ha logrado educar a sus dos hijos, así como las mejoras a su casa. El cual ha sido el objetivo todo estos años.
Hoy en día necesita reparar el techo, pero no cuenta con todo el capital, lo que recurre al financiamiento para lograr el cambio. Comprara láminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, para comenzar la obra.
Contenta ya que podrá hacer esta mejora ante del invierno,  así como pagar a plazos y cuotas a bajo interese.
texts.en:
Juana is a hard-working woman.  She is a teacher by profession and has 27 years experience.  She has managed to educate her two children and make improvements to her home which has been her goal all these years.

Juana currently needs to replace her roof but she doesn't have enough capital.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan.  She will buy metal sheets, beams and bolts so that she can start the work.

Juana is happy that she will be able to make this improvement before the winter comes.  She is also happy that she can pay by instalments at a low interest rate.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, beams and bolts to replace her roof

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.es: El Sr. Juvenal se dedica al comercio de papa desde hace cuatro años, trae papa desde la localidad de independencia y kami, y posteriormente lo comercializa en la localidad de Colcapirhua, la compra y venta que realiza del producto es al contado, debido a que el sr. Juvenal se compro un terreno le falta capital de trabajo, motivo por el cual solicita el crédito para la compra de papa por cantidad ya que le hicieron varios pedidos, vive en domicilio propio con su esposa y sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar también le ayudan en su trabajo, es un apersona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juvenal has been selling potatoes for four years.  He transports them from the towns of Independencia and Kami, and then sells them in the town of Colcapirhua.  He buys and sells his products for cash.  Juvenal has bought a plot of land and so lacks working capital.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy potatoes in bulk since he has several orders.

Juvenal lives in his own home together with his wife and his school-age children who also help him in his work.  He is a very hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: to buy potatoes in bulk

loans.name: Malik

texts.en:
Malik runs a small business, selling household goods in Agsu’s busy central market. He is married and has one child. 

He was not able find a good-paying job, so he decided to go into business for himself. He has now been self-employed in his current business for seven years and is the sole breadwinner for his family. 

Malik is very determined and serious about his business. Maintaining a reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service have always been priorities in Malik’s work and have ensured the success of his business. 

Malik is asking for a loan of 1,000 AZN to increase his assortment of goods. The loan will be beneficial for Malik’s business and will also help him meet his household expenses and set aside some savings for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Hijas De Sion 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the group coordinator of her group, Hijas D. Sion 1 & 2. This group has 10 members. The group is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town.

Maria runs a small business selling empanadas (filled dough of meat, eggs or vegetables). She dedicates herself to selling this meal from her house and producing income for her family. She has three children and they are live together with her husband and her children's father. 

Maria is really excited to develop her business, which she started four years ago with some of her savings. She is committed to do a business and help her husband with extras income. This is her first Esperanza loan. She wants to use her business profits to save.

Her dreams are to have her own house, and thanks to her business, her savings and the Lord, she will get it. Her favorite thing to do is to play sports, especially softball.

loans.use: to buy a gas tank for cooking

loans.name: Richard Agustin

texts.es:
El Sr. Richard cuenta con un Autoservice desde el año 2000, dicha actividad lo lleva desarrollando durante 10 años y en el barrio donde se encuentra ya cuenta con clientes fieles.
Richard, es joven y sin hijos, por lo que cuenta con mayor capacidad de invertir en su negocio y hacerlo crecer con mayor rapidez.
El crédito solicitado a la Fundación Paraguaya, desea invertirlo en la compra de lácteos, gaseosas, carnes, y otros artículos que vende en su negocio.
Richard agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya el apoyo otorgado, mediante el cual tendrá oportunidad de darle otro impulso a su emprendimiento y hacer conocer su historia a inversionistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Richard has owned a supermarket since the year 2000.  He has been in this business for 10 years and has loyal customers in his neighborhood.

Richard is a young man and he doesn't have any children.  For this reason, he has a better ability to invest in his business and grow it more quickly.

Richard would like to invest the loan he has requested from Fundación Paraguaya in buying dairy products, soda, meat and other products to sell in his business.

Richard is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support they have provided which will give him the opportunity he needs to provide his business with another boost and make his story known to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, soda, meat and other products

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 25-year-old married man with one child, living in a rented house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the tailoring business for eight years. Before that he previously dealt in the transport business with a bicycle, then later with a motorcycle. He then shifted to cattle selling, after which he switched to tailoring. His hardship is bad debtors and his vision is buying more tailoring machines. Emmanuel needs the loan to buy clothing to make clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy clothing for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Eralda Amariles

texts.es:
Eralda Amariles tiene 53 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C DIVINO NIÑO, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, está constituida por 10 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maíz y plátano, además se dedican a la comercialización de granos secos.


eralda Amariles se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maíz, plátano, soya y yuca, además se dedica a la crianza de aves. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar un aumentar las ventas.

Le gusta ser una persona alegre, le gusta decansar y festejar las fiestas de carnaval.
texts.en:
Eralda Amariles, 53, is married and lives with her husband and children.  She lives in the Recinto El Progreso, which belongs to the canton of Chillanes.

The members of the rural communal bank "Divino Nino" live 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  The group has 10 members, and this is the third loan that they have requested.  The members of this communal bank are farmers who cultivate cocoa, corn and bananas, and they also sell dried grains.

Eralda Amariles works in agriculture farming cocoa, corn, bananas, soybeans and cassava.  She also raises poultry.  She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and she sells her products in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

This loan will help her to buy supplies such as fertilizer.  The loans have helped her to increase the production on her fields.  She has confronted challenges such as illnesses that have affected her workers, and diseases and pests that have affected her crops.  Her dream is to increase her sales. 

She likes to be a happy person; she enjoys the holidays when she can rest and join in the festivities.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe, 61, lives in the Philippines and is widowed with two children. She has a retail shop where she sells snacks, beverages and canned goods, a business she has had for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Fe is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a soft drink retail business in the Philippines.

Paulita has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Paulita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina de 31años de edad, convive con Iván  de 29 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari.
Martina Tiene un restaurante que esta en funcionamiento hace 5 años aproximadamente.; este negocio no lo hace sola tiene un cocinero y un ayudante de cocina, y su pareja quien lo apoya.
Le gusta porque no es un trabajo pesado y  que solo  necesita dedicación y estar al pendiente  para que sus comidas este al agrado de sus clientes; no le gusta porque  tiene que sacrificar los días feriados; porque el restaurante siempre tiene que estar al servicio de sus clientes así no vengan todos.
Martina lo considera rentable su restaurante porque gracias al pequeño negocio que tiene hizo algunos arreglos de su casa, aparte de ello su esposo, sus hijos y ella se alimentan en el. los problemas que le aquejan a Martina es el agua que viene solo por horas y este pequeño problema retarda la preparación de los alimentos, y el costo elevado de las verduras y demás productos.Martina necesita  el crédito para hacer compras al por mayor de productos para su restaurante, también  para hacer algunos cambios para que su restaurante se vea mas atractivo.Los planes que tiene Martina para el futuro son: que su restaurante sea uno de los mejores del lugar, abrir una sucursal más.Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete una vez mas ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.Con los 2000 nuevos soles ella adquirirá productos para preparar los ricos platos que ofrecerá.Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que ella ratifica su compromiso el de cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.Martina es la persona responsable en su banco comunal.	
Con los 2000 nuevos soles ella adquirirá productos para preparar los ricos platos que ofrecerá.
texts.en:
Martina, 31, lives with Ivan, 29, and they have 4 children.  They live in their own home, located in the Pichari district.  

Martina has a restaurant that has been in business for about 5 years.  She does not run the business by herself; she has the help of a cook and a kitchen assistant, and the support of her partner.

She likes it because it is not heavy work; it requires only her dedication and constant attention to ensure that the meals are to the liking of her customers.  What she doesn't like about her work is having to sacrifice on the festival days, because the restaurant always has to be open for service to her customers so they do not go elsewhere.  Martina finds the business profitable.  Thanks to her small restaurant she has made some repairs to her house, and she and her family also eat there.  The problems that Martina has to deal with include the water, which is only available during certain hours and delays the preparation of her food, and the high cost of vegetables and other products.  Martina needs this loan to buy products for her restaurant at wholesale.  In addition, she will use the loan to make some changes to her restaurant to make it more attractive.  In the future, Martina plans to make her restaurant one of the best in the area, and to open a restaurant in another location.  This is her 2nd loan with MFP, and so she is committed once again to make her payments on time.  With the 2,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy products to make the delicious dishes that she offers.  This is her second loan with MFP, and she affirms her pledge to make her payments on time.  Martina is a responsible person in her communal bank.  

With the 2,000 Peruvian soles requested, she will buy products to prepare the delicious dishes that she will offer in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy products to prepare the delicious dishes that she will offer

loans.name: Orlando Felipe

texts.es:
Don Orlando tiene su propio negocio, una pulperia en su casa de habitacion con un año trabajandola. Anteriormente trabajaba como guarda de seguridad, lo que con su liquidacion, logra comenzar con su ventas, su esposa esta trabajando tambien como conserje, para lograr cubrir gastos del hogar y poder salir adelante con su negocio, introduciendo mas productos.
Don Orlando ha hecho mejora  a su vivienda, mediante el financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en ocho ciclos, todos para mejoras de su casa, con el credito anterior logro poner el piso, y hoy con este nuevo prestamo, sera para introducir mas inventarios de productos a su pulperia en la compra de granos basicos, gaseosas, golosinas, caja de javon de lavar ropa, lavar traste, de baño, vidones de aceite, entre otros productos.
Esta contento por que ha dado un giro diferente a su vida, un mejor ingreso, lo que beneficias a sus hijos. Asi como tambien cuida su casa y ve por sus hijos.
texts.en:
Don Orlando runs his own grocery store set up in his home and has been in business for a year.  Previously he worked as a security guard but with his severance pay was able to set up the store.  His wife works as a concierge to help cover household expenses.  His aim is to grow his business and introduce new products.

Orlando has made home improvements with loans through Afodenic over a period of eight cycles.  With his last loan he was able to put down floor covering.  This new loan will be used to introduce more products into his grocery inventory such as basic grains, softdrinks, sweets, detergents, cleaning products, oil, etc.

He is content because he has been able to turn his life around and increase his income, which benefits his children.  This enables him to care for his house and for his family.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, sweets, softdrinks and other items requested by customers.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas is 36 years old. She lives with her family in Prey Chor District, Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is married and has three children. 

Currently, she is actively involved in the family agricultural business, but she has encountered financial shortages in meeting their family expenses and business needs.

To solve this problem, his husband would like to purchase one more horse for transporting goods, but he lacks capital, so he has asked her to apply for a loan through HKL, a Kiva partner. 

She believes that this loan will benefit her family and bring them happiness. 

She hopes in the future to educate her children to a high level and to have a bigger house. She is very thankful to all the kind lenders that always help her family.

loans.use: to purchase a horse for transporting goods.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein, a borrower from Iraq, is 53 years old, married, and a father of four children, two of whom work. In 2005, he opened a workshop for car and air conditioning repair and installation. Having worked in this field for more than 15 years, he is well-experienced and enjoys a good reputation in the area.

Now requesting a $2000 loan in order to add more inventory and purchase new tools and materials for his business, Hussein is aiming to gain more profit in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to add more inventory and to purchase new tools and materials for his business.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Carmelina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 15 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and rice for resale.

Carmelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Carmelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and rice for resale.

loans.name: Alodokpo Sozin Elise

texts.fr: Alodokpo Sozin Elise est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Bienvenu. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Alodokpo Sozin Elise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Alodokpo Sozin Elise n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais a appris la coiffure, une activité qu’elle exerce depuis douze ans et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. A côté de cette activité, Alodokpo Sozin Elise vend des mèches et des produits de cheveux dans son atelier. Alodokpo Sozin Elise s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Alodokpo Sozin Elise sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à rehausser le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Alodokpo Sozin Elise a bien effectué le remboursement des deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé.
texts.en: Alodokpo Sozin Elise is thirty-two years old and is married to a driver named Bienvenu. The couple has four children, some of whom are in school. Alodokpo Sozin Elise lives together with her husband and children. The couple provides for the various needs of their family. Alodokpo Sozin Elise didn't attend school but learned hairdressing, an occupation that she has practiced for twelve years and that brings her considerable income. Aside from this occupation, Alodokpo Sozin Elise sells hair extensions and other hair products in her shop. Alodokpo Sozin Elise stocks up in one of Benin's markets. This is the third time that Alodokpo Sozin Elise is asking for a loan from Alidé, a loan which will help her to raise the level of her activity in order to better respond to the demands of her clients. Alodokpo Sozin Elise completed the reimbursement of the two loans that she received from Alidé.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and hair products.

loans.name: Ludiya

texts.en:
Ludiya is 33 year old and married wirh four children, none of them in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei South Sudan for four years.
Ludiya requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme célibataire, sans enfants.Elle vend des produits de beauté .Elle s'approvisionne dans les grands magasins de la capitale et place les produits auprès de ses clients qui paient au bout de deux à trois mois.Cette activité lui rapporte des bénéfices assez importants.Elle se prend en charge et s'occupe aussi de la scolarité de ses quatre petits frères.Elle sollicite un prêt de 300000f auprès de l'UIMCEC pour acheter du lait de beauté, des parfum, des mèches et d'autres produits divers.Son ambition est de s'implanter en centre ville en y ouvrant sa propre boutique.
texts.en:
Aby is unmarried and without children. She sells beauty products. She gets her supplies from large stores in the capital, and sells them to her customers, who pay her after two or three months.

This business turns a rather high profit. She provides for herself and takes care of the school expenses of her four little brothers.

She's seeking a loan of XOF 300'000 from Kiva's partner, UIMCEC, in order to buy beauty milk, perfumes, hair extensions, and various other products.

Her ambition is to open her own shop downtown.

loans.use: to buy beauty milk, perfumes, hair extensions, and various other products

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en:
Nafisa lives in Changamwe, Kenya and owns a salon business which has been in operation for one year. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is also employed elsewhere.
Nafisa learned of Milango from a friend and decided to join in order to access credit. She is applying for a loan of Ksh 100,000 to purchase cosmetics and salon machines e.g. blow dryer. 
Nafisa believes the income from this loan will improve the standard of living of her family while her future plans include opening other salon branches to increase sales.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and salon machines e.g. blow dryer

loans.name: Maungu Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Maungu Group in Western Kenya! Gentrix is the facilitator of the Maungu group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Gentrix takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Gentrix had a good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Gentrix was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Gentrix and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Gentrix will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Maungu group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Gentrix with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Rodel has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Rodel has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rodel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Illumine

texts.en:
Illumine is 36 years old and is married with five children aged between five and 15 years old. Illumine sells soft drinks and local drinks such as water and Fanta. Her business is well organized. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. and has had her business for three years.

Illumine has requested a loan from Kiva field partner Vision Finance Company in order to buy more water, Fanta, and other beverages for her business. With any additional profit she realizes as a result of this loan, she plans to reinvest in her business and save for her future.  She hopes that one days she can buy a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and local drinks for resale

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is from the village of Sinian Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Elsa is married and has two adult-aged children.

Elsa operates a specialized retail store to earn a living. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over six years and the business runs smoothly. She earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month for these activities.

Elsa's last loan allowed her to purchase additional inventory and have working capital. Her business retail store is successful, now she is taking a new loan for 12,000 PHP to buy supplementary grocery goods to sell.

In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dababougou Benkadi 8 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Dababougou Benkadi 8 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Soké, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  BATOU, debout au milieu   sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et des semences pour exploiter  0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Dababougou Benkadi 8" are married women averaging 33 years of age and four children each all living in traditional families in Soké, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with BATOU, standing in the middle in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds to make use of 0.5 hectare.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 80,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and some seeds

loans.name: Yenessy Xiomara

texts.es:
Yenessy es una joven de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Yenessy se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.

Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Yenessy trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de calzado, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.

Yenessy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar la mayor cantidad de mercadería, como zapatillas, sandalias, tacones y otros, de esta manera Yenessy podrá abastecer mejor su negocio, asi atenderà a mas cliente y aumentará sus ingresos econòmicos, los cuales le serviràn de mucho para poder ampliar su negocio y en un fututo n muy lejano desea tener un puesto de ventas en un mercado de su ciudad, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional y una mujer de bien.
texts.en:
Yenessy, 20, is single and lives in the city of Pisco with her parents and siblings. She is a very kind, enthusiastic and hard-working person, who strongly desires success. Thanks to the support of her parents, Yenessy is study for a degree in Business Administration. In her free time she likes to do sport and occasionally cooks a delicious meal of chicken and rice to share with her family.

On her own initiative and thanks to the support of her parents, Yenessy runs a small business that sells shoes and similar items for ladies, men and children. She works from the early hours every day for approximately 10 hours, she enjoys working and believes that it is going well because of the good prices and kind service that she offers to her customers.

Yenessy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as it is thanks to their help that she has been able to purchase the majority of her merchandise, such as shoes, sandals, dress shoes and others. This will help Yenessy to have a well-stocked business and be able to better meet her customer's needs. This allows her to keep working hard to achieve her dream of being a good professional businesswoman and well-off.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Kakuu

texts.en: Kakuu is a member of Osotua women group a community based organization that encourages women to start up income generating activities. The group runs a group revolving fund and it has a bank account where members keep their savings. She is 42 years old, married and they have five children. She has been in business since 1984 and she been selling milk in Isinya Town for years. Since then, she is ever on the move finding opportunities to improve her life. She started raising steers in 2002 and the business was doing very well until 2005 when the whole area was almost destroyed by a prolonged drought. The climate since March this year favors farmers and life is back to normal in Maasai land. Kakuu now has three steers in different age groups and she will sell one at a time. She wants to keep six steers and at the end of six months, two will be ready for sell and this will give her good income to pay school fees for her children and to cover other necessities.

loans.use: She would like to buy six steers.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese is a young, talented woman and she’s from the village of Levi Saleimoa.  She’s forty one (41) years of age and married to a forty two (42) year old man from Tuanai.  They have six children, all raised at Levi Saleimoa.  Akenese’s family depends primarily on their fishing business that is jointly managed by both wife and husband. This additional loan will help improve their business by having more than one canoe with nets for running the business.

loans.use: Purchase additional fishing nets and a canoe with outrigger

loans.name: Lemalie

texts.en: Lemalie V. is a 33-year-old woman from the village of Seesee, and is married with six children.  She likes cooking Samoan food -- like taro, banana, yam and fish mixed with coconut cream -- in a Samoan oven. Her stall is open on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Saturdays. This income greatly assists in paying for her children's education and making her weekly repayments at the center's meeting. She is now ready for a second loan so she can increase her output of food and improve her income and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and materials for making food

loans.name: Fulgencia

texts.es:
Fulgencia is 62 years old and has 10 sons and daughters. As a child, she learned how to make bedding with typical handmade fabrics of the Carapeguá area, especially since many women learn this trade from generation to generation in this city. They create these remarkable handicrafts that are highly valued in the local market and by tourists who are left marveled with their work. After getting married, Fulgencia continued making bedding while her husband sold them. However, it's been 5 years since her husband became bedridden due to a disease and she has had to support her household alone, with the help of two daughters who assist her in making the products. Nowadays, she supplies for large stores dedicated to selling handicrafts. Fulgencia would like to buy a loom and threads, using the loan she is applying for so that her eldest daughter can knit with her. At the moment Fulgencia has only one loom and since there is a growing demand for her products, she needs to increase her production. Fulgencia plans to increase her income this way and thus be able to help her husband through his sickness and give a better education to their two daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Fulgencia tiene 62 años es casada y tiene 10 hijos.
