Desde pequeña aprendió el oficio de hacer colchas con los telares caseros característicos de la zona de Carapeguá, ya que en esta ciudad existen muchas mujeres que adquieren el oficio generación tras generación y que se dedican a la elaboración de esta maravillosa artesanía que es bastante cotizada en el mercado local y por los extranjeros que visitan el país quedando maravillados con esta labor. Luego de casarse, ellav siguió dedicandose a la fabricación de las colchas mientras que el marido salía a venderlas. Sin embargo desde hace ya 5 años el marido está en cama por una enfermedad que lo aqueja, por lo que ella enfrenta a la vida sola con dos hijas que la ayudan en el oficio. Hoy día ella es proveedora de grandes tiendas que se dedican a la venta de artesanías. El crédito lo quiere utilizar para la compra de un telar e hilos para que su hija mayor teja a la par que ella, pues por el momento, cuentan con solo una, y como la demanda ha aumentado necesitan aumentar su producción. De esta manera ella planea aumentar sus ingresos para sobrellevar la enfermedad del marido y darle una educación a sus dos hijas.

loans.use: Compra de un telar e hilos

loans.name: Ermin Antonio

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Ermin and my main occupation is my small grocery store, which I run from a room in my home. I have had this business for several years now and it generates enough income to cover my family's living expenses and other obligations. It has also allowed me to help out my siblings since my parents separated.

I need this loan to purchase additional inventory in order to offer a better selection to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Ermin, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitación, llamada Pulperia "ERMIN", tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera utilidades para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos, gracias a este negocio puedo ayudar a mis hermanos ya que mis padres se separaron. Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a mis clientes.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, lard, beans, soap, dairy products, sausages and flour

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita, 23 years old, is married, with three children.  Her husband works as driver of heavy trucks. The children go to the public school of the township, except the youngest that is just one year old.  To help her husband face the family’s needs, María plans to sell clothes.  She thinks that the holiday season is the suitable moment to begin the business.  With the loan requested, she’ll wholesale purchase clothes in Santo Domingo and Dajabón, a frontier city with Haiti where garments are very cheap.  She also plans o buy a stall so that she can easily show the clothes to the customers.  The entrepreneur hopes she’ll get quickly the loan to begin the activity which will change her family life.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in order to start her business.

loans.name: Shakhsuvar

texts.en: Shakhsuvar Q.  is a 65-year-old farmer who raises vegetables in the southern region of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar.  He is internally displaced person from occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. He is married and has six children; three sons and three daughters. He started raising vegetables in 1992. Every year he sells his crop in the local bazaar and to the local people. His garden is very big but during these fourteen years the land needed treatment and got drained. And every year it is getting harder to raise a good quality crop. Shakhsuvar is going to improve his land and start raising such vegetables as potatoes, tomatoes,  peppers and onions. For this purpose Shakshsuvar has  applied for 800 USD with a repayment term of 15 months. He will spend this money to purchase fertilizer and to  buy seeds for the vegetable he wants to grow.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Khurshida

texts.en: “I live in a three-room house with my husband and nine children in a small town called Vehari, about four hours away from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Most of our children are small. My husband makes special bed sheets with his hand loom. These sheets are semi-thick and good for spring and fall season. However, his hand loom is old and needs refurbishing. He requires a loan to fix his hand loom and purchase spare parts along with some thread. Since there is plenty of demand for our bed sheets, I am confident that he will make a profit.”

loans.use: Repair hand loom used for making special bed sheets

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicholas B. is a widowed man at the age of 37 and lives with his two children.  He has been the head of a mechanic shop for six years.  After saving a little money from his previous job, he was able to open his own shop.  Nicholas received his first job working with his uncle in the mechanic shop right out of school.  His uncle had offered to pay his tuition for school if he promised to work for him after graduating.  
After the death of his wife, Nicholas let the business slip as he went into a depression.  But he realized that he had to continue fighting to make enough money to support his children.  It is now stronger and more profitable than ever.  It was his wife’s dream to see their children growing up and becoming professionals in whichever field they choose to study. 
Nicholas is asking for a loan today to buy oil and air filters, brake fluid, motor oil, carburetors, light bulbs, and other various car parts.

loans.use: To buy oil and air filters, brake fluid, motor oil, carburetors, and other various car parts for his shop.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
A few years ago, Jorge became unemployed after working as a workman in the 'franca' zone. Having to feed two kids, he decided to start doing something well-paid so that he could pay the household costs, so 9 months ago he started to sell small bags of bread, sweet bread and toasted bread to grocery stores, all-purpose stores and certain houses. Every morning he buys bread in the main market, and then goes to sell it to his clients that rely on him. His wife supports him by selling soft drinks from home, all so that they can make it through and give their kids a good life. He requires a loan to buy a motor to fit it to his bike, as this is the mode of transport he uses to sell the bread.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Jorge hace algunos años quedó sin empleo, trabajaba de operario en una zona franca. Teniendo que alimentar a sus 2 hijos, opta por emprender una actividad que le fuera rentable y con la cual pudiera pagar los gastos del hogar y es desde hace 9 meses que se ha dedicado a distribuir bolsas de pan simple, pan dulce y pan tostado a pulperías, misceláneas y casas particulares. Todas las mañanas compra el pan en el mercado mayoreo y posteriormente sale a venderlo a sus clientes fijos con los que cuenta Jorge. Su esposa lo apoya vendiendo refrescos en su vivienda, todo con el propósito de salir adelante y poder darles una vida cómoda a sus hijos. Requiere del préstamo para comprar un motor para instalarlo en su bicicleta que es su medio de transporte para vender el pan.

loans.use: To buy a motor to fit it to his bike / Comprar Motor para instalárselo a su bicicleta

loans.name: Taga 3 Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
For these 3 women of Taga 3 on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account, then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business's development and help guarantee on-time payments.

Gaualofa F., 59, is married with 8 children. She sells tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbages and other vegetables to the village people. With her loan, she will purchase 10 cabbages, 10 cucumbers, 10 tomatoes, 10 beans and chemicals.

Lauama A., 53, is married with 3 children. She sells taro and bananas, staples of the Samoan diet, 3 days a week to the village people. She needs chemicals, a weed-killing sprayer, a knife and a wheelbarrow to improve her business. Her family has been in the business for years. Her low prices, good quality and good location set her apart from the competition.

Matagi L., 37, is married with 6 children. She sells taro, taumu and bananas 3 days a week to the village people. She learned gardening from her parents. Her loan will permit her to purchase more materials to tend her garden.

loans.use: Purchase of a weed killing sprayer, wheelbarrow, etc.

loans.name: Sharifhon

texts.ru:
Sharifhon U. lives in Khuroson region. He is 51, married and has 4 children. Sharifhon has a technical education. He is a driver by training, and this is his career. Since his salary is low, Sharifhon, just like everyone else living in rural areas, raises cattle in his spare time. His children help him. The client buys young calves on a market, rears them and then resells them. This business provides him with a decent profit. 3 of Sharifhon's children are students, and his youngest son studies in school. Sharifhon supports his large family alone. Currently, the client wants to buy a new calf and feed. He plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Улугов Шарифхон житель района Хуросон. Ему 51 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее техническое. По специальности водитель,работает шофером. Так как заработная плата не очень высокая, да и к тому-же в сельской местности нельзя без этого, Шарифхон в свободное от работы время занимается животноводством. Помогают ему его дети. Клиент покупает на рынке бычков , откармливает их и перепродает. Это приносит ему небольшой доход. Трое детей Шарифхона студенты,а младший сын учится в средней школе. Шарифхон сам содержит такую большую семью. В данный момент клиент хочет купить очередного бычка и корм. Планирует погасить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a calf and feed

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Mrs. Rama K. is 38 years old and lives in the town of Sainbu-Bhaishapati. She owns two cows and makes a living selling milk door to door every morning and evening.

Mrs. K. lives in a single-family home with her husband, Mr. Madan K., who works in private office, and their two daughters. Her older daughter has left school and helps her mother with her business. Her younger daughter is sill in school, in grade seven.

Mrs. K. has applied for a loan of $450 to buy another cow because the demand for milk is increasing in her area.

loans.use: To buy another cow to produce more milk

loans.name: Annet Namayanja's Group

texts.en:
Annet is the leader of 4 members. She is 54 years old and divorced with 5 children. The children are 33, 28, 25, 23, and 19 years old. The youngest child is in school, while the 4 older children are past school age. The community she lives and works in is urban and is a slum within a low-lying area that floods in the rainy season.

Annet goes to the village to purchase and cut down maize and matoke (green, non-sweet bananas that are a main part of the diet in Uganda). She then roasts the maize and sells that and the matoke on the roadside. Her customers purchase small quantities, with the exception of a few who buy from her to sell to others.

Her main challenge is that she cannot work when it rains because she sells her goods at the side of the road rather than in a shop.

Annet plans to use this loan to buy more maize, as it is currently in season. Thus far, her loans have helped her pay school fees and feed her family. In addition, she has been able to buy a plot on which she hopes to one day build a house for her family.

Annet has successfully paid back 15 loans.

loans.use: To buy more maize

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An S. is a villager in Totoeng Thngai Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer. She is a 43-year-old widow with two children who are attending school. Her family members live in poor conditions because Mrs. An S. has only one business activity.

Therefore, Mrs. An S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. Previously, Mrs. An S. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizers for her field and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Adokaume

texts.fr: Née  le 30/12/1979 à Pénaré, S. Adokaume est célibataire sans enfant. Elle est vendeuse de petits beignets et de petits gâteaux. Malgré sa bonne volonté, elle n’arrive pas à faire décoller ses ventes fautes de moyens financiers. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour consolider son activité et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires. Son crédit lui servira à l’achat de la farine de blé et d’huile.
texts.en:
Born on December 30, 1979 in Pénaré, Adokaume S. is single and has no children. She sells donuts and little cakes. In spite of her good will, she can't manage to make her sales take off, because she lacks business capital. She is asking for this loan so that she can consolidate her business and raise her turnover. Her loan will be used to purchase flour and oil.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expanding sale of donuts and cakes

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea B. is 47 years old and lives with two of her children in Siem Reap, Cambodia. Since 1988, she and her husband, Khem Tun, 48, have worked together as fishermen and growing rice. On average, they make $3 each day. Two of their children also sometimes help them to fish.

To earn more, Chea has requested a loan of $1000 to breed pigs. This will allow the family to double their daily income. (Khem Tun is pictured outside his home.)

loans.use: To breed pigs

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 51 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives in Beirut and bakes "Manniesh" bread for local bakeries and street vendors to re-sell. Manniesh is a traditional type of Lebanese bread which is usually topped with Zaater- a thyme-like herb, and cheese or minced meat. It can be found in the hands of nearly every Lebanese for either breakfast or lunch. The tasty bread is almost always served warm, and Mohammed supplies locals with soft, fresh Manniesh every day.

Mohammed has asked Al Majmoua for a loan of 500 US Dollars in order to repair his bread oven and many of his aging tools. Mohammed is grateful for the opportunity provided to him by Kiva and Al Majmoua, and he is confident that this loan will enable him to sustain his business and continue to support his family.

loans.use: to repair Mohammed's bread oven and many of his tools

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia Es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco II que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua.
Aurelia es casada, tiene 60 años y 3 hijos, Aurelia es feriante y viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región de donde compra quesos, animales, que luego lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho, los animales los beneficia y vende de casa en casa.
Aurelia necesita un préstamo de 1100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos, carneros.
Los sueños de Aurelia son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of the Communal Bank “Ccori Concco II” which means Heart of Gold in Quechua. Aurelia is married, 60 years old, and has 3 children. She is a businesswoman who travels to different markets in the region where she buys cheeses and animals that she transports to Ayacucho city. She feeds the animals and sells them house to house. Aurelia needs a loan for 1100 soles to buy cheeses and sheep. Aurelia dreams of improving her business and of her children finishing their studies and becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chese and sheep

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Teresa A. G. tengo 35 años de edad y vivo en el barrio el chile de esta ciudad, es primera vez que solicito un credito, este mismo lo necesito para poder comprar mas lacteos ya que no cubro con las exigencias de mis clientes y mi producto se me termina rapido, los lacteos son mi actividad principal pero tambein vendo huevos y carnes, estos productos se venden pero con menor porcentaje, soy una persona luchadora y deseo salir adelante con mi negocio que es mi unica fuente de ingresos, con este negocio estoy sacando adelante a mis hijos. muchas gracias
texts.en:
Hi! My name is Teresa A. G.; I am 35 years old and I live in the "el chile" neighbourhood of this city. This is the first time that I have asked for a loan. I need the loan to buy more milk as I am not able to keep up with demand from my customers and my stock is running out. My main business is selling milk, but I also sell eggs and meat in smaller quantities. I am a fighter and I want to get ahead with my business as it is my only source of income. This business allows me to take care of my children. Thank you very much!

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Perlas de la Sabiduría 
Rosa es soltera  tiene 19 años, ha terminado de estudiar su quinto de segundaria, pero no puede seguir estudios superiores por falta de dinero, por ahora quiere ayudar económicamente  a su familia  
Rosa trabajaba en un jugueria en la cual tuvo problemas y  se queda sin trabajo   una amiga la animo a que venda productos de belleza por catalogo Avon desde entonces se dedica hace un año a la venta de productos por catalogo.

Rosa solicita un préstamo de  600 soles para invertirlos en comprar productos en oferta y tener un stock, para después venderlos a precio normal
En Finca ha aprendido administrar su dinero a saber cuando invertir, le gusta las charlas que recibe en su Banquito, esta contenta por se preocupan por ella  
Rosa nos cuenta que ha presentado dificultades en las ventas por que hay personas que no le han pagado pero lo ha podido súperar gracias a los ahorros que tenia.
Rosa tiene un sueño quiere ser gerente zonal de ventas por catalogo en  Avon en Tablada de Turín  y le gustaría estudia mas adelante cosmetología
texts.en:
Rose is a partner of the Communal Bank called Perlas de la Sabiduría. Rose is single and she is 19 years old. She finished the fifth year of secondary school, but she can't continue her studies for lack of money. For the time being she wants to help her family economically. Rose used to work in a toy shop where she had some problems and she was left without work. A fried encouraged her to sell "Avon" beauty products and she has been selling this products for a year. Rose is requesting a loan of 600 soles ($200) to invest in buying products on sale and be able to have a stock and later to sell them at a regular price. In Finca (Kiva's field partner), she he has learned to administer her money and to know when to invest it. She likes the seminars he gets from her bank. She is happy because they worry about her. She tells us that she has had some problems with the sales because there are some people who haven't paid her, but she has been able to overcome this thanks to the savings she had. Her dream is to become the area manager of the Avon catalogue sales in Tablada de Turin and she would like study cosmetology later.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products on sale to have a stock and later sell them at a regular price.

loans.name: Ildefonsa

texts.es: Ildefonsa tiene 59 años, es divorciada, vive en su propia casa construida de adobe, con sus dos hijos Víctor de 25 y Candy de 15. Ella es una trabajadora mujer que se dedica a la venta de verduras, frutas, y otros productos para sacar adelante a su familia, viene dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 35 años, en los cuales ha sacado mucho provecho de su trabajo y gracias a él puede ofrecerle a su familia vestimenta, educación, alimentación y velar por su salud. Ildefonsa es muy feliz en su negocio, debido a que se distrae mucho en el puesto que tiene en el mercado, compartiendo con sus vecinas y con la clientela a la cual convence fácilmente de adquirir su mercadería, su carisma y buen humor le facilitan el trabajo, pero lo que lamentablemente le resulta difícil es el traslado de su mercadería a su puesto porque requiere mucho esfuerzo físico. Este es octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, estando muy agradecida ya que gracias a estos créditos puede crecer en su negocio. Con la cantidad que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería en vegetales, frutas y demás para aumentar sus ventas, lograr mejores ingresos y forjarle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Ildefonsa is a 59-year-old divorcee who lives in her own adobe house with her two children—Victor, age 25, and Candy, age 15. She is a hard-working woman who sells fruits, vegetables, and other products for a living in order to help her family get ahead. She has been in business for 35 years, during which time she has taken greatly benefited from her job. Thanks to this business, she can provide her family with food, clothing, an education, and health. Ildefonsa is very happy with her business because she can amuse herself in her market stand, sharing with her neighbors and clientele, whom she easily persuades to purchase her produce. Her charisma and good humor facilitate her work, but sadly the most difficult aspect for her is transporting her goods to her stand because it requires a great deal of physical exertion. This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She is very grateful to the microfinance institute because thanks to those loans, her business has been able to grow. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase a greater quantity of fruits, vegetables, and other products so that she can boost sales, generate greater profits, and forge a better future for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. is currently in the business of selling goats and sheep and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Regina is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has four children, and her children go to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more goats and sheep for sale.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more goats and sheep for sale

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
La señora Shirley M. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Decididas”, vive en el Jr. Leguia cdra. 07, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 57 años y es madre 02 hijos, 01 que depende de ella.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, motivada por una amiga , se inició trabajando en su casa, en Tapicería  con la ayuda de  una maquina de coser. Tiene 01 año trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se  dedica al mismo negocio, con pedidos y con el préstamo de  S/1,500.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06 meses, piensa ampliar e implementar su negocio, con telas en rollos, hilos para  tapizados para muebles del hogar y vehículos motorizados.

Ella; toma las decisiones en los gastos y ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal,  se siente una Mujer independiente, decidida y más segura, responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y sabe tomar sus propias decisiones. 

Shirley, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Shirley M. G. is a member of Banco Comunal “Las Decididas.” She lives in the Tarapoto District in the department of San Martín. She is married, 57 years old, and has two children, one of whom still lives at home. Inspired by a friend and with an initial loan of 300 soles, she started working from her house, doing upholstery with the aid of a sewing machine. She's been working with the bank for one year. She is currently engaged in the same business. By receiving more orders and a loan of 1500 soles, which she will pay off in six months, she hopes to expand her business and purchase bolts of cloth and thread for upholstering household furniture and motor vehicles. She makes the decisions about her business's expenses and earnings. She is an independent woman, decisive and secure, responsible in making her payments, and she knows how to make her own decisions. Shirley expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for enabling her to grow as a business owner and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bolts of cloth and upholstery thread for her business

loans.name: Sanginoy

texts.ru: Хакбердиева Сангиной проживает в Варзобском районе. Одна растит 11 детей. Муж умер и уже 10 лет она занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота. Имеет хозяйство у себя дома , где и откармливает скот. После откормки выводит животных на рынок для продажи. Бизнес дает доход, которого ей хватает только на питание , поэтому она решила увеличить поголовье скота , путе получения кредита.
texts.en:
Sanginoy H. lives in the Varzob area. She raises 11 children by herself. Her husband died and for 10 years now she has been raising large livestock. She has a plot at her home where she fattens livestock. After fattening the livestock she takes it to the market to sell. The business provides her with income that is only enough for food, which is why she has decided to increase her livestock headcount via a loan. She will be able to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
LUCINDA C. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Productivas”, su número de teléfono es 574454, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Walter S/N Mz. B Lt.34, cerca al “Aserradero Ezcurra”, en el AA.HH. Santa Clara, en el distrito de Manantay, tiene 55 años de edad, trabaja vendiendo plátano en las afueras de su domicilio, su esposo trabaja como enfermero en Santa Carmela de Mashangay, 3 horas río arriba y tienen 4 hijos.

Ella tiene 1 año trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para invertir en su chacra, ubicada en el lugar donde trabaja su esposo. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,800. Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en despejar sus 5 hectáreas que conforman su  chacra, para luego cultivar y vender plátano, naranja y zapote (frutas de la región).

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la apoya con créditos financieros, que permiten hacer trabajar sus 5 hectáreas que conforman su chacra, permitiéndola solventar gastos en su familia.
texts.en:
Lucinda C. R. is a member of the Community Bank “Mujeres Productivas (Productive Women)”, her phone number is 574454. She lives in Jr. Walter S/N Mz. B Lt.34, near “Aserradero Ezcurra”, in Santa Clara neighborhood, in the district of Manantay. She is 55 years old. She works selling bananas, in the suburbs of ther neighborhood. Her husband works as a nurse in Santa Carmela de Mashangay, 3 hours up the river and they have 4 children. She’s been working with Manuela Ramos for a year. She obtained a previous loan of 300 New Soles, which she used to invest on a small farm, located at the facilities where her husband works. With this loan of 1.800 New Soles she will clean the 5 acres of her farm, to later on grow bananas, oranges and zapote (local fruit). She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos, because the bank is supports her financial loans, which allows her to work on the 5 acres of her farm, which helps her cover her family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain her farm to grow fruit

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela  es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Adela es separada, tiene 53 años, dos hijos de 26 y 23 años, que estudian y trabajan.
Adela trabajo como secretaria en una empresa hasta que esta quebró, y se  puso a estudiar corte y confección, empezó a coser en su casa pero lo dejo por que no era tan rentable, empezó a compra ropa hecha, actualmente vende ropa por pedidos también vende perfumes.  
Adela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de perfumes, de diferentes marcas.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a valorizar el negocio, a ahorrar, a no gastar un sol de mas.   
El sueño de Adela es tener un bazar.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women Communal Bank). Adela is separated, 53 years old, and has two children ages 26 and 23 who study and work.

Adela worked as a secretary in a business until it went bankrupt, and she put herself to studying dressmaking. She started to sew in her house but she quit because it was not so profitable, and she started to purchase clothes. She now sells clothes on order as well as perfumes.

Adela needs a loan of 1000 PEN to purchase perfumes of different brands. Since she has been in the program she has learned how to increase the value of her business, to save, and to not spend a sol (PEN) more than necessary. Adela’s dream is to own a bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perfumes of different brands

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de  55 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos y posee estudios de primaria incompleta (2do grado). Vive en el Barrio Desaguadero.
Trabaja hace tiempo luego se retiro y volvió hace 04 meses, con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos descanso un año, por motivos de viaje, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos  soles. Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes.
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, comprará harina, conservas, arroz, quaker, aceite, leche, fideos, mazamorras, gelatinas. Ella desea construir su casa.
Su deseo es poder surtir mejor su tienda, y distribuir al por mayor.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad, agradece a Manuela Ramos por permitirles sacar adelante su negocio
texts.en:
Sra. Teodora is a member of the Las Fronterizas community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno. She is 55 years old and married with 5 children. She left school in the 2nd grade. She lives in the Desaguadero neighborhood. She worked a while back, then retired and, 4 months ago, after a year off and away, she returned to the Manuela Ramos movement. Her first loan was for S/.300 (300 soles). She operates a grocery business. With this S/.500 loan, she will buy flour, preserves, rice, oatmeal, cooking oil, milk, pasta and other products for resale. She wants to build a house. Her hope is that she can better stock her store and sell wholesale supplies of goods. She's grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to move her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Madaraka

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Madaraka M. from Mwanza. She is married with four children, between the ages of 19 and 24 years old. Madaraka has been running a shop since 2008, selling sodas, salt, and sugar. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by one employee.

Madaraka currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase rice, soda, sugar, and beans. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Madaraka thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice, soda, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda E. is 24 years old. She is married with one kid. She realized the need to support her family with additional income, so she decided to start a trade. She has been selling vegetable cooking oil like palm oil, palm kernel oil, etc. for two years. She obtains her supply of cooking oil from wholesalers and retails them to her customers who are mostly households, food vendors, etc.  She wants to use her loan to buy oil in bulk to cater to the demands of her customers. Linda wants to use the proceeds from her operation to support her only child in school.

loans.use: To buy vegetable oil in bulk

loans.name: Yesu Ne Me Kanea Group

texts.en:
Francis is fifty years old. He is married and has three children. He is a trader and deals in jewels.

Francis is the leader of a trust bank group called “Yesu ne me Kanea” which literally means “Jesus is my Light”. They are a group of thirteen members but only two showed up at the meeting.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well.

The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses. It is the heart’s desire of the group members to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Jose Samuel

texts.es: El señor José Samuel C. C., tiene la edad de 43 años, habita en La concepción, junto a su esposa, la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar, ellos tiene cuatro hijos ya todos independientes, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, don José desde hace 21 años se dedica a la agricultura y a hacer trabajo de ebanista para poder dar el sustento a su familia, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es el robo de producción , él inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo .Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos  para aplicar al cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
José Samuel C. C. is 43. He lives in La Concepción with his wife. She supports him with the household activities. They have four independent children. The family plan is to improve their living conditions. For 21 years José has worked as a farmer and a cabinet maker to be able to support his family. The greatest difficulty he has is theft of his products. He started this activity with help from his parents. His future plan is to diversify his crops. The loan is to buy fertilizers and supplies to apply to his crops to be able to obtain a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers to improve his crops

loans.name: Musa's Group

texts.en:
G. Musa is the leader of his lending group in Kayunga and is married with six children aged 16 – 2 years. He has had a business tailoring and selling clothes in Kavule for twenty-nine years. He deals in finished (ready-made clothes) and unfinished clothes (those he makes himself), and in a week, he is able to make 40,000/= as profits.

Musa has a business policy of having customer-friendly prices so that he will be able to sell more. His plan is to turn his business into a tailoring school and improve on the quality of his family life by educating his children and training them in his trade.

Musa needs a loan to be able to buy new materials for the business so as to boost the business more. He is a hard working and friendly man and this has brought him reliable customers.

loans.use: To buy new clothing materials for his business

loans.name: Radjabali

texts.ru: Раджабали Мирзоалиев проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 49 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Раджабали сам бизнесмен. Он более 10 лет занимается торговлей у себя в магазине. В основном торгует хозяйственными товарами. Его жена домохозяйка. Ему также помогают его дети. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Radjabali M. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 49 years old, married and has 5 children. Radjabali is a businessman. He has been involved in retail sales for over 10 years at his store. He mainly sells household goods. His wife is a homemaker. His children also help him. Radjabali is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasun que significa Trabajemos.
Soledad es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Soledad se dedica a la elaboración de tortas, bocaditos, decoraciones de locales para diferentes eventos, tiene una tienda de exhibiciones.
Soledad necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas para decoración.
Los sueños de Soledad son ampliar su negocio y tener una empresa, tener casa propia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de telas para decoración.

loans.name: Willma

texts.es:
Willma  vive junto a su pequeña hija la cual esta aun en escuela primaria. Por circunstancias de la vida se quedo como madre y padre de la pequeña; ocupa una habitación en la vivienda de sus padres ubicada en la calle José Antonio Arce  de la zona Puerto Mejillones en la ciudad de El Alto.
Se dedica a la venta de comestibles y abarrotes en la feria que se encuentra ubicada en su zona.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de Mercadería,  aumentando su stock de comestibles y abarrotes  para una mejor venta en la feria de su zona y así poder incrementar sus ingresos familiares.

Es el primer  crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada  califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Willma.

loans.use: Compra de más productos comestibles y abarrotes para su venta en la feria de la ciudad de El Alto.

loans.name: Benik

texts.en:
Benik T. is 49 years old. He lives in Ddmashen villige, near Sevan. Benik is married and has three sons. Two of them live and study in Russia, while the third one studies in the Yerevan Police Academy. 

Benik works as electrician. Benik and his wife have also been engaged in farm work for about 15 years. They have cows, sheep, pigs and hens, which they keep on their own land. Benik needs 500,000 Armenian dram loan to buy fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy a fodder for farm animals

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap K. is a villager in Chuos village in Takeo province. She has four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

Mrs. Sopheap K. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. She also raises pigs. Since raising pigs is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fifteen piglets to raise and pig food.

loans.use: To buy fifteen piglets and pig food

loans.name: Zagdzesem

texts.en:
Zagdzesem is 44 years old and lives with his wife and five children in the Uvurkhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All of his children, ages 18 to 9, attend a local secondary school while Zagdzesem operates a café and welding business with the help of his wife. His wife is the café cook and manager while Zagdzesem is responsible for the welding business. They used to sell meals door-to-door, but as they grew successful, they were able to purchase a shipping container where they now make their meals and sell them. In order to supplement their income, Zagdzesem also builds homes in the summer months. The family also has approximately 50 heads of livestock which they care for and use. He says, “My wife and I work hard to grow our businesses in order to be able to afford our children’s education.” Zagdzesem is requesting a 250,000 tugrug (~170 USD) loan in order to purchase food for their growing café business.

About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

loans.use: To purchase food for their growing café

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es:
Llerme H. es una socia emprendedora y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 41 años, es madre de tres hijos mayores de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es electricista.
Llerme forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace nueve años y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una socia muy puntual. 
Ella cuenta con una bodega de abarrotes que funciona en su casa y nos comenta que con el primer crédito que recibió que fue de 300.00 soles comprò gaseosas para venderlas en la vereda de su casa.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 1200.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de productos comestibles para su negocio.
La meta de Llerme es tener una tienda con todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad y seguir trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
LLerme H. is an enterprising member and a team player. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali Region. She's 41, the mother of three grown children, and enjoys the support of her husband, an electrician. She has been a member of the "Las Nazarenas" Village Bank for nine years, and has always been known for being very precise. Llerme runs a grocery store in her house. She tells us that her first loan was for 300 soles, and she used it to buy soft drinks to sell from the sidewalk outside her house. She needs a loan now for 1200 soles, which she plans to use to buy food items for her business. Llerme's goal is to have a store with all kinds of staple products, and to continue getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She'll use her loan to stock her store with food products.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina C. L., de 45 años de edad es casada, con dos hijos.  Ella tiene un venta de consumo diario dentro del mercado municipal.  Ella vende golosina, papel higiénico, gaseosas, chicles, cereales, etc.  Ella vende  los días, domingos, martes, y jueves. 
 
Ya está contenta ya que antes, tenía cosas, pero pocas.  Con la ayuda de FAPE, ella surtió su tienda y colocó cosas o cereales que la gente le pedía.  Hoy en día, las puede comprar y vender.  Antes, no lo podía porque le faltaba dinero.  Ella solicita este préstamo par utilizar para comprar más consumos diarios, también ropa típica para vender.  

Mantiene a sus hijos ya que están en la edad escolar.  Su esposo es barbero, y ella les ayuda también.  Su sueño es tener un deposito para poder vender a lo grande.
texts.en:
Paulina C. L., 45 years old, is married with two children. She has a stall selling goods for daily consumption in the municipal market. She sells candy, toilet paper, carbonated drinks, chewing gum, grains, etc. Her stall is open on Sundays, Tuesdays and Thursdays. She is happy because before, she had things, but very little. With the help of FAPE, she supplied her shop and invested in items or grains that people had requested. Today, she is able to buy and sell them. Before, she couldn't because she didn't have enough money. She is requesting this loan so she can use it to purchase more basic consumables as well as traditional clothing to sell. She supports her children, who are still schoolaged. Her husband is a barber, and she helps him too. Her dream is to have a store to be able to sell on a large scale.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase traditional clothes and basic consumables for a shop.

loans.name: Annagi

texts.en:
Annagi J. is 22 but he has kept his business since he was 18. He rents a place where he sells building and repair materials. He is continuing the business of his father. Annagi started to help his father when he was 16 and since that time, he gained enough experience to run this business alone now. 

Annagi requested 1,600 Azerbaijani New Manat  to increase the number of items he sells. Annagi's dream is to build his own shop one day.

loans.use: Purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Marlene del Socorro Rosas, cuenta con 44 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 16 años el cual ya está cursando los estudios secundarios, tiene 20 Años de estar trabajando en este negocio, con la institución trabaja desde el año 2004, en todo este período se la han otorgado la cantidad de 13 créditos, los créditos otorgados a demás de abastecer el negocio, le han servido para mejorar su puesto de trabajo como su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marlene del Socorro R.is 44 years old and has a 16 year old son who is in high school. She has worked for the past 20 years in this business (cooking and selling food) and has worked with this microfinance institution since 2004. During this time, she has been given 13 separate loans in order to supply her business; these loans have helped her to improve her business as well as her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to improve locale (zinc, etc.) and merchandise for the business (corn, kindling, whitewash, gas, bags, etc.)

loans.name: Alodia

texts.es: Alodia, es una mujer muy puntual, vive en el Distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene  38 años, es madre de cinco hijos, dos son dependientes, ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos de motores, esta actividad la realiza en su puesto que tiene en el puerto, cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja que se desempeña como mecánico. Alodia forma parte del Banco Comunal “El Fruto Bendito”, desde hace 2 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de comida, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será invertido en la compra de repuestos y colas de motores fuera de borda. La meta de Alodia es seguir trabajando para ampliar su negocio de compra y venta de motores.
texts.en:
Alodia is a very punctual woman who lives in the District of Manantay, Ucayali Region. She is 38 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are dependents. Alodia sells engine parts from her business that she manages on the port. She has the support of her partner who works as a mechanic.

Alodia joined the Communal Bank “El Fruto Bendito” (The Blessed Fruit) two years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to sell food. She now needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy parts and propellers for outboard motors. Her goal is to continue working by expanding her business through buying and selling motors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts & propellers for outboard motors

loans.name: Federico's Group

texts.en:
Federico B. is from the village of Gappal, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is fifty-one years old. Federico is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Federico is married and has five grown children. To make a living, Federico owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Federico has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP every four months through his business. 

In 2006, Federico joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Federico is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be Federico's ninth loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Holmahmad

texts.ru: Саидов Холмахмад проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена, домохазяйка. Сам Холмахмад имеет среднее образование. Зарабатывает путем разведения скота. Он создал все условия для продвижения своего бизнеса. Покупает молодых бычков, откармливает и продает на рынке по более выгодной цене. В этой области более 5 лет. Кроме того занимается строительными работами по найму. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Holmahmad S. lives in the Yavan district. He is 36 years old, married and has 6 children. His wife is a homemaker. Holmahmad has a secondary education and earns a living by breeding livestock. He created all of the necessary conditions for moving his business forward. He buys young bulls, fattens and resells them at the market at a more profitable price. Holmahmad has been in this business for over 5 years. Besides this, he is also involved in construction work for-hire. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Dometila

texts.en:
Dometila M. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old. Dometila is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Dometila owns & operates a business selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Dometila has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Dometila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dometila is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dometila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: A 47-year-old mother of four children, Leah G. is a bakery owner in Tapaz Sta. Josefa Agusan del Sur. Though very confident in her bread-baking knowledge, she was worried about where to get enough funds to sustain her livelihood. Then she found CEV and applied for a loan of Php 8,000 which she will use to buy additional ingredients orf her bakery operations. She says, “The CEVI loan program is really helpful to the poor.”

loans.use: To purchase baking supplies for her business

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi comprend sept femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames, avec en moyenne de 42 ans, 5 enfants et habitant  toutes  à Sakoïbougouni, un village de la Commune Rurale de Sakoïba (4ème Région administrative du Mali) .
Les membres du groupe font essentiellement le commerce du bois de chauffe, du charbon de bois, des condiments alimentaires, du savon et de la restauration.  
Le besoin d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les motiva à s’organiser et à intégrer le programme  crédit avec qui elles sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire. 
Quant à l’utilisation de ce nouveau prêt, Madame Arahama Traoré compte utiliser le sien pour acheter,  5 sacs de graines de Néré. Elle s’approvisionne à  Kouri et à Ségou. 
Pour transformer les graines de Néré en Sounbala, elle les trie les fait bouillir pendant longtemps, les pile légèrement,  les débarrasse de tous les  déchets, les fait fumer à la vapeur puis, les garder hermétiquement fermé dans un vase pendant au moins deux jours avant de les écraser, les mettre en boule et les faire sécher. Son Sounbala est beaucoup apprécié par sa clientèle. 
Elle revend à domicile, en ambulant à travers le village et à la foire de  Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et à  crédit à une clientèle essentiellement composée  de femmes. 
Arahama espère  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 17.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour, rembourser son prêt, contribuer à  certaines dépenses familiales, participer aux évènements sociaux. Son ambition est d’acheter une charrette et un âne pour faciliter son transport et celui des marchandises.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi is composed of seven married women mostly in polygamous families.  These women average 42 years of age and five children all living in Sakoïbougouni, a village of the rural community of Sakoïba (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They essentially do commerce involving firewood, charcoal, condiments, soaps, and food catering.    Needing to increase their working capital, the group members were motivated to become organized and to join the loan program.  They are now on their third solidarity loan.  As for the use of the loan, Ms. Arahama Traoré plans on using hers to buy five sacks of néré seeds.  She gets her supplies in Kouri and in Ségou.  To process the néré seeds into sounbala, she sorts them, boils them for a long time, pounds them lightly, removes all the waste, steam-cooks the seeds, and then keeps them sealed in a container for at least two days.  Then she crushes them, puts them into a bowl, and dries them.  Her sounbala is much appreciated by her customers.  Arahama sells out of her home, door-to-door, and at the Ségou fair.  Sales are made, cash or credit accepted, to a customer base composed essentially of women.  Arahama hopes to make a monthly profit of 17,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan, to help cover certain family expenses, and to take part in societal events.  Her ambition is to buy a cart and donkey to facilitate transport for herself and the merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying néré seeds

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita M. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 45 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a service-based business in the local community, the Water Refiller. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately $135 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Nenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Alberto T. nasceu em Namaacha, vizinho com o reino da Suazilândia, província de Maputo, casado e pai de 7 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 1 aos 16 anos, os mais velhos é que vão a escola. Fez a 10ª classe e de seguida engrena num curso de professorado que durou dois anos (tempo regular). Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca saiu do Distrito, após o curso de professorado é afeto numa localidade que dista a 45km da vila sede do Município. É funcionário permanente ha mais de 16 anos com a categoria de Director da Escola auferindo 7.799.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
 
Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos e resolvei não continuar mais. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes da Hluvuku. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, cimento, ferro, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 15.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. 
 
Esta confiante que vai pagar cem nenhum problema e pedir novo empréstimo para fazer um murro de vedação em sua residência.
texts.en:
Alberto T. was born in Namaacha, Maputo province, near the Mozambique's border with Swaziland. He is married and is the father of 7 children who are between 1 and 16 years old. The oldest go to school. He studied through 10th grade and then entered a professoriate course, which lasted 2 years (normal time). He lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else. He has never left the District; after the professoriate course, he was hired in a town 45km away from the main village in the municipality. He has been a permanent employee there for more than 16 years, and as School Director he makes 7,799 MZN each month. He uses this to pay for household expenses and even saves some in his bank account. Alberto has had loans with other banks and decided not to continue with them. He found out about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his second loan, which has a value of 20,000 MZN. He plans to use to to buy construction material (rock, cement, iron, sand, etc.) in order to continue working on his home. The previous loan of 15,000 MZN was for the same purpose. He is confident that he can pay back the loan without any problems and ask for a new one to build a protective wall around his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material (rock, cement, iron, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Siporah Gitura

texts.en:
Siporah Gitura K. is 53 years old. She is married to John K. and a mother of two school-going children. Siporah is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last seven years.

She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET. This will be her first loan which she is planning to spend to prepare land for potato planting. Potatoes have been doing well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Siporah's dream is to do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hard-working woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To spend 25,000 on harrowing, 20,000 on seeds and fertilizer and 15,000 on planting

loans.name: Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Akhtar is married to S. H., who works in a factory, while she supports her husband financially by stitching clothes for her neighborhood clients.

Akhtar lives with her family in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children who are still very young and have not yet started to go to school. 

Akhtar’s husband also has a fertilizer-selling business which he does after returning from the factory. He has contacts with the farmers and earns a good profit on the fertilizer by selling it to them.

Akhtar has applied for a loan for the first time from Asasah. With the loan, her husband will buy fertilizer so that he can fulfill the orders of his customers. She hopes that he will be able to increase his income.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto Benavidez tiene 26 años y vive en el barrio la Luz, su negocio se llama “Venta de víveres donde Carlos” este es su tercer crédito y lo invertirá en la compra de surtido para la tienda, entre víveres ranchos, licores y abarrotes. 
Su negocio lo inició en el año 2005 con una venta de jugos naturales y otros refrescos, como gaseosas y bebidas frías, gradualmente fue agregándole otras mercancías, porque sintió la necesidad de aumentar sus ingresos y además porque el lugar resultó propicio para esta actividad; en la actualidad en su tienda  vende adicionalmente bebidas frías al por mayor y al detal y también productos de papelería que  adicionó últimamente.
Carlos Alberto ha recibido 3 créditos que le han ayudado a producir ciertos cambios como el su economía que se ha mejorado y también han ocurrido en los aspectos organizacionales de su tienda, que cada día reviste un mayor orden.
Su meta es continuar adicionando otros productos como los de miscelánea e independizar su negocio de su espacio familiar. Su mayor desafío es la competencia que existe en ese sector, por eso su meta es tener gran variedad de mercancía e ir diversificando la oferta de productos y servicios.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto Benavidez is 26 years old and lives in the La Luz neighborhood. His business is a general store called “Venta de víveres donde Carlos.” This is his third loan, and it will be invested in purchasing products for the store, like general provisions, food and liquor.

He started his business in 2005, initially selling fruit juices and other beverages, such as soda pop and cold drinks. He gradually added other merchandise because he felt the need to increase his income. Furthermore, the business turned out to be favorable. He currently also sells cold drinks wholesale and retail, as well as stationery, which he recently added.

Carlos Alberto has received 3 loans, which have helped him achieve several changes; his financial situation has improved, and his store organization is improving day by day. His goal is to continue adding other products and to separate his business from his residence. His biggest challenge is the competition that exists in the area, which is why his goal is to offer a greater variety of merchandise and to diversify his goods and services.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase provisions, food and liquor for general store

loans.name: Ramón Sabas

texts.es:
Don Ramón Sabas V. E., es soltero tiene dos hijos menores de edad vive junto a su familia en el barrio la florida desde hace cinco años, es de profesión contador público trabaja en la alcaldía municipal de Chinandega desde hace seis años como auditor fiscal dice sentirse realizado en su familia y en su trabajo como profesional ya que es útil para el desarrollo de su municipio.
Don Ramón Sabas V. E. es cliente activo de CEPRODEL desde hace más de cuatro años con tres créditos cancelados y uno activo estos créditos los ha utilizado para mejoras de vivienda y resolver problemas familiares, dice sentirse agradecido ya que son créditos accesibles y con tasas de interés bajas.
texts.en:
Ramón Sabas V. E. is single and has two young children. He and his family have lived in the “La Florida” neighborhood for five years. He is an accountant and has been working as an auditor for the Chinandega city hall for the past six years. He tells us that he feels established with his family and his professional career, because it is helpful to the development of the city. Ramon has been actively working with CEPRODEL for more than four years and has had three prior loans, which he has used to make improvements to his home and to resolve some family issues. He tells us that he is grateful because these loans are within reach and the interest rates are low.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medicine

loans.name: Burulsun's Group

texts.en:
Burulsun N. is the leader of this group. She is twenty-seven and married. She has a daughter and a son. Her daughter is one year old and her son is three years old.  Her husband is a farmer and a taxi driver. He also breeds cattle. Depending on the season, her husband devotes himself to his job as a taxi driver. During appropriate periods, he farms and breeds cattle. Right now, he is planting wheat and potatoes. She is applying for a loan in order to buy more cattle and increase their number. Mainly, all the work will be done by her husband.  In the future, she wants to improve her family’s living conditions on the profits from their business.

Group members:

Chinar T. is forty-two years old and married. She has seven children: four daughters and three sons. Her elder two sons breed cattle and the other children go to school. Her husband and her sons are buying, fattening and reselling cattle at a higher price. Her husband started his cattle breeding business ten years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 KGS. He has bred cattle since he was a child. Due to the successful functioning of their business, her husband provides for all the members of the family, and they built a new house and bought a car. 

Kunduz K. is twenty-seven and married. She has a son who is four years old. Her husband combines farming and cattle breeding. In 2004, her husband bought cattle for 10,000 KGS. Since that time he has bred cattle. Also during appropriate seasons he farms. Right now, he is planting wheat and barley. They have already achieved good results, and with the help of the profits received they provide for all their family members.  She is applying for a loan in order to buy more cattle for breeding. They are planning to expand both in cattle breeding and in agriculture but they need support in the form of a loan for the purchase of more cattle. 

Kenzhegul T. is thirty-three and married. She has four daughters who are fifteen, thirteen, seven and five years old. Her husband combines his work as a taxi driver and cattle breeding. They started cattle breeding ten years ago with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS. The work of cattle breeding is done by her husband because he has bred cattle since he was a child. They have greatly increased their number of cattle. Now, they are applying for a loan in order to get money for the purchase of additional cattle. This would give them an opportunity to grow and expand their cattle breeding business.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Jeoffer

texts.en:
Jeoffer A. is from the town of Banga. He is 31 years old and is married with a 7-year-old child.

Jeoffer owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. He also tills a small parcel of land where he plants and harvests rice crops. He says his harvest helps his family as they use part of it for family consumption. When he is not busy farming and growing hogs, he spends time driving his tricycle to transport people around his community.

Jeoffer joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Jeoffer is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and feed for his pigs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and feed for his pigs

loans.name: Germie

texts.en:
Germie G. is from the town of Panglao. She is 48 years old. Germie is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Germie owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing taxi services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tour van services. Germie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years.

Germie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Germie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Germie and is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to repair an  existing vehicle for better service and to purchase tires. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle  and purchase tires to provide better service

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Mrs. Pech E., 36, is a fisherman in the province of Siem Reap which is the most wonderful place in Cambodia. Her husband's name is Chhoum; he is 39 and works with her in the fishing business. The young couple is blessed with eight children who are enrolled in public school;  a few of them help their parents with the same business. They usually need to spend over six hours a day fishing in and around Tunle Sap River. 

Mrs. Pech E. and her husband catch around 7 kilos of fish per day and sell them in bulk to his customers in the market. She said that her fishing equipment is torn and is getting old. Mrs. Pech E. will use her loan to purchase nets and other fishing equipment to catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets, and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Bogita

texts.en:
Bogita has been practicing mixed farming for fifteen years in Kisii town, western Kenya. His mixed farm produces maize, tomatoes, bananas and milk which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his butcher shop in a nearby shopping center. He says that his primary challenges in farming have been fluctuation in the market prices of his products and a poor transport network which hinders them from reaching wider markets.

Bogita is 34 years old. He is married and has been blessed with two children, ages five and seven. Both children attend school.

He has requested this loan of 35,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help him improve the living standards of his family. He would like to expand both his dairy farming and his butcher shop in the future. He is grateful to Juhudi for the financial help which has assisted many poor Kenyans improve their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat S. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia.  The family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All four of his children attend the local secondary school.  

Munhbat and his wife operate the family businesses.  They own three kind of businesses such as taxi service, pc game service provider center and a dairy products production to support their family.  Munhbat is a herder and raise his own herd of 250 livestock in his town.  He first started his business in 2006 by producing and selling a variety of dairy products and since 2007, he has been operating a taxi service using his own car.  

After years of successful operation on both businesses, he has expanded his business facility and started to manage a pc game center. Moreover, he also produces and sells ice cream in his home to supplement his family income. Munhbat is a very hardworking man and for the future, he says, "I plan to save more money in order to establish my own big dairy product production factory in the future."  He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to repay his computer loan and decorate his work place.

loans.use: To repay for his computer loan.

loans.name: Delfa

texts.en:
Delfa M. lives in San Francisco, Agusan del Sur. She is he mother of four children and she is passionate about taking care of the needs of her family. She has had a rice farm store since 2007. She does her best to help her husband earn a living for their family. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 4,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the money to expand her business and buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In that way, she believes that she will be able to increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school. Betty has a business running a food stall. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week. Betty sells her products from home, on a retail basis. Betty has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy baskets of fish, eggplants, sugar cane, tomatoes, and oranges. The main business challenges for Betty are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and to build her own house.   Betty lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and food.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish, eggplants, tomatoes, and oranges.

loans.name: Mas Que Vencedores Group

texts.es:
CARMELA; de 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, menores de edad uno y mayores de edad cuatro. Ella integra del grupo “MAS QUE VENCEDORES” junto con 6 integrantes mas, quienes son muy entusiastas y emprendedoras.
Desde hace diez años, la Sra. Carmela se dedica a la venta de menús y buffet. Se inicia en este negocio, porque desde los 15 años ella cocina, ya que su padre era cocinero y con el aprendió, ahora junto con su hija que estudia gastronomía desea tener una sucursal de ventas, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo siempre ha ayudado en la educación de sus hijas y la ampliación de su hogar.
La gran meta de Carmela es tener un restaurante campestre, el reciente préstamo será invertido en la compra de mercadería para bufet, ella esta muy agradecida con los inversionistas y con la institución por todo el apoyo que ha recibido y promete cumplir con la puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Carmela is 50 years old, she is married and she has 5 children. One is still a minor and the others are adults. She is a member of the group named "Mas que Vencedores". There are 6 other members in the group and they are all enthusiastic, enterprising individuals.

For more than ten years Carmela has been selling foods, either buffet or a la carte. She started out this business because for the previous 15 years she was a cook. Her father was also a cook and she learned from him. She wants to have restaurant together with her daughter that is studying to be a cook. With time and effort she has put her daughters through school and she has made additions to the house.

Carmela's greatest goal is to have a country restaurant. The loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for the buffet. She is very grateful to all to individuals who contributed to the loan, and with the organization for the support they have given her. She is committed to making payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase items for the buffet.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia P. is a 60-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating pig-fattening, sugarcane-farming and livestock businesses. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig-fattening, farming  and livestock businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8500. 

Virgilia is borrowing PHP 19500 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Virgilia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:
