In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund three business operations

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia Z. S. tiene la edad de 29 años, estudio hasta el segundo grado de secundaria y esta casada con el señor Juan Carlos Fabian con el cual tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos son hombres a los llama Juan Carlos  de 6  años de edad  que estudia la primaria y  eduardo de 3  años  y dos mujeres de nombres Cecilia de 9 años de edad que asisten a la primaria de la comunidad y Imelda de 4 años que asiste al preescolar.
Doña Cecilia y su familia viven en la comunidad de Vista Hermosa que se encuentra a 40 minutos de Tierra Blanca en el Veracruz, para poder llegar a la comunidad de vista hermosa se toma un autobus que te deja en la carretera y debes caminar como 25 minutos  para llegar a dicha comunidad.

 Doña Cecilia nos platica que hace mas de dos años inicio con su negocio de venta de dulces de posteria(cocadas, camotes y dulces de leche ), ella vende casa por casa en su comunidad y algunas veces  se va a otras comunidades como La Reforma, La Atalaya y Loma Alta a vender sus dulces, ella decidio iniciar su propio negocio porque quiere ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, tambien nos dice que quiere iniciar  a vender zapatos por catalogo para obtener mas recursos economicos, Doña Cecilia  desea darles un profesion a sus hijos pero tambien sabe que solo lo lograra trabajando muy duro junto a su esposo, ella tambien nos dice que se encuentra agradecida con la fundacion ya que con este prestamo su negocio prosperara.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cecilia Z. Sánchez is 29 years old.  She finished 8th grade and is married to Mr. Juan Carlos Fabian with whom she has four children.  Two are boys: Juan Carlos, 6, who is in elementary school and Eduardo, 3, and two girls, Cecilia, 9, who goes to the local elementary school and Imelda, 4, who is in preschool.

Doña Cecilia and her family live in the community of Vista Hermosa located 40 minutes from Tierra Blanca in Veracruz.  To get to the community of Vista Hermosa one takes a bus that drops you off on the highway and then you must walk about 25 minutes to reach the community.

Doña Cecilia tells us that she started her sweet pastry (macaroons and dulce de leche) sales business over two years ago.  She sells house to house in her community and sometimes goes to other communities like La Reforma, La Atalaya and Loma Alta to sell her sweets.  She decided to start her own business because she wants to help her husband with household expenses and to provide her children with a better quality of life.  She also tells us that she wants to start selling catalogue shoes to obtain more economic resources.

Doña Cecilia wants to provide her children with professions and knows that the only way to accomplish this is through her and her husband’s hard work.  She also tells us that she’s grateful to the foundation because her business will prosper with this loan.

loans.use: For sweet pastry and shoe sales.

loans.name: Sonia Alicia

texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia has 29 years of age, is a single mother with a child. Sonia is dedicated to the making of garments of different varieties and has extensive experience in handling such work.  For a long time, she worked as a clerk in a clothing factory until two years ago she decided to start her own sewing workshop, for which she established a partnership with a friend, because she did not have all the machines that she needed to start but her partner had the machines with him.

The credit obtained from the Paraguayan Foundation has been invested in purchasing a machine that allows you to do work that previously could not be performed.

So also has a full stock of machines to perform a wider variety of jobs, which should attract more number of customers.

Sonia thanked the Fundación Paraguaya for the credit granted and by which to get the opportunity to continue growing her business.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Albertina forma parte del Banco comunal “El tiempo es oro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y  venta de sus productos de amasandería, los cuales consisten en; empanadas, humitas y tortas. Trabajo que realiza cuando sus clientes le solicitan productos, especialmente los fines de semana, festivos y ocasionalmente en eventos. De esta manera entrega a domicilio sus productos de amasandería.
Albertina trabaja desde hace 2 años y 6 meses en este rubro. Además se dedica a dar almuerzos a un grupo de ancianos por las tardes. 
Albertina vive con su esposo, su hija y dos nietas.
El préstamo de Fondo esperanza lo utilizará como uso personal, ya que a causa del terremoto del 27 de febrero de 2010, su casa fue devastada, por lo cual comprará  materiales de construcción para arreglar los muros de su casa y así con esto vivir más tranquila. 
Su sueño es tener una amasandería donde pueda preparar todos sus productos y seguir entregándolos a domicilio. Respecto a su casa su sueño es arreglarla completamente, pero necesita de mucho dinero, para hacerlo posible.
A Albertina le han sido muy útiles los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza para la mantención de su negocio y reconstrucción de su hogar. En relación a las reuniones grupales que realiza el Banco comunal al que pertenece, ella se siente muy cómoda y contenta con los aprendizajes adquiridos, ya que le han servido para distribuir sus ingresos y ahorrar sus ganancias. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Albertina is a member of the “El Tiempo es Oro” (Time is Gold) communal bank in the city of Concepción.  She manufactures and sells bakery items consisting in turnovers, "humitas" (small cakes made from corn and sugar) and cakes.  She does this work based on orders from customers especially on weekends, holidays and occasionally for special events.  She home delivers her baked goods.  She has been in this line of work for two and a half years.  She also provides lunches for a group of senior citizens in the afternoons.  Albertina lives with her husband, her daughter and two granddaughters.

The Fondo Esperanza loan is for personal use because, due to the February 27, 2010 earthquake, her house was devastated.  She will, therefore, buy building materials and supplies to repair the walls in her house thus living more securely.

Her dream is to own a bakery where she can produce all her products and continue going out to home deliver them.  With respect to her house it is to repair it completely but she needs a lot of money to do so.

Fondo Esperanza loans have been very useful for Albertina to stay in business and rebuild her home.  She feels very happy and content with what she’s learned at the communal bank group meetings; it has served her well to budget her income and save profits.

Concepción is situated at the mouth of the Bíobío River.  It has been very important in our history since it was the site of important battles and settlements, especially during the Arauco War, because it borders Mapuche territory.  Currently the city has an important economic and demographic development being considered one of Chile’s most relevant urban, demographic, administrative, financial and commercial nucleuses after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Mrs. Tep Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The sixteen people who make up this village bank loan will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so that it will improve their family's standard of living.

Mrs. Tep is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Voeun, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land where they can grow rice.  They sell some part of the rice and the other part they use to support their family.  He is a construction worker. 

Now she has a problem because her field is far away from an irrigation system. So to improve this situation, Mrs. Tep is asking for a loan to buy a pump machine. She is the mother of two children who are studying in local school.

loans.use: to buy a pump machine

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.en:
The rural communal bank "Virgen D. Guadalupe" is in their 3rd loan cycle at FINCA Peru. The bank is located in the district of Huaytara in the province of Huancavelica. Members of the bank have businesses in production of alfalfa, fruits, other agriculture, and livestock production. The group is taking out a loan total of 9,600 PEN. 

Teofila is taking out a loan of 600 PEN for the purchase of avocado seeds for growing and guinea pigs for reproduction. She is married, and has three children who are all studying. 

Teofila would like to continue to educate her children so that they can become professionals, and to build a new house. With respect to her businesses, she would like to increase her avocado production and find more places to sell them, in addition to increasing her guinea pig production. Since joining FINCA she has enjoyed working more and increasing her loan amounts, and her savings at the same time.

loans.use: To purchase avocado seeds and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Ana Susana

texts.es:
Ana, es una joven D. 26 años D. edad, resiD. en El Transito, departamento D. San Miguel, vive alquilando vivienda, junto a su esposo y una hija D. 3 años D. edad, administra una sala D. belleza y venta D. ropa, este negocio lo inicio hace un año, trabajo anteriormente y aprendió el oficio, su horario es D. 8:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella necesita para su negocio mobiliario, por esta razón solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar sillas y estantes, ya que carece D. estos y le son necesarios para atender a sus clientes y que este cómodos, también mostrar su mercadería sin mayor problema.
Esta compra le ayudara a tener en mejores condiciones el salón D. belleza y recibir a sus clientes en un lugar más adecuado, su objetivo es ser una microempresaria D. éxito, aumentar el volumen D. clientes y en su familia, pues cada mejorar la calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a young woman of 26 who lives in El Transito, in San Miguel department.  She lives in a rental house together with her husband and 3 year-old daughter.  Ana runs a beauty salon and sells clothes.  She started her business one year ago.  Prior to that she worked and learned the traD..  She works from 8.00am to 5.00pm.

Ana needs furniture for her business.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy chairs and shelves as she doesn't have these and they are necessary in order for her to be able to serve her customers and make them comfortable.  She would also like to be able to display her merchandise without problems.

This purchase will help Ana to have her beauty salon in a better condition and enable her to receive her customers in a more suitable place.  Her goal is to be a successful small businesswoman, to increase her number of customers, and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chairs and shelves for her business

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Kyrey” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades diferentes y formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Este comité está en 1er. ciclo con muchas ganas de sobresalir.
La sra. Nancy Mercedes es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la cria y venta de animales, en especial de aves de corral, desde hace tiempo que este negocio fue montado y con mucho sacrificio lo fue acrecentando, hoy día cuenta con buena clientela, generalmente almacenes y para cualquier persona que quiera cocinar en su casa o restaurantes.
Ella se esmera por sobresalir al igual que sus amigas del comité, todas tratan de superarse cada día mejorando la calidad de sus productos, por eso solicitan el crédito de Kiva, para comprar balanceados y medicamentos de modo que puedan mejorar los animales que ofrecen para el consumo.
texts.en:
The committee “Kuña Kyrey” started with the union of some neighbors from the city of Santaní. All of the members of the committee have different jobs and started a very united group that is capable of doing activities together that strengthen their team spirit. This committee is in their 1st loan cycle and is very encouraged to get ahead.

Mrs. Nancy Mercedes is the president of the group, she breeds and sells animals, especially chickens, for a long time since she set up the business and with a lot of sacrifice it started to grow and now she has a good customer base and generally has enough in stock for any person that wants to cook in their home or for restaurants.

Mrs. Nancy works hard to get ahead as well as her friends from the committee who all try to succeed by improving the quality of their products which is why they are seeking a loan from Kiva, to buy food and medicines to improve the animals that they sell for consumption.

loans.use: buy food and medicine for their animals.

loans.name: Juana De Mata

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “SEÑOR de COYLLURITTI de CCORAO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Ccorao - Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Juana, la socia tiene 64 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 1 hijo, ella se dedica a la agricultura, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivo los cuales producen maíz, papas y verduras, la socia vende su producción al por mayor, ella requiere en esta ocasión el crédito para poder comprar semillas y para alquilar el tractor correspondiente para una nueva época de siembra. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Señor D. Coylluritti D. Ccorao” and it is located in the town of Ccorao – Pisac, which forms part of the Province of Calca and the Department of Cusco.

Juana is 64 years old, married and has one child.  She works in agriculture and has farmlands where she grows corn, potatoes and vegetables.  She sells her crops at wholesale.  She currently needs this loan in order to be able to buy seeds and rent a tractor for the new planting season.

Juana is grateful and wishes to state that she will be disciplined and make her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy seeds for the next planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 48 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales está con ella solo el menor de sus hijos de 16 años de edad; la socia tiene sus negocios de compra y venta de maíz y su tienda de abarrotes, la socia requiere el crédito en esta ocasión para comprar mercadería de primera necesidad que es arroz, azúcar, fideos, harinas, aceite y todo al por mayor. La socia invertirá su crédito en la compra de mercadería.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito que le otorgarán para así mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank “Perolniyoc”. She lives in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

The member is 48 years old, married, and has four children. Only her youngest child, age 16, still lives with her. She has businesses of buying and selling corn and managing a grocery store. The loan she is requesting on this occasion will be used to buy basic necessities such as rice, sugar, noodles, flour, oil, and other products in bulk. Therefore, she intends to invest the loan for this purpose.

She values and appreciates the loan that has been provided so that she can improve her quality of life. In addition, she promises to complete her payments according to the stated terms.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, noodles, flour, oil, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Alex Vladimir

texts.es:
El joven Alex Vladimir  tiene 29 años y es soltero, Alex vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la zona Oeste. Alex es Técnico Medio en Veterinaria. Alex es Gerente Técnico en la empresa avícola AVIACRUZ desde hace más de 5 años. También se dedica a la cría y posterior venta de pollos en sus terrenos ubicados en una zona de Cochabamba conocida como El Paso.
Alex necesita este capital de inversión para poder abastecerse de pollitos y poder vender, ya que la demanda de los mismos se incremento considerablemente los últimos meses. Alex es conocido por ser una persona muy trabajadora, estudiosa y con interés de superarse. A pesar que en Cochabamba la inestabilidad social (bloqueos de caminos, paros de transporte, manifestaciones y diferencias políticas) es un problema grande y es el mayor riesgo que corre su negocio puesto que al existir estos problemas el precio de su producto sufre cambios tanto positivos como negativos repentinamente. El mayor sueño de Alex es poder tener una granja lo suficientemente grande para algún día ser el mayor distribuidor de pollo de la región.
texts.en:
Alex Vladimir is 29 years old and single.  He lives in the western area of the city of Cochabamba.  Alex is a veterinarian.  He has been the technical manager of the poultry company AVIACRUZ for more than five years.  He also raises and then sells chickens on land which he owns which is located in an area of Cochabamba known as El Paso.  Alex needs this investment capital to stock up with chicks that he can sell since demand has increased considerably in recent months.

Alex is known as a very hard-working, studious person who is interested in improving himself.  Social unrest in Cochabamba is a big problem (road blocks, transport strikes, demos and political differences) and this is the biggest risk for his business since these problems mean that the price for his product suffers sudden changes, both positive and negative.  However, Alex's biggest dream is to be able to own a farm which is big enough that one day he will become the biggest chicken distributor in his region.

loans.use: to invest in his business raising and selling chickens

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en: Cresencia, a 54-year-old married mother of two children, has had a retail shop selling snacks, biscuits and  beverages for the past five years in the Philippines. A new member of HSPFI, she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her enterprise. In the future, Cresencia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, a 46-year-old Ugandan male who hails from Kyenjojo District, is married and has six children ranging in age from 16 to 7 years. He lives in a semi-permanent house with an iron roof, and one of his chief family goals is to educate his children up to university level.

Wilson obtained the start-up capital for his retail business by burning and selling charcoal. He is requesting this loan to purchase sugar, cooking oil and cassava flour to resell, and wants his business to grow to include trade in wholesale items. The main problem Wilson faces are customers who buy on credit and take a long to pay.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil and cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
Jose Alexander tiene 20 años, Es soltero vive con los padres no tiene hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla son 12 miembros se en su mayoria dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz, actividad mas antigua.

Jose Alexander se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Procan y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafios como enfermedades de los trabajadores y falta de dinero para seguir invirtiendo. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios e incrementar la produccion para ayudar a los padres.

Le gusta ser una persona emprendedora y ser un hombre trabajador.
texts.en:
Jose Alexander, 20. is single, without children, and he lives with his parents in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.  
The members of his communal bank V.R.C. Nuevo Amancer meet in the building of San Luis de Zapotal in Ventanas canton.  This chapter of 12 members is dedicated to growing corn and rice, an older business.

Jose Alexander works as a farmer and grows rice and corn.  He buys his supplies in Comercial Procan and sells them in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers for the corn and rice.  The support of the financing will help him buy what he needs.  His dream is to finish school and increase production to help his parents.  He confronts problems such as the illness in the workers and lack of money to continue investing.

He wants to be an entrepreneur and a hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a 32-year-old lady who has two children. Her eldest daughter is in kindergarten while the youngest is only three years old and hasn't started her education yet. 

Bushra and her husband both work as embroiderers and operate their business from their home. They are very good at their work and receive regular orders every month. 

She also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to grow her family business. With the loan, they will buy embroidery material in bulk to be able to fulfill the orders of their clients and increase their profits. 

They have been running this business for past 10 years and have a good base of clientele. She hopes that an investment will be a profitable one for their business and increase their income.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 38 years old, married and has three children. For the past four years she has had a shop where she sells snacks, beverages and canned goods.

Teresita is a new member of HSPFI. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more snacks, beverages and canned goods to sell. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: Octavia, de 53 años es una mujer responsable. Ella vive en el caserío de Villa Visca junto a su esposo Marcelino, con quien tiene 8 hijos pero solo vive con 3 de ellos que son menores. Para el progreso de su familia, está trabajadora mujer se dedica a la agricultura con la siembra de papa y alverja en grandes cantidades los cuales realiza con la ayuda de su esposo; él que es su pareja incondicional. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pasar su tiempo en el campo, “es tranquilo y se respira una paz”, afirma. Pues viaja seguido a la ciudad de Lima, donde comercializa los ricos quesos que solo se realiza en la sierra del Perú, donde obtiene buenas ganancias desde hace 4 años que comenzó con este negocio. Ahora se está preparando para la cosecha a de papa de la variedad “yungay”, donde espera tener buenas ganancias. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Octavia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de alverja para su próxima siembra, además de varios moldes de queso para su negocio.
texts.en:
Octavia, 53, is a responsible woman. She lives in Villa Visca settlement along with her husband, Marcelino, with whom she has 8 children, but only 3, who are still minors, live with them. To support the family, this hardworking woman is an agriculturalist who plants potatoes and peas in large quantities alongside her husband, who is her staunch and wholehearted partner. What she most likes about her work is spending time in the countryside: “It is nice and quiet and very peaceful,” she states. 

She also travels frequently to the city of Lima, where she sells the delicious cheese that is only produced in the mountains of Peru and where sales have been profitable since she began this business 4 years ago.

Presently she is preparing to harvest her “Yungay” potatoes  [a sturdy Peruvian highland variety] from which she also expects to make a good profit.

This is her eighth loan from MFP and she hopes to have the support of all of you so that she can continue to reach her goals. She promises to make her payments on time and, upon receiving your support, she will invest the money in purchasing pea seeds for her next sowing as well as various cheese molds for her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of pea seeds and cheese.

loans.name: Habil

texts.ru: Habil 30 let . On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Habil yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i sinom. Habil seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji. On uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
texts.en: Habil is 30 years old.  He is married and has one child.  Habil is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his wife and son.  Habil now needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle to increase livestock quantity for sale.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for five years and breeds cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran is 36 years old and spends most of her time in her home doing her household responsibilities. She is very efficient and performs her duties very well. 

Her husband has a business of loading & unloading. He has a donkey cart which he purchased on installments. Through his cart he offers goods transfer services to his clients. 

Bashiran is the mother of a daughter who is studying in class 5. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to pay off the remaining installments on his cart. This will make him the owner of the donkey cart and give him the motivation to work with more dedication. He is very experienced in his business and many people know about his services. 

Bashiran is hopeful that the loan will bring positive financial changes to her husband's business and improve the lifestyle of her family.

Note: One of the members has a clothes selling business thats why they are holding clothes.

loans.use: To pay off the remaining installments on a donkey cart.

loans.name: Mikala

texts.en:
Mikala is 30 years old, a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yei South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Makala requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her child to go to school and hopes to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Juanito is providing motorcycle, or habal-habal, services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service. Juanito has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Juanito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian tiene 34 años es casado y tiene 4 hijos de 7, 5, 4, 2 años de edad, vive con su familia en la ciudad de Otavalo que se encuentra en la provincia de Imbabura al norte de Ecuador. Julian se describe como una persona emprendedora que lucha por ser mejor cada día para poder salir adelante con su familia.

Julian trabaja solo en la elaboración de artesanías (instrumentos musicales). Es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de tubos de madera (tunda) y de un motor de dos caballos de fuerza; esta inversión le ayudará bastante ya que puede optimizar tiempo con el motor y obtener muy buena productividad teniendo buenos resultados en cuanto a las ventas e ingresos.

Su sueño es viajar al extranjero para poder demostrar su cultura con los instrumentos musicales y abrirse mercado internacional.
texts.en:
Julian is 34 years old, married, and has four children (ages 7, 5, 4, and 2). He and his family live in the city of Otavalo, which is located in the province of Imbabura in northern Ecuador. Julian describes himself as an enterprising person who strives to get better each day so that he and his family can move forward.

Julian works alone in his business of making handcrafted musical instruments. This is the second loan he is requesting from FODEMI and he will invest in the purchase of wooden tubes and a two-horsepower motor. This investment will be of a great help since the motor will allow him to optimize his time. As a result, Julian will be able to achieve good productivity that will lead to excellent results in his sales and his income.

His dream is to travel abroad in order to conduct cultural demonstrations with his musical instruments and to open an international market.

loans.use: to buy wooden tubes and a motor for making musical instruments.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is a 39-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one school-aged child. She helps her husband, who works as an employee in a local company, with the household expenses. As for her, Wissam has been working as a tailor for the past 15 years and has owned her shop since 2003. She has gained a good number of customers who ask for her services. Today, she’s looking to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to enlarge her business and increase her productivity by purchasing additional tailoring tools and supplies. She estimates that the loan will help her increase her profits by 10 percent.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring tools and supplies.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria, 45, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Braulio, her business partner, and a mother to three children who are all in school. While attending to her children, she has also kept herself busy with her business as her way of helping with the family's daily expenses. 

Gloria owns a variety store. She earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located in her residence. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more grocery items so she will have more stock. The more items displayed at the store the better, as it helps to attract more customers to buy in her variety store. She believes that she will earn more profit and income once she adds more canned goods and pastries. 

Gloria hopes that her business will continue to help her with her family's needs and expenses. She wants all her children to finish their studies and fulfill their own dreams and aspirations in life. She hopes that she will be able to put up another store. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps her learn from the Bible. It strengthens her spiritual life.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Cinforosa

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Cinforosa; tiene 59 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,ella prepara platos como pollo al horno,huevos fritos y caldos,la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado de Cusco donde prepara la comida,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar  como carne,huevo, pollo y verduras.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is Cinforosa, she is 59, married and has three children; she continues to work in the business of food sales, she prepares dishes such as oven roasted chicken, fried eggs and soups, she has a stand in the Cusco market where she prepares the food and works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM, through this business she gets her children ahead and wants to expand and improve her food sales business. Our associate requests a loan to buy ingredients to cook with such as meat, eggs, chicken and vegetables.

Our associate is thankful for the loan and is committed to repay on schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook with such as meat, eggs, chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Suvila Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Suvila Group in Western Kenya! Concepter is the facilitator of the Suvila group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Concepter takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Concepter had a very good maize yield harvesting seven bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Concepter was only able to harvest one bag of maize on 1/2 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Concepter and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, Concepter will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Suvila group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 
Cheryl has a shop that makes & sells snacks like pan & rice cakes or suman. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.
Cheryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cheryl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Akpedji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AKPEDJI est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Julienne Rufine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Julienne Rufine est âgée de 50 ans et une veuve. Julienne Rufine est mère quatre enfants tous scolarisés, mais plus aucun enfant n'est à sa charge. Julienne Rufine vit seule et assure seule ses divers besoins. Julienne Rufine a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Depuis quinze ans, Julienne Rufine exerce comme activité, la vente de divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, conserves, etc.) dans un marché du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Julienne Rufine vend des cartes de recharge téléphoniques. Julienne Rufine s’approvisionne au Bénin. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Julienne Rufine désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Julienne Rufine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKPEDJI, un deuxième crédit auprès de  ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The AKPEDJI group consists of three people who live in the same area of Benin.  The representative of the group, named Julienne Rufine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  This is the second time that this group has requested a loan from Alide with the goal of expanding their business.  Julienne Rufine is 50 years old and a widow.  She is mother of four children, all in school, but none are her dependents.  Julienne Rufine lives alone and is solely responsible for her various needs.  She quit secondary school.  For the past 15 years, Julienne Rufine has been in the business of selling various products (pasta, canned goods, etc) in a market in Benin.  In addition, she sells recharge cards for mobile phones.  She stocks up in Benin.  This business allows her to take care of her needs without much difficulty.  In order to better meet the requirements of her customers, Julienne Rufine wants to strengthen her product inventory and increase the level of her business.  To accomplish this, Julienne Rufine and the other members of the AKPEDJI group are requesting a second loan from Alide.  Their first loan was completely repaid.

loans.use: to buy various products (pasta, canned goods) and mobile phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is married and has two sons, ages five and seven years. He describes himself as an ambitious and optimistic man. His primary activity is photography. He has been in this business for the last five years. His business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the photography business and the high cost of electricity. 

He will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy related photo materials. In the next five years, Reuben hopes to run a photo studio.

loans.use: To buy related photo materials.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis es un joven muy trabajador y que no le gusta depender de nadie, hace años el comenzó con su negocio de venta de comida pero como estaba en lugar donde la renta era muy elevada sus ganancias eran muy pocas y no le convino. Aparte de ese negocio el siempre se dedico al estilismo, trabajos que solo realizaba en sus ratos libres, pero al ver que no le quedaba de otra se dedico completamente al negocio de belleza desde hace 7 años, en el que le está funcionando muy bien. Los trabajos que realiza es corte de cabello, colocación de extensiones, uñas, tintes, mechas y peinados. En este momento requiere de un préstamo para comprar material para uñas, broches, tintes, peróxido y mas, de esta manera el tendrá suficiente material para poder realizar sus trabajos.
texts.en: Jose Luis is a hardworking young man who doesn't like to depend on anyone. Some years ago he started a business selling food, but he was in a place where the rent was very high and so he didn't have a lot of profit, which wasn't working for him. Aside from that business, he has always worked as a stylist in his free time, so seven years ago when he realized that the other business wasn't going to make it he decided to dedicate himself fully to the beauty business. It's going very well for him. He gives hair cuts, extensions, nails, hair coloring, highlights and hair styling. Right now he needs a loan to buy materials for nails, hair clips, dyes, peroxide and other things so that he will have enough supplies to be able to do his job.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for his business.

loans.name: Carolina Vladimir

texts.es:
Carolina, se encuentra acompañada y todavía no tiene hijos, su fuente de ingresos es la venta de comida en su localidad, su negocio está funcionando desde aproximadamente 15 años, no representa dificultades en desarrollar su trabajo ya que tiene mucha experiencia.
Comprará insumos para elaborar la comida tales como: verduras, aceite, carnes, pollo, condimentos, granos básicos, etc., con ello el inventario estará surtido, tendrá la facilidad de seguir trabajando y brindara a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
Carolina tiene  como visión administrar bien el crédito y tener un negocio más rentable para resarcir su deuda y tener un estilo de vida más digno junto a su pareja.
texts.en:
Carolina has a partner, and still has no children. 

Her source of income is the sale of food in her area. Her business has been operating for about 15 years. She does not have difficulties in developing her work, because she has a lot of experience.

She will buy supplies to make food such as: vegetables, oil, meat, chicken, spices, grains, etc. Thus the inventory will be stocked, she can easily continue working, and she will offer her customers a better service. Carolina's vision is to manage credit well, and have a more profitable business, to repay her debt, and to have a more dignified way of life with her family business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food such as: vegetables, oil, meat, chicken, spices, grains, etc.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en: Dorcas was born in Empuyiankat 43 years ago. She was raised in this village and missed to attend formal education because her parents did not see the importance of sending their daughter to school. She got married when she was 17 and she is lucky she has only 6 children. She is a Choir member of PCEA church Empuyiankat. Dorcas is a strong member of Inkiramat women groups and participates in every group activity. The group works with WEEC thus, they have been able to receive trainings on basic business skills and livestock management. After the training, Dorcas started a small retail shop, where she sells Vegetables and other basic household items. Dorcas and her husband also rear steers. On average the family keeps 10 steers and sells 3 every month. Due to the favorable climatic conditions and ready market, Dorcas wants to increase the number of steers to at least 20 in a period of eight months. She would like to buy 4 more medium size steers at a cost of USD450. The fattened Steers will be sold after 3 months and the proceeds will be used to purchase more steers. This will form a good capital base and will put the family in a better financial position.

loans.use: Dorcus wants to buy 4 medium size steers.

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en: Mahir S. lives in Agsu city and owns a small general store in the local bazaar. He opened up the store two years ago. He lost both his sister and brother during the conflict that left tens of thousands of people internally displaced.  Mahir currently supports not only his wife and two children, but also his parents as well as his brother's family. He hopes to use this loan to purchase more inventory and increase his business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Fiapaipai

texts.en: Fiapaipai runs a plantation at Vailoa-uta. She sells her crops to people in her village to earn a living to accommodate her growing family. Fiapaipai has many years experience in operating a vegetable plantation, so as a result her experience is used to expand and nurture her crops, and to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, string, seeds & crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Calixtas

texts.es:
My name is Calixta and I have a small business baking bread which I then sell from my home. I have been in business for several years and this business generates enough income to help with my family's living expenses. But the most important advantage is that it allows me to work from home and care for my children, who help me in their free time.

Thanks to the income I have generated, I have been able to make improvements to our home and raise my family's living standard. This loan will be used to buy more raw materials for my bread-baking business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Calixta, soy comerciante, mi actividad principal es la elaboración de pan (producto para consumo Humano), ubicado en mi casa de habitación, cuento con varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, lo mas importante es que este negocio me permite atender a mis hijos, los que me colaboran en su tiempo libre. Gracias a los ingresos que persivo he mejorado mi vivienda logrando asi un mejor nivel de vida para mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase firewood, flour, lard, sugar and eggs

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
JOSEFA is 38 years old. She has five children and works by decorating and making borders for handicraft blouses worn by locals in the region. She belongs to a solidarity group called Bajucu 1 together with Ms. Delina Hernández Méndez (handicrafts) y Ms. Carmelina Santiz López (handicrafts). With their loans they will invest in the purchase of thread in a variety of colors, more cloth, needles, and scissors.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

JOSEFA tiene 38 años, cinco hijos y se dedica al bordado de blusas artesanales característica de la región. Pertenece al grupo solidario llamado Bajucu 1 junto con doña Delina Hernández Méndez (artesana) y doña Carmelina Santiz López (artesana). Con sus prestamos invertirán en la compra de hilos en su variedad de colores, telas al por mayor, agujas y tijeras.

loans.use: Handicrafts

loans.name: Dodji

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dodji H., 35 years old, is married and the mother of three (03) children. For the last 8 years she has specialized herself in cereal storage. This activity is paying off and the profit she is making allows her to contribute to the household expenses. It also must be said that this income is, for the most part, used up by the household. To increase and secure that income, she would like to stock up bigger quantities. To do this she is requesting a loan of $250.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 35 ans, Madame Dodji H. est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Depuis 8 ans elle s’est spécialisée dans le stockage de céréales. C’est une activité qui lui est rentable et le profit qu’elle tire lui permet de contribuer aux charges du ménage. Il faut dire aussi ce revenu est en grande partie consommé par le ménage. Pour améliorer et sécuriser ce revenu, elle veut faire des stocks beaucoup plus importants. Pour cela elle sollicite un crédit de $250.

loans.use: Stocking up and sale of cereals

loans.name: Aladdin

texts.en: Aladdin was born in 1969. He is married and has three children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Armenian-occupied Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and is settled in the Fuzuli region. He has run his cattle-breeding business for five years. Now he needs a loan of $600 to buy one calf.

loans.use: To buy one calf

loans.name: Roger De La Trinidad

texts.es:
In the city of Chinandega, specifically in Chichigalpa, Mr. Roger Trinidad Cortes M. sells several products in his general store which he has managed to grow for 10 years with great effort. Like all startups, Mr. Trinidad had a rough time in the beginning when he had few products to sell. With time, he slowly increased the variety of products up until having a full stocked general store today.

As he advises us, his sole motive to run the store today is to provide for his humble family which is undergoing a tough economic situation. However, with the support of Mr. Trinidad they have the hope of raising up and moving on from the situation they are currently at.

CEPRODEL has been an inseparable companion of Mr. Trinidad. He has benefited from the credits he has obtained investing them in his business to purchase more products and improve the living conditions in his home. Currently, he has three credits with this financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


En la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente en Chichigalpa, el señor Roger de la Trinidad C. M. se dedica al negocio de venta de productos varios (pulpería) que con gran ahínco ha logrado administrar desde hace 10 largos años. Como todo inicio es duro, el señor Trinidad comenzó vendiendo pocos productos que luego los fue diversificando hasta llegar a tener la pulpería que hoy posee.

Según comenta, el único motivo por el cual se ha dedicado a este trabajo es para mantener a su humilde familia que atraviesa difíciles circunstancias económicas pero con el apoyo del señor Trinidad tienen esperanza de levantarse y salir de la situación en que se encuentran.

Ceprodel ha sido un inseparable apoyo para el señor Trinidad debido a que ha sido beneficiado con créditos que los ha invertido en su negocio para adquirir sus productos y además para mejorar las condiciones de su hogar. Actualmente posee una cuenta de tres créditos con esta institución financiera.

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Antofagasta Group

texts.es:
Antofagasta is the name of the association that unites 18 women, lead by Leonarda Beatriz P., and who have many different types of business.

Mainly, their activities include crafts and textiles, mainly using lamb's wool and alpaca wool. These products are sold in the main market in the city of El Alto, and some places in La Paz.

Unfortunately, raw material for these kinds of crafts is very expensive, especially when buying in small quantities. For this reason they need money to invest in buying raw material in bulk, which will definitely have a positive impact on their economies, reducing the cost of buying raw material.

It is only in this way that they will see an increase in their income, as at the moment their wares are selling well.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Antofagasta, es el nombre de la asociación que reúne a 18 mujeres liderizadas por la señora Leonarda Beatriz P. y que se dedican al comercio de todo tipo de productos.

Entre sus principales destrezas se encuentra la elaboración de artesanías, textiles, principalmente en lana de oveja y lana de alpaca. Estos productos son comercializados en la feria principal de la ciudad de El Alto, y en algunas zonas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Lastimosamente la materia prima para este tipo de artesanías, es muy costosa, y más cuando se realiza la compra por menor o por unidad. Por tal motivo, ellas precisan de capital para poder invertir en la compra de materia prima al por mayor, lo que definitivamente tendrá un impacto positivo en su economía, pues se reducirá el gasto que genera la compra de esta materia prima.

Solo de esta manera podrán ver un ligero incremento en sus ingresos, puesto que la venta de estos artículos por el momento es unitario.

loans.use: They need the capital to invest in buying mostly raw materials, which will definitely have a positive impact on their economies, and this will reduce their spending on this material.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru:
Umedjon N. lives in Gissar district. He is 26 and married with one child. He does not have a formal education, but he works as an on-demand apartment repairman. This job allows him to earn money, but the work is seasonal and there is not always demand for repairs. The money he earns is not enough to feed his family, so he also raises livestock. He keeps a few calves which he fattens and then sells back at the market for their meat. Umedjon has been in this business for three years. At the moment, he needs money to buy another pair of calves and increase his sales. He hopes to receive a loan and plans to pay it back within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Нуров Умеджон проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 26 лет , женат и имеет 1 ребенка. Образования не имеет, но зарабатывает ремонтом квартир на заказ. Но доход от этой деятельности не достаточный для того , чтобы можно было обеспечивать свою семью. Поэтому клиент еще подрабатывает разведением крупно -рогатого скота. Имеет несколько бычков , откормив которых Умед перепродает на базаре, на мясо. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 3 года.Сейчас клиенту нужны деньги , для того чтобы купить еще пару бычков, и увеличить товарооборот. Обратившись к нам клиент надеется получить кредит, а погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sang S. T., 24, is married with two little children and has started a business in 2005 selling household products and vegetables to the people in her area, making on average around $5 each day of net income. Her husband works very hard every day to help generate more income by working as a motor-taxi driver and generally can make about $5 per day of income. Mrs. Sang S. T. would like to start another business which will enable her to have another source of family income. She and her husband want to open a place where they can wash motor-bikes for the people in her community. Recently, this couple has taken out a loan to purchase an automatic motor-bike washer to run her new business.

Furthermore, she believes her business is blooming and generates better income because there will be a lot of unclean and muddy motor-bikes coming to her during this rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase an automatic motor-bike washer to start a new business

loans.name: Mirzosafar

texts.en: K. Mirzosafar is 51 years old. He is married with four children. Mirzosafar is a farmer. He is growing crops like onions, wheat, tomatos, cucumbers, potatos and others. He has been working the land for ten years. His wife, elder sons and a daughter help him with the business. Each year Mirzosafar grows crops sufficient for family consumption and for selling. Generating stable income, Mirzosafar is able to support his large family. Today he requests $600 for the term of 9 months. The loan shall be used for purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer. Mirzosafar thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to be accurate in the loan payment.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mak

texts.en: Mrs. Mak M. is a widow who lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works out of her home as a tailor, and can generate up to $15 US in revenue daily. She has six children, three of whom are married. Her oldest son lives in the United States, and her two other sons work as goldsmiths in Cambodia. Mrs. Mak is requesting a loan of $1,200 US so that she can purchase cloth for her business. The remaining money would be applied towards repairing her motorbike, which is her family's main source of transportation.

loans.use: To purchase additional cloth for her tailoring business and to repair a motorbike.

loans.name: Bwavumpologoma Lending Group

texts.en:
Esau W. is the treasurer of Bwavumpologoma Lending group in Kayunga. He is a teacher by profession teaching in Busaana Primary School, a privately owned school, where he gets a monthly pay. He is also a farmer with maize and bean plantations, as well as having a retail shop where he sells clothes of all kinds, shoes, luggage and handbags, bells and many other accessories. He is 40 years old and married with four children, the eldest being 13 years while the youngest is three. In all his businesses, he works with his wife.

Esau is our good client and he would like a loan to be able to add manpower to his plantain farm and partly to buy luggage bags for his shop. He will share this loan with the other members of his group.

loans.use: To employ more farm labor and to buy bags for a retail shop.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 47 years old. She is married with 6 children between 30 and 15 years old. She has been a handbags and juice seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 2pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more handbags and juice for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more handbags and juice for re-sale

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en: A. Shahodat is 53 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of five children. Shahodat is a market vendor. She started out eight years ago with only a few products, but her business is currently more stable. Shahodat is selling fruits and vegetables such as: pears, grapes, apples, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Her youngest daughter who is pictured in the photo helps Shahodat with the business. In the market she is known by people because of her attractive prices and friendly nature. All this allows Shahodat’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for her family. Now, her goods are in great demand. For this reason, she is planning to purchase new, fresh fruits and vegetables in order to restock her store, thus expanding her business. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan of $1000, which she will repay in 12 months. She hopes to increase her income in order to pay her children’s university fees. With your help, this will be possible. Shahodat would like to thank everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing fruits

loans.name: Pheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheang Y., age 30, grows yams in her grove. She typically makes about $6 each day by selling her yams to a broker. Her husband works as a recycler, buying recyclable items from different locations and reselling them to recycling plants. He can generate about $2.50/day for his household. Pheang Y. has three children who are enrolled in school.

She is applying for a loan of $1200 from KIVA, which she will use, along with her family's savings, to purchase a truck to use to carry her yams to market. This will allow her to carry much larger loads in each trip.

loans.use: To purchase a truck to use for her business transportation

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Sonia tiene 43 años, es conviviente con su esposo, tuvo cuatro hijos, de los cuales ahora viven con uno de ellos. Es de padres agricultores, ahora que tiene su esposo también realiza la misma actividad, se dedican a sembrar arvejas en mayor cantidad. Primero siembra papas y abona bien esas tierras, en seguida, en esa misma chacra siembra en grandes cantidades de arvejas, con la finalidad de aprovechar el abonado de la chacra. Sembrar arvejas le es más rentable, porque nos dice que es menos la inversión, por ello le gusta sembrar ese producto, lo más dificultoso es el alza de los fertilizantes, porque van con una determinada cantidad de dinero y no les alcanza. Este es préstamo Nº 7 con MFP, tiempo en el cual ha sido puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero comprará 8 sacos de “temex” producto que sirva para contrarrestar la gusanera de la papa, producto que cuesta cada uno S/.245, con el resto del dinero, comprará también pesticidas para las hojas de sus arvejas, lo que le costará S/.1,200.00, solo en pesticidas.
texts.en:
Sonia is 43 years old, lives with her husband, had 4 children, and now they live with one of them. Her parents where farmers, and now that she has her husband she also farms. Mostly they dedicate themselves to cultivating peas. First they plant potatoes and fertilize well that land, after which on that same small plot of land they plant peas in large quantities, with the aim to make the most of the fertilizer of their small farm. Plating peas is more profitable for them because it’s a smaller investment, and for that reason they like plating that crop. What is most difficult is purchasing fertilizer, because they go with a fixed amount of money and it is not enough. This is Sonia’s 7th loan with MFP, and she has been punctual with her payments. With this loan she will buy 8 sacks of “temex” a product that will help counteract the potato pest, which costs 245 PEN per sack. With the rest of the money, she will also buy pesticides for their pea leaves, which will cost 1,200.00 PEN.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase insecticides and pesticides for her crop

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 49 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos que la apoyan  mucho. Su dedicación a la venta de comida la viene realizando desde hace ya un año atrás, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una muy buena atención a sus clientes. Le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en un buen lugar y sobre todo cuenta con una clientela selecta que degustan de su buena sazón. Lo único difícil para ella, es no contar con un local para su restaurante, ya que lo adecua en un espacio de su casa. Es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir en las afueras de su domicilio una ramada (espacio cubierto con un techo de ramas) para vender su comida y además comprar mesas y sillas para dar una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma is 49-years-old. She is a single mother and lives with her three children, who support her very much. She has sold food for one year. What she likes about her job is giving good attention to her customers. Her business is profitable for her because it is in a good location, and above all, she has a select clientele that likes the good flavor of her food. The only difficult part for her is not having a location for her restaurant, since she has adapted a space in her house for it. This is her sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is punctual with her payments. With the money that she is requesting, she will have a ramada (a space covered with a roof of branches) constructed outside her house where she can sell her food. She will also buy tables and chairs to give good attention to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To implement an adequate space where she can sell her food

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo es socia del Bancomunal San Juan, Consuelo es soltera tiene dos hijos de 28 y 16 años la ultima esta en el colegio  ella se dedica hace 20 años a la venta de golosinas, gaseosa, cerveza, cigarro tiene un kiosco en la puerta de su casa  su mama le ayuda en su negocio, también hace ocho años ella tiene una micro empresa de tejido con varias amigas se llama “Manos Maravillosas” donde hacen tejidos de poncho carteras etc, hacen a pedido.

Nos cuenta que desde que esta in Finca tiene una visión mas clara de su negocio y le gusta por que hay unión entre las socias amistad y armonía los prestamos que Finca le da han ayudado a que su  negocio crezca.
Consuelo solicita un préstamo de 400.00 soles para surtir su Kiosco  con mercadera
El suelo de Consuelo es poner un puesto en el mercado de venta de pasamanería  y remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a member of the San Juan cooperative bank. She is single, and has two children ages 28 and 16; her youngest daughter is in school. For the past twenty years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of candy, sodas, beer, and cigars. She has a kiosk in the doorway of her house, and her mother helps her out with the business. Also, eight years ago she started a small knitting business with several friends which is called “Marvelous Hands” where they knit ponchos, purses, etc., or items on order. She tells us that since she’s become involved with Finca, she has a clearer vision for her business and she values the friendly and harmonious relationships with the other members. The loans Finca has provided have helped her to grow her business. Consuelo requests a loan of 400.00 Peruvian soles to supply her kiosk with wood. Consuelo’s dreams are to install a location at the market in Pasamanería and to renovate her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her kiosk.

loans.name: Grupo Francisca Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Francisca, compuesto por tres integrantes, Doña Francisca del Socorro S., Julia Argentina C. C. y Argentina del Socorro G. G., originarias de Masatepe, municipio de Masaya. Son mujeres con negocios en sus casas, con actividades de venta de Rosquillas, venta de leña y venta de refrescos.
Doña Julia Argentina vende rosquillas en su casa, las compra en un taller cercano y vende a clientes que llegan de otros municipios a comprarle, en el negocio solo participa ella, vive con su familia compuesta por su esposo y dos hijos que trabajan fuera de la casa  le ayudan con los gastos. El crédito lo necesita para comprar más rosquillas que tiene por encargo de unos clientes que lo llevan a Costa Rica. Piensa poder captar más clientes que le están recomendando. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace muchos años que la aprendió de su madre. Con esta actividad ella confía que muy pronto podrá comprar una vitrina para exhibir también cajetas y otros productos. Espera no fallar en sus pagos y poder mantener el crédito con Adim.
texts.en:
This group’s name is Francisca, and it has 3 members: Doña Francisca del Socorro S., Julia Argentina C. C. y Argentina del Socorro G. G., from Masatepe, municipality of Masaya. They are women with home business; they sell doughnuts, wood and sodas. Doña Julia Argentina sells doughnuts from her house, she buys them from a near by doughnut maker and sells them to clients from other municipalities who come to buy from her, she lives with her husband and two children who work outside the house and help her with her business. She needs the loan to buy more doughnuts for some clients who want to take them to Costa Rica. She learned this activity from her mother and she expects to buy a showcase for other products too. She won’t default on her payments and will keep a good credit with Adim.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her business to increase her sales

loans.name: Horoniya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du  groupe Horoniya (une veuve et trois mariées) ont en moyenne 42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent en majorité dans des familles monogames dans le quartier Rails ko de Markala (4ème région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues dans l’association traditionnelle Parissain qui veut dire "travailler ensemble" en dialecte Bobo. Elles font  la vente du riz, de pagnes, de tasses et la transformation des légumes (oignon, tomate).
Dans le souci d’améliorer leurs activités  économiques, elles ont décidé d’approcher Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont  à leur troisième prêt solidaire  après avoir bien remboursés les deux  prêts précédents. 
Elles comptent acheter, 6 pièces de 6 pagnes wax et des habits pour femmes. Elles s’approvisionnent  au grand  marché de Bamako(capitale du Mali) et effectuent leurs ventes  en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et dans les quartiers de Markala à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 28.000FCA qui sera utilisé pour  contribuer aux dépenses de la famille et investir le reste dans les affaires.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Horoniya is composed of one widow and three married women who average 42 years of age and 6 children. They live, for the most part, in monogamous families in the Rails Ko district of Markala (fourth region of the Republic of Mali). They got know one another in the association Parissain, which means "to work together" in the Bobo dialect. They sell rice, pagne cloth, tubs and basins, and they process vegetables (onions, tomatoes). Concerned about improving their commerce, the group members decided to approach Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their third solidarity loan after having repaid the two preceding ones. The group plans to buy six lengths of Wax-brand pagnes and some clothing for women. They supply themselves at the grand marketplace of Bamako (capital of Mali), and they sell the goods at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, out of the house and in the districts of Markala, to customers composed essentially of women. The group members envision realizing an average monthly profit of 28,000 francs CFA that will be used to help cover family expenses and to invest the rest in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagne cloth

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Albertina L. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su negocio de elaboracion y venta de tortillas las cuales son comercializadas por ella misma en su localidad donde a diario se desempeña.

A pesas de las dificiles situaciones economicas que ella ha atravesado ha logrado salir adelante y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima como lo es el maíz para continuar en su negocio de elaboración de tortillas.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Albertina L. works extremely hard making and selling tortillas. She markets the tortillas herself in her region and she does very well every day. Despite the difficult economic situations she has faced, she has succeded in coming out on top. This is why she has gone to Kiva Partner Ceprodel in order to get a loan to buy the basic materials such as corn in order to continue making tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha S. is a Tanzanian small business woman.  She runs a business selling charcoal to retail customers at Kisiwani ward in Dar es Salaam.  She purchases the charcoal wholesale directly from the producers.  Charcoal is the major source of power in most of the developing countries due to high cost of electricity which is also unstable.  She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business stock.

loans.use: Buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres en Accion” debe su nombre a las incansables trabajadoras que conforman este grupo.  Actualmente este es su 7mo ciclo, es decir tiene mas D. 2 años D. formacion y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya. Retiran ahora un crédito promedio D. 500.000 Gs y lo utilizaran para ampliar lo que ya estan realizando como ser: la compra D. tela , compra D. insumos para la fabricacion D. comestibles, compra D. leche, azucar, yerba, harina, sal, panificados y verduras para su posterior venta.  Tambien compran y venden bebidas como refrescos , gaseosas ,cervezas, vinos etc.

Las miembras son:

Maria Cristina O.	-  Vta D. cosméticos - 
Fany O. - Vta D. frutas y verduras - 
Crescencia F. -	Despensa - 
Rosa V.	 - Vta D. merceria - 
Ana Lia G. - Vta D. artesanias y merceria - 
Felicia D. - Vta D. comestibles - 
Gabriela D. M. -	Heladeria - 
Adela C. -	Vta D. frutas y verduras - 
Daiane D. - Vta D. comestibles - 
Gloria D. - Vta D. mercaderias varias - 
Angela G. - Vta D. frutas y verduras - 
Marilina L. - Vta D. juguetes inflables - 
Juana I. - Vta D. juguetes  - 
Amalia O. -	Vta D. chipas - 
Celia M. -	Fca y venta D. productos D. limpieza - 
Zunilda C.	Vta D. ropas -
texts.en:
The "Women in Action" committee owes its name to the tireless workers who comprise this group. They are currently in their 7th cycle, that is, they have been together and working with the Fundación Paraguaya for more than two years. On average, each woman receives a credit of $100 USD to grow their enterprise, for example with the purchase of textiles; purchase of foodstuffs; purchase of milk, sugar, herbs, flour, salt, breads and vegetables for resale. They also buy and sell refreshments, beer, wine, etc. The members are: Maria Cristina O. - Cosmetics - Fany O. - Fruits and Vegetables - Crescencia F. - Groceries - Rosa V. - Haberdashery - Ana Lia G. - Crafts and Haberdashery - Felicia D. - Foodstuffs - Gabriela D. M. - Ice Cream - Adela C. - Fruits and Vegetables - Daiane D. - Foodstuffs - Gloria D. - Various Merchandise - Angela G. - Fruits and Vegetables - Marilina L. - Inflatable toys - Juana I. - Toys - Amalia O. - ArcaD. - Celia M. - Cleaning products - Zunilda C. - Clothes -

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of milk, sugar, textiles for the manufacture of clothing, elaboration and sales of typical food such as: butifarra, morcilla, tortillas, pies, biscuits

loans.name: Venelanda

texts.en:
Venelanda has been a local seller in the Ruaha neighborhood of Iringa for 7 years. She belongs to Kinegamgosi B group loan (Group code 2001). Venelanda currently earns an average monthly profit of $80 and works 12 hours a day 7 days a week.

Venelanda is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Venelanda is 38 years old, married, and has four children: ages 19, 16, 11 and 9.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Aura Maria

texts.es: La Señora Aura A. tiene 36 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, madre soltera con dos hijas mujeres como madre soltera es muy difícil salir adelante sin apoyo del padre de las niñas. Los planes siempre son realizados en beneficio de sus hijas y la construcción de su vivienda es unos de ellos.Doña Aura tiene su pequeño negocio de variedad de producto como:cosméticos y otros.Gracias al préstamo que solicito en Afodenic lograra comprar nuevos productos: ropas, zapatos, perfumería, aumentando sus inventarios y obteniendo mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Comprar ropa, zapatos y perfumenes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es: Oscar Alberto N. J. reside en Apaneca en el departamento de Ahuachapán, uno de los lugares con más turismo del país. Vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad los cuales únicamente estudian. Él posee un vivero y tienda de productos perecederos en su casa, Oscar es una persona de muy buenas referencias, ya que es notable su esfuerzo diario por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Oscar solicita un préstamo ya que le es muy necesario contar con más variedad de plantas para aumentar sus ventas, así también desea poder comprar tierra y otros productos para el cuidado de flores, las cuales no solamente las vende en su vivero sino que también comercializa de manera ambulante en pueblos cercanos.
texts.en:
Oscar Alberto N. J. lives in Apaneca, in the department of Ahuachapán, one of the biggest tourist areas in the country. He lives with his wife and two school age children. He owns a plant nursery and a shop in his home in which he sells perishable goods. Oscar has great references because his daily efforts are notable in that wants to offer the best to his family. Oscar is requesting a loan because he needs a greater variety of plants to boost sales. He also wants to be able to purchase soil and other gardening products, which he sells not only in his nursery, but also as a street vendor in the nearby towns.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase stock/ expand business

loans.name: Edith Dina

texts.es:
La señora Edith, es socia del banco comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y esta al cuidado de 03 hijos, ella pudo estudiar solo la primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde la fundación del Banco Comunal, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir abarrotes tales como, azúcar, fideos, leche, conservas, harina, jugos, huevos, etc. Para su kiosco.

Su deseo es poder llenar su kiosco con mas productos y bien surtidos

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los encuentros.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the 30th of August cooperative bank, located in the Ilave district of El Collao, in Puno. She is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children in her care. She was only able to finish her education through primary school. She has been working with the Manuela R. movement since the establishment of the cooperative bank. Her first loan of 300 soles served the purpose of helping her buy groceries. Currently, she needs an additional loan of 3,000 soles to buy supplies such as sugar, noodles, milk, preserves, flour, juices, eggs, etc. for her kiosk. Her wish is to fill her store with more products and to keep it well-stocked. She enjoys the reunions and meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sugar, noodles, milk, preserves, flour, juices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, three sons and four daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a petty trader.

Stella is into the palm oil production business. Stella supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. She has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy A. is 40 years old. He is married to Lorena, who is a simple housewife. The couple have three children, Sherwin, age 14; Ron Ron, age 10; and Roy Jr., age 6. The children study in a public school, so Roy works hard to provide them with a daily school allowance.  

In addition to tilling their small farm, Roy also raises native chickens. His simple businesses makes things great for his family, so he wants to maintain them. 

Roy was motivated to request financial assistance from Kiva lenders to support his poultry business. This loan of  PHP 5,000 has already been a big help because it is allowing him to build a chicken house and purchase feed. He is doing everything so that he can send his children to school until college.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
