María Concepción Holguín Cedeño es  socia del Banco Comunal Dinámicas  ubicado en el cantón  Tosagua a una hora de Portoviejo  en la Provincia de Manabí. 

 María Concepción es una mujer  dedicada a la costura,  profesión que desarrolla  desde que era soltera, ella  junto a su esposo  viven de  esta profesión desde hace muchos años, en los actuales momentos el esposo esta delicado de salud y es ella  quien continua con esta labor, cose ropa para damas y camisas  para caballeros. 

La sastrería la tiene en su  casita propia ubicada en el centro de la ciudad de Tosagua, y es María Concepción la que tiene que solventar los gastos del hogar con el apoyo de sus hijos  que actualmente adquirieron un disco móvil para ayudarse económicamente debido que ahora la gente prefiere comprar ropa ya confeccionada en boutique y eso a hecho disminuir  un poco el negocio.

El préstamo que la señora María  Concepción esta solicitando será para invertir en sus dos negocios, uno en materiales de costura como tela, hilos, cierres, botones, etc.  y lo demás para comprar una pantalla gigante para su disco móvil  y un ecualizador.
texts.en:
María Concepción Holguín Cedeño is a member of the "Dinámicas" Community Bank located in the territory of Tosagua one hour from Portoviejo in the province of Manabí. María Concepción is a woman who is dedicated to sewing, a profession that she developed since when she was single. She and her husband have lived off this profession for many years. Currently, her husband is in delicate health and it is she who continues with this work. She sews clothing for women and shirts for men. The tailor shop that she has in her own little home is located in the center of the city of Tosagua and it is María Concepción who has to pay the bills with the support of her children who recently acquired a mobile disco to help them economically since right now people prefer to buy pre-made clothing from a boutique and this has caused business to slow down. The loan that María Concepción is requesting will be invested in her two businesses: one in sewing materials such as fabric, thread, closures, buttons, etc. and the rest to buy a gigantic screen for her mobile disco and an equalizer.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials such as fabric, thread, closures, buttons, etc. and the rest to buy a gigantic screen for her mobile disco and an equalizer.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es de ocupación  agricultor de hortalizas y productor de leche, misma que comercializa con Pil Andina, para su posterior transformación en productos derivados del mismo (queso, yogurt, etc.), la esposa tiene la misma ocupación que el esposo, tienen 4 hijos en edad escolar, viven en casa propia de adobe ubicado en la comunidad El Palomar.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para poder aumentar la producción de leche e incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Juan.

loans.use: Compra de una vaca lechera para aumentar su producción de leche.

loans.name: Doem

texts.en:
Doem D., age 57 (picture with his wife) and his wife Norn Thuch, age 57, live in a small village off of National Road number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have five sons and one daughter. Three of them are married and live outside the home, three attend school and another is a construction worker. 
 
Doem has been driving a motor taxi for 15 years.  Norn has sold fruits for 10 years. His motorbike is connected to a trailer at the rear. He carries goods and people from his village to Phnom Penh City and back.  Doem is applying for his first loan of $500 to add to his own savings to purchase a motorbike for his son to drive to work.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle for his son to drive to work.

loans.name: Mrs. Sdeurng Ngay Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sdeurng N. lives in Chrouy village in Takeo province: she is the group leader of four people who all live in this village. Mrs. Sdeurng N. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Sam Dara, is a fisherman who earns a small income to support the family. Although they try to work hard they still earn less than the income needed to support the family.

Thus, Mrs. Sdeurng N. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn income. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other child, aged five years old, is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn income.

loans.name: Nop

texts.en: Nop S. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and five children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are tailors who are able to make about US$6 of profit every day. Four of her children are in school and one is a garment factory worker. Nop S. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase cloth to make clothes. (Nop S. is pictured with her husband from home)

loans.use: To purchase cloth.

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es:
Nuestra socia AYDE tiene 27 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” de la Asociación Arariwa.      
 
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de yuca. Ella tiene su stand en el mercado de “Cascaparo” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella se levanta muy temprano para comprar mercadería de los mayoristas. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Todos los días vende en el mercado, ya tiene sus clientes fijos que son muy exigentes con el producto y para esta época del año es cuando más vende. Nuestra socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más yuca. 
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
AYDE, 27, lives with her life partner. She is from Cusco and a member of Asociación Arariwa's “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” communal bank. She alternates her domestic responsibilities with the sales of yuca (cassava or manioc) from her stand in Cusco's "Cascapara" market. She rises very early in the morning to buy her merchandise from the wholesalers. She has been in this line of work for several years now and has done well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. She sells in the market everty day; has her regular customers, who are very selective with the product, especially this time of year, which is when sales are highest. She is a hard-working, enterprising woman who struggles to get her family ahead in life. She needs financing to buy more yucca. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yucca.

loans.name: Nicole

texts.fr: A. Nicole est née le 22 Décembre 1978 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Nicole vit depuis près de 7 ans au quartier Finagnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à FAÏHOUN Justin, un soudeur, Nicole est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Finagnon. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Nicole a été à l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire, et a appris ensuite la coiffure. Nicole mène également comme activité, la vente de mèches, des produits de beauté et des produits pour cheveux à son domicile. Nicole s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Nicole mène cette activité depuis environs 10 ans, et a obtenu déjà une fois de crédit, qu'elle a bien remboursé à ALIDé. Nicole sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Nicole A. was born on December 22 1978 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Nicole has lived for almost seven years in the Finagnon neigbourhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Justin Faihoun, a welder. Nicole has two children who attend school. The family lives together in Finagnon. The couple share the household expenses. Nicole attended school until High School and then studied hairdressing. Nicole also sells hair extensions, beauty products and hair products from her home. Nicole gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Nicole has done so for roughly 10 years and has one previous loan with Alidé, which she repaid in full. Nicole is asking for this second loan from Alidé in order to increase her stock and be better prepared to meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions as well as beauty and hair products.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en: Flor B.'s main source of income comes from selling household products like soap, toilet cleaner and more in her community. She is 25 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. Flor has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Flor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Flor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase products to sell. Flor is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Reidelinda

texts.es:
La Sra. Reidelinda, tiene 63 años, vive en el Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” y presenta estudios hasta segundo grado de primaria, es viuda, tiene 4 hijos todos ya independientes. 
Reidelinda lleva 10 años dedicándose al negocio de frutas, se encuentra ubicado en un mercado cerca de su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles compró naranjas en cientos, limones en sacos y plátanos en racimos.
Con este crédito de S/. 2,000.00, Nuevos Soles comprará frutas cómo: naranjas en cientos, carambolas (fruta silvestre de la selva), plátanos de seda, piñas, guayabas brasileras, etc. Y así satisfacer a su clientela, que día a día acuden a su puesto de ventas.
Reidelinda, se siente muy contenta por el trabajo que realiza, el buen producto que vende le ha proporcionado clientela fiel. La Socia sueña con tener su local propio en su casa. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que le brindan a ella y a otras mujeres más que lo necesitan, en iniciar e implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Reidelinda, 63, lives in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cásceres province, San Martín department. She belongs to the Santa Rosa de Lima Communal Bank. She has a second grade education. She is a widow, and she has four independent children. Reilinda has been in the business of selling fruit for ten years. Her business is located in the market close to her house. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought oranges by the hundreds, sacks of lemons, and bunches of bananas. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy fruit like oranges by the hundreds, “carambolas” (a wild jungle fruit), plantains, pineapples, and Brazilian guavas, etc. That way she will satisfy her customers who come to her stand day to day. Reilinda is very happy with the work she does. The good product that she sells has given her loyal customers. The member dreams of having her own place to sell from in her house. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the support they give her, and other women who need it, to start and establish their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits to stock her business

loans.name: Ariana María

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote en León, la señora Ariana M. se dedica a trabajar en un centro de labores y ha iniciado a incrementar sus esfuerzos para mejorar las condiciones de su núcleo familiar compuesto por sus tres hijos.
Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que esta requiere a lo inmediato de inversión. Es por esta razón que con dicho crédito comprará 20 láminas de zinc y otros materiales de construcción y también pagará la mano de obra que le realizará el trabajo. Ella espera ser beneficiada con el crédito y así mejorar sus condiciones del negocio.
texts.en:
In the town of Nagarote within the Department of León, Sra. Ariana M. is employed at a work center. She has started to invest more effort into improving the conditions for her three children.

Ariana is requesting a loan to make immediate improvements to her house. The money will be used to purchase 20 sheets of zinc (corrugated roofing material) and other construction materials. She will also pay for the labor needed to complete the job. She expects the loan to be of benefit and help improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for materials & labor to make improvements

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen C. is from Barangay R. G. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte Province. She is 35 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Carmen owns and operates a business recycling empty bottles in the community. Carmen has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carmen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carmen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital for the business

location.town: Sindangan-R.J. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Kyebajja Tobona General Traders Group, Jinja

texts.en:
M. Ziita, shown at the top left in the small photo is the leader of her lending group although she does not appear in the big group photo.

M. Ziita is an enterprising 47-year-old, married local-brew seller. Like many others, her future plan is to build herself a permanent house and fully provide for all her children’s educational needs. She has six children under her care, with only one attending school.

Being a hardworking woman, Ziita thinks she can establish a business niche for herself in the course of time, with some support rendered to her. She highlights the ever-changing preference for other drinks by her customers as a major setback. This, at times, leaves her with no serious customers at all on some days.

Ziita operates her business from Masese in Jinja and she belongs to the Kyebajja Tobona General Traders’ Group. Her business generates profits of 300,000 Ugandan shillings per month and she cites the good quality of her brew and her good customer care skills as her vantage point.

With a loan of 450,000 shillings she anticipates making substantial strides in her business by buying more raw materials like bananas and yeast for better productivity.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like bananas and yeast for making local brew

loans.name: Alvina

texts.es:
Alvina, tiene 59 años y tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre responsable que buscó a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

Alvina alterna sus actividades del hogar con su trabajo D. atender la biblioteca municipal D. la ciudad D. Urubamba y también se dedica a la producción y venta artesanía.  La socia nos cuenta con mucha pena que el negocio bajo en un 80% y que le devolvieron mercadería. La causa D. la baja D. turismo es por las fuertes precipitaciones fluviales que cayeron en la ciudad haciendo que turistas cancelaran sus a viajes al Cusco.   

Alvina pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” D. la Asociación Arariwa. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo lana y tela.  El anhelo D. la socia es exportar sus productos y sacar profesionales a sus hijos.    

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alvina is 59 years old and has four children. She is a responsible mother who always looks for opportunities to get ahead and works daily to give her children a better future. Alvina alternates her housework with her work at the municipal library in Urubamba city and also produces and sells craftwork. The member sadly tells us that the business has decreased by 80% and that her merchandise has been returned. The cause in the drop in tourism is from the torrential rain that fell in the city making the tourists cancel their trips to Cusco. Alvina belongs to the “TERCER MILENIO” communal bank of the Arariwa Association. The member needs the loan to buy more materials such as wool and fabric. The member's wish is to export her products and that her children become professionals. The member is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means and promises to fulfill the payments according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Alvina wants the loan to buy more materials such as wool and fabric.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama K. is a mother of 4 children, age 33, and lives in New site, an area in Waterloo. She sells plywood for making tables and chairs. Her husband does the same kind of business to support the family. 

Adama has established a good profile with LAPO,SL, hence she has taken five loans already. Moreover, she has been in this business for 15 years and loves it so much that she cannot switch over to another kind of business.

Adama is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Leones to improve her business and help her family.

loans.use: Plywood to make tables and chairs

loans.name: José

texts.es: José E. G., tiene la edad de 39 años, está en unión libre, y vive con su esposa y su hijo de 4 años de edad, y son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don José también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
José E. G. is 39 years old and lives with his common law wife and their four year old son, who are his highest priority. This loan will be used to help maintain his farm, specifically for the purpose of growing coffee. José plans to buy compost and fertilizer so that he can adequately maintain his coffee crop. This will result in better quality and the highest possible price when it comes time to harvest. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services that have been provided. Don José has worked many years in agriculture. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater financial stability. In addition, he wants to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers for his coffee crop

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer M. is from the village of Tumpagon Cagayan de oro City. He is 38 years old. Elmer is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Elmer owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elmer has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elmer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elmer is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elmer from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijas, Yeny de 9 y Nipta de 4 años de edad respectivamente. Juntas viven en la ceja de la selva peruana, ubicada en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, donde tienen  su propia casa a base de madera. Hace 20 años trabajaba en la actividad agrícola, en donde cultiva y comercializa cacao. Recuerda que empezó con una pequeña parcela en donde solo lo alcanzaba para su canasta familiar, hoy produce de manera considerable a los grandes mayoristas y por tal obtiene buenas ganancias económicas. 

Es entonces que al percibir y ahorrar estas ganancias, pudo abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes con la finalidad de cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Por tanto su mayor anhelo es abastecer su tienda y ampliar sus plantaciones de cacao, con el propósito de ganar más, tanto clientes como posicionarse en el mercado. Por el momento se encuentra a cargo de su tienda de abarrotes, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus padres. por otro lado contrata peones para que se encarguen de sus campos de cacao y puedan facilitarle la extracción de su producto terminado, en donde es comercializado en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando de manera puntual, además se siente respaldado por su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería, para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes, con la necesidad de poder cubrir los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hilda is 40 years old and the single mother of two daughters: Yeny, age 9, and Nipta, age 4. They live together on the edge of the Peruvian jungle, in the community of Manitea Alta, where they have their own wooden house. For the past 20 years, Hilda has worked in agriculture, growing and selling cocoa. She recalls that she began with only a small parcel of land, which only served to cover her own consumption. Today, she produces and sells on a significant scale, dealing with large wholesalers, and in this way she obtains excellent economic returns. She saved her profits and thus was also able to open a small grocery store with the aim of satisfying her customers' needs. In the future, Hilda hopes to expand both her grocery store and her cocoa fields, with the aim of attracting more customers and positioning herself better in the market. Toward this aim, she works tirelessly on her business. For the moment, she runs her store herself, though she occasionally receives help from her parentr. At harvest time, she needs assistance from hired laborers to get the work done and help transport the crops to the warehouses where they are sold. This is Hilda's fifth loan with MFP, and she is committed to continue being punctual with her payments. She feels well-supported by her communal bank group. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy merchandise to stock her store, so that she can satisfy the tastes and preferences of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products to stock her store

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La señora Benedicta V. tiene 39 años está casada con el señor Ronal Ortiz y tiene tres niños de siete años, de cinco y la más pequeña de tres años, ella vive en Colcapirhua una provincia de la ciudad de Cochabamba en la localidad de Sumunpaya, ella se dedica a la producción de leche y elaboración de quesillo.

Benedicta es una persona muy trabajadora hace como dos meses atrás la operaron de varices, porque ella no podía caminar ya que le afectaba a los pies pero su esposo don Ronal decidió que era momento de operarse y verla mejor a su esposa y de esa manera ella podría cuidar a sus niños y guiarlos en su educación, pero ese tiempo de recuperación bajo mucho la entrega de leche y elaboración de quesillos porque su esposo trabajaba y el no podía dedicarse a la producción de leche ella lo hacia lo mejor que podía con ayuda de su hijo.

Ella requiere el crédito para la compra de cascara de soya ya que ahora ella puede trabajar más y si les da una buena alimentación a las  vacas ellas darán más producción y ella podrá aumentar sus ingresos y de esa manera ayudar con los gastos y la educación de sus hijos, porque ellos sueñan con que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor y puedan terminar el colegio y realizar una carrera Benedicta sueña con que su hija pueda ser una excelente doctora y así ayudar a las personas de bajos recursos y en especial a los niños de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ms. Benedicta V. is 39 years old and is married to Mr. Ronal Ortiz. They have three children, ages 7, 5, and 3. She lives in the community of Sumunpaya, in Colcapirhua, in the Department of Cochabamba. She works in the production of milk and fresh cheese. Benedicta is a very hard-working person. Two months ago, she had an operation for varicose veins because she could not walk, as it affected her feet. Her husband, Ronal, decided it was at the point where she needed to have the operation so that she could get better, to care for their children and to guide their education. However, their milk and cheese production has really fallen during her recovery, because her husband has another job and can't dedicate himself to their dairy business. Benedicta has done the best she can, with the help of her son. Now that she is able to work more, Benedicta is requesting this loan to buy soybean husk to feed her cows. If she provides the cows with nutritional food, they will produce more milk and she can increase her income. This would allow her to help with the household expenses and to pay for her children's education. She dreams that her children will have a better future, be able to finish high school, and become professionals. Benedicta imagines that her daughter would make an excellent doctor, and in this way could help low-income people, especially the children of their community.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soy husk (to feed her milk cows)

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is 54 years old and works very hard to help her husband with fulfilling the needs of her family. She does embroidery work and is very good at her art. Due to her quality work, she is often able to receive good orders to earn a reasonable income. 

Her husband sells fruits on a four wheeled-cart in different streets of Pakpattan, where Khursheed bibi has lived all through her life. Her husband wants to buy some seasonal fruits to continue the cycle of his living. For this purpose, Khursheed has applied for a loan for the fourth time from Asasah. She hopes that the investment will prove successful for her husband’s business and he will be able to enhance his business and generate a good profit on it.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal fruits for reselling

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: La Señora Soledad es una persona trabajadora y con muchos ánimos de hacer crecer su negocio, ella y su esposo tienen un local en donde venden ropa usada y aparatos electrónicos, viven solos en su vivienda y son una pareja muy unidos, ellos requieren de este crédito para invertir en su negocio, La señora Soledad quiere comprar mas mercancía para la venta y así incrementar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Soledad is a hard-working woman with a great desire to make her activity grow. She and her husband own a stall where they sell used clothes and electrical appliances. They live alone in their house and they are very close as a couple. They will use the requested loan to invest in their activity. Soledad wants to buy more products to sell in order to increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Donald

texts.es:
El señor S. N. labora para AFUNIC, donde se desempeña como coordinador técnico, es soltero tiene una persona a su cargo.
CEPRODEL me ha otorgado 3 creditos dos han sido para gastos médicos , de mi madre y mios, el otro parra compra de electrodomésticos para mi hogar. 
Agradezco a CEPRODEL por la oportunidad de mejorar mis condiciones de vida y la de mi familia.
texts.en:
S. N. works as a technical coordinator for AFUNIC. He is single and has one person under his care. “CEPRODEL has granted me three previous loans. Two have been for my mother’s and my medical expenses, and the third for some small household appliances. I appreciate the opportunities that CEPRODEL has given me to improve my living conditions and those of my family.”

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Health expenses

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, is single, and lives with his family.

He has operated a supermarket since 1994. His dad used to own a food market so he gained a good experience in the business. He is well known in his local community and has good manners.

He is requesting a loan of $1,800 from Kiva partner, CHF-ACSI, which he wants to invest in renovating his store. His purpose is to grow his business and expand it in the future.

loans.use: To renovate his store

loans.name: Fagasau

texts.en:
Fagasau K. is 69 and married with two children.  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Fagasau has many years of experience in this business.  She needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Fagasau joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fagasau's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Rwemengo Tumanyane Group, Ibanda

texts.en: Prosper K. is a member of the Rwemengo Tumanyane loan group (pictured here) and a 53-year-old married father with seven boisterous children. To meet his large family's expenses, he has operated a grocery store in the Rwemengo Trading Centre for the last ten years. Mostly, he sells bananas and coffee. His business has done well but has also faced many challenges, including the absence of a regular revenue source. However, his business has remained successful because of Prosper's hard work and attention to customer relations. He makes 120,000 Ugandan shillings a month, and has applied for a loan to restock and expand his store so that he can increase his income.

loans.use: to restock and expand his grocery store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine M. owns and operates a grocery store. She is 45 years old, married and has six school-aged children. They are from the village of Napilan, Sapang Dalaga. Josephine has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC which was used as additional capital for her business. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used to purchase new stock to sell. This will be her seventh loan from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the store

loans.name: Yostasi

texts.en: Yostasi, age 40, is a married man with five children living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He raises cattle and also buys more for reselling at a margin. He wants his children to study for a better future. He wants a loan to buy more cattle for reselling.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to resell

loans.name: Fatoumata Bintou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Bintou H. est âgée de 26 ans,  mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  avec son mari, ses enfants et plusieurs ménages au 2ème quartier de la ville de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné  l’école  en classe de 9ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien)  pour se marier par volonté parentale, elle débuta le petit commerce juste après son mariage. Elle mène depuis maintenant 7 ans cette activité de vente d’habits de tous genres et jouit d’une grande réputation et notoriété. 
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 18 mois,  après 3 prêts solidaires   bien remboursés. Elle  est à son 1er  prêt individuel  qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 100 complets pour enfants. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. 
Madame Fatoumata Bintou H. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  de femmes majoritairement. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA, qui servira à rembourser son prêt et à aider son, mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.  Son ambition est de donner plus d’élan à son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Bintou H. is 26 years old, married and the mother of three. She lives in a traditional extended family with her husband, her children and several relatives in the second district of the town of Ségou (the fourth administrative district of Mali).

Having left school in the 9th year of general studies (in Mali’s educational system) in order to get married in accordance with her parents’ wishes, she started her business right after her marriage.  With 7 years of experience selling all types of clothing, she is well-known now and enjoys a good business reputation. In the goal of increasing her working capital so as to better meet customer demand, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She has been with Soro Yiriwaso for 18 month and obtained three solidarity loans, all well repaid. She is now on her first individual loan, which she plans to use for purchasing 100 infant’s outfits. She stocks up in Bamako. 

Mrs. Fatoumato Bintou H. sells for cash and on credit to a customer based composed mainly of women.
She plans to achieve a monthly income of 75,000 West African francs, which will be used to repay her loan and to help her husband with household expensive. She strives to reinvigorate her business.

loans.use: Purchasing children's clothing

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo D. C., Sr. is from the village of Saranay, Cabatuan, Isabela. He is 62 years old. Danilo is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Danilo owns and operates a  fishing business, raising tilapia and selling it to the market and to community members. Danilo has been engaged in his business for more than 13 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Danilo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken by Danilo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About ASKI: 
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
El señor Máximo vive en casa alquilada con sus hijos en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, esta separado de la esposa y vive con sus hijos; trabaja como soldador en una empresa donde percibe un salario mínimo. Máximo pidió un préstamo anteriormente con el cual se compro una soldadora con la cual trabaja independientemente para poder generar mejores ingresos.

El crédito que solicita es para darle a su hija capital de operación para que ella inicie un negocio de venta de juguetes.


Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Máximo lives in a rented house with his children in La Paz’s Pasankeri area.  He’s separated from his wife and lives with his children.  He's employed as a Welder in a firm earning minimum wage.

Máximo requested a loan previously that he used to buy a welding machine.  He uses it to work independently thus earning better income.

This loan he’s asking for is to give his daughter working capital so that she can start a business selling toys.

He is a well-paying Impro client and his social characteristics qualify him for a loan.

loans.use: To buy toys to set his daughter up in business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia, D. 40 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. pupusas como fuente D. ingresos para su hogar, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán, ella vive con sus cuatro hijos: Rony D. 18 años, Nilson D. 17, Wilson D. 13, José Miguel D. 4 años D. edad, es madre soltera, y tiene cinco años D. dedicarse a la venta, con un horario D. 5:00am a 11:am, todos los días D. la semana, inicio gracias a su madre que le enseño la preparación D. los ingredientes para poder hacer las pupusas.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. una cocina con plancha y también ingredientes para la venta, como tomates, cebollas, maíz, chiles entre otros que son necesarios para la preparación D. las pupusas, esta inversión le ayudara a generar más ingresos a su hogar y a brindar un mejor servicio y atención a los clientes.
Su objetivo es ser buen cliente pagando en las fechas establecidas, ahorrar D. las ganancias para mejorar la vivienda y seguir velando por el bienestar D. sus hijos que continúen estudiando hasta que logren terminar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 40 years old and she sells pupusas. It is a source of income for her household. She lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the Morazan region. She lives with her four children: Rony, 18; Nilson, 17; Wilson, 13; and, Jose Miguel, 4. She is a single mother and she has had her business for the past five years. She works from 5:00am to 11am every day of the week. She started out thanks to her mother who taught her how to prepare the ingredients to make pupusas.

She requests a loan to purchase a stove with a grill surface and to purchase ingredients, including: tomatoes, onions, corn, hot peppers, and other ingredients that are necessary to make pupusas. This investment will help her generate more income for her household and to proviD. better service and attention to her clients.

Her goal is to be a good client and to make payments in the dates that were agreed on, to save money to improve their home, and to keep working hard for the welfare of her children, to keep them in school until they graduate from university.

loans.use: To purchase a stove and ingredients to make pupusas.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
José, tiene 47 años de edad, reside en Santa Elena, departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 21 y 18 años de edad, todos trabajan y contribuyen con los gastos del hogar, José inicio con el negocio de la ganadería y agricultura con la ayuda de un compadre quien se ha dedicado a la ganadería, hoy día este negocio es la fortaleza económica del hogar.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ganado de repasto para comercializarlo dentro de algún tiempo. Esta compra le permitirá ampliarse con su ganadería con oportunidad de darse a conocer con otros ganaderos de la zona.
José quiere ser un gran ganadero, dedicarse por completo al cuido del ganado para obtener ganancia de su comercio, así también permanecer con su familia y trabajar juntos por una mejor condición.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old and lives in Santa Elena in the department of Usulután.  He lives with his wife and two children, ages 21 and 18.  They all work and help pay for household expenses.  José began his cattle raising and farm business with the help of a friend.  This is now the main source of income for the family.

He is requesting the loan to buy more livestock that he can sell over time.  This will allow him to expand his business and get to know other cattle farmers in his area.

José wants to be a great cattle farmer and dedicate all of his time to raising livestock to earn a living and stay close to family, working together to improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Katty Maritza

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Katty  es socia fundadora del Banco comunal,  hace dos ciclos se desempeña como fiscal de reglamentos del Banco y le gusta por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 32 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene un  hijo de nueve años  de edad el mismo que  estudia en la  escuela. Ella vive en casa de su madre.

Trabaja en una peluquería de lunes a sábado desde las 9h00 hasta las 19h00 y el día domingo se dedica a la venta de carne en un puesto que tiene en el mercado de Charapoto, ese dia ella empieza su faena desde las 04h00 hasta las 15h00, pero el dia anterior desde las 15h00 ella se encarga de ir a comprar la vaca para llevarla al camal municipal para que la misma sea faenada y así tener la carne para la venta del dia siguiente, nos cuenta que es una tarea muy dura para una mujer pero que tiene que hacerlo por su bien y  de su hijo,  viene realizando esta actividad desde hace cinco años.

Este crédito es para comprar una vaca para tener carne para la venta del dia domingo. Sus sueños es tener su casa propia y que su hijo sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Katty is a founding member of the Virgen de Guadalupe communal bank which meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This location is known for its traditional culture and for being just minutes away from two of the province’s best beaches: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

For the last two years she’s been the financial overseer of the bank.  She likes it because of the ease of loans.  She is 32 years old, separated and has a nine year old son who is in school.  She lives in her mother’s house.

She works in a barber shop from Monday through Saturday from 9am until 7pm.  On Sundays she sells meat in a small stand she has in the Charapoto market.  On that day her work schedule starts at 4am and continues until 3pm but on the day before she starts at 3pm going out to buy a cow to take to the municipal slaughterhouse to be butchered so she can have meat available to sell the next day.  She tells us that this is very heavy work for a woman but she has to do it for her own and her son’s wellbeing.  She has been doing this activity for the last five years.

This loan is to buy a cow to have meat to sell on Sunday.  Her dream is to have a house of her own and that her son becomes a great professional.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Mrs. Sophea was born in 1976 and is married to Mr. Leng who was born in 1979. They have four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school. The others are too small to work or study. She is a weaver and a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice. She sells some of the rice yield and the rest her family uses. In the rice field, she has some problem because her field has infertile soil. So to improve her rice production, Mrs. Sophea is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. Her husband is a construction worker. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a cow.

loans.name: Ma Taide

texts.es:
La señora María Taide E. P., vive en coapilla  estado de Chiapas México,  en un lugar bonito  donde hay mucha vegetación, ella es madre soltera con un hijo a su responsabilidad de nombre Francisco Javier  de tan solo dos años de edad.
    
    Solicito el préstamo para invertirlo  en la compra de ingredientes como son: harina, aceite, huevos, azúcar, queso, leche, entre otros, para la elaboración de panes, para luego venderlo en la misma localidad. 
   
    Con esta actividad lleva tres años y seis meses, en donde comenta que le va bien y hace unos meses que inicio con su taller de costura ya que también pueda elaborar blusas y vestidos.

    Taide inicio esta actividad para sostenerse con los ingresos y así poder darle lo mejor a su hijo que está creciendo ya que desafortunadamente en viudo cuando estaba embarazada de cinco mes  y tuvo que buscar la manera de sostenerse.

    Con la ganancia que va obteniendo lo invierte en la misma actividad y con  lo que le queda  lo utiliza para cubrir sus gastos que se dan dentro de su pequeña familia.

    Lo que más desea es que logre ahorrar para aumentar su actividad, par que mejor sea sus ingresos, como también de eso mismo poyarse para seguir trabajando y darle una buena educación  a su hijo.
texts.en:
María Taide E. P. lives in Coapilla in the state of Chiapas, Mexico in a beautiful place where there is a lot of vegetation. She is a single mother and has one son for which she is responsible. His name is Francisco Javier and he is just two years old. 
    
She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as flour, oil, eggs, sugar, cheese and milk among others which she will use to make bread and then sell in the same locality. 

She has been doing this work for three years and six months. She says that she does well and a few months ago she also started a sewing workshop since she can also make blouses and dresses. 
   
Taide started this business to support herself with the income so that she could provide the best to her growing son because unfortunately she was widowed when she was five months pregnant and she had to find a way to support herself. 

She re-invests her profits in her business and she uses what remains to cover her small family's expenses. 

What she most desires is to save to expand her business so that she can improve her profits and to keep working so that she can provide her son with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make breads and to purchase materials for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina, tiene 65, es viuda, con 5 hijos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Unión II.
Solicita un crédito D. S/. 3000.00.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. mercaderías como: Arroz, azúcar, fideos, conservas, harina, huevos, aguas gaseosas, helados, cerveza, entre otros.
Justina antes era feriante, pero desD. el año 1991 decidió abrir una pequeña bodega en su casa y poco a poco lo fue surtiendo.
Ingresó a FINCA Perú, por la invitación D. una amiga. Lo que más le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro, la enseñanza D.  valores y los momentos gratos que pasa con sus con socias.
Ahora está ahorrando para la construcción del segundo piso D. su casa. Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Justina is 65 years old, she is a widow, she has 5 children and she is a member of the Banco Comunal Unión II (Union II Communal Bank).
She is requesting a loan of 3000.00 PEN.
The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of products such as rice, sugar, noodles, canned foods, flour, eggs, sparkling waters, ice-creams and beer among others.
Until 1991 Justina was a trader, but then she decided to open a small grocery store in her house, and little by little she has been furnishing it ever since.
She entered into FINCA Peru thanks to the invitation from a friend. What she likes the most in the motivation to saving, the values they teach and the pleasant moments she spends with her fellow members.
She is currently saving to have the second floor of her house built, and she hopes for her activity to keep on growing.

loans.use: To buy products to supply her grocery store shop.

loans.name: Lucilo Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Lucilo Nicolás C., tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en el barrio los Martínez, ubicado en el municipio de la concepción , junto a su esposa la cual es comerciante de frutas y verduras para poder apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar ya q ellos tiene cinco hijos , los dos mayores le apoyan con los trabajos del campo , los planes hacia un futuro es poder establecer diversos cultivos para poder obtener ingresos todo el año , ya que tiene 23 años de dedicarse al cultivo de  piña y es casi 18 meses para poder ver parte de lo invertido , agradece a Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva el financiamiento que se le otorga para poder darle mantenimiento  a sus cultivo para que estos no carezcan de fertilizantes e insumos y cuando salga la producción tenga una buena maduración y color para vender a un mejor precio y poder pagar en tiempo y forma su crédito .
texts.en:
Sr. Lucilo Nicolás C. is 49 years old and resides in the neighborhood of Los Martínez in the town of La Concepción. He lives with his wife who works as a fruit and vegetable merchant in order to help with the household expenses. They have five children. The two older children help with the farm work. His future plans include producing different crops in order to generate more income throughout the year. Lucilo has been cultivating pineapple for 23 years. It will be almost 18 months before he will be able to see part of his investment.

Lucilo is grateful to AFODENIC for providing him with a Kiva loan so that he can maintain his crops. He lacks the fertilizers and supplies needed for his crops to reach the proper maturity and color. As a result, he will be able to sell his crops at a good price and repay his loan on time and according to terms.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene  26 años de edad, es un joven activo y trabajador que vive con sus padres y su novia en una comunidad rural llamada El Imperial en la provincia de Olmos – Lambayeque.
 
Natividad tiene varios años de experiencia brindando el servicio de mototaxi en su zona (la mototaxi es un servicio de transporte público muy común en el Perú, sobretodo en las pequeñas comunidades; consta de una moto con una cabina en la parte trasera  donde se pueden transportar pasajeros). Él conoce muy bien a sus clientes y cuales son sus rutas, ya que éste trabaja diariamente y en horario corrido. 

La mototaxi del cliente  últimamente ha estado presentando algunos problemas y esto le ha restado horas de trabajo a Natividad, lo cual ha llevado a una baja en sus ingresos.

Natividad solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para comprarle repuestos y darle mantenimiento a su moto  y poder seguir con su trabajo y sus ganancias habituales. 

Natividad ahorra parte del dinero ganado para comprarse  otra mototaxi y así extender su negocio, para en un futuro casarse y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Natividad, age 26, is a very active and hard-working young man.  He lives with his parents and his girl-friend in a rural community called El Imperial, which is in the Olmos – Lambayeque province.

Natividad has several years of experience providing “mototaxi” service in his area (mototaxi is a very common public transportation service in Peru, especially in the small communities; it consists of a motorcycle with a cabin in the back that can be used to transport passengers).  He knows his customers very well, and he knows their routes because he works non-stop every day.

His mototaxi has had some problems recently.  This has caused Natividad to miss some hours of work, and his earnings have gone down.

Natividad is requesting a loan for 1,5000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy replacement parts and for maintenance on his motorcycle.  He will do this to be able to continue his work and to get his usual income.

Natividad is saving part of his income to buy another mototaxi.  That way he will expand his business so that in the future he can get married and have his own house.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and to perform maintenance on his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Urubamba en la provincia D. Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 52  años D. edad y La socia es viuda y tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales ella vive con dos D. ellos D. 29, 25 años D. edad; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta D. animales menores ella se dedica  a la crianza y engorD. D. animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia suele comprar en las ferias los animales menores los cuales cría y engorda y luego los venD.. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. animales menores.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito que le otorgarán para así mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the communal bank Perolniyoc [the name of a canyon]. She lives in the district of Urubamba, which is in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

She is 52 years old, widowed and the mother of three children. She lives with two of them, aged 29 and 25. She alternates her activities between household chores and buying and selling small animals. She breeds and fattens small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens, which she usually buys at the traD. fairs. After having fattened them, she sells them. She applies for a loan to invest in the purchase of small animals.

She values and appreciates the awarded loan. Her quality of life will be improved. She is committed to repay the loan in installments on schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of small animals.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela de 26 años de edad convive junto a su esposo Demetrio de 30 años,  fruto de esta relación  tienen 03 hijos quienes viven en casa propia en la ciudad de Quimbiri. Adela es una persona de ardua labor, quien viene realizando las actividades de compra y venta de productos de la zona; tales como: cacao, café, achiote y palillo, esta actividad lo realiza  junto a su  amado esposo, quien se encarga de cargar y pesar los volúmenes de cada producto. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es contar con la plena confianza de los agricultores, quienes al ver el buen trato y precio que se les brinda no dudan en entregarle la mayor cantidad de sus frutos. Adela viene realizando esta actividad hace 07 años, con mucho entusiasmo y laboriosidad, ya que vio en ello una gran oportunidad de generar su propio ingreso para el  bienestar de su familia y educación a sus hijos. Sin embargo no cuenta con capital suficiente para poder acopiar dichos productos, es por ello que recurre  a los créditos que facilita  la institución MFP. Los planes que tiene en mente es la de seguir creciendo y trabajar con el mismo ahínco  que la caracteriza. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para mejorar su negocio. Asimismo se compromete a aportar sus pagos en la fecha indicada, pues  desea acceder a otros prestamos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una socia que aporta ideas para el progreso de su banco comunal. El crédito solicitado le servirá como capital para poder comprar los granos que producen los campesinos.
texts.en:
Adela is 26 years of age and in a common-law marriage with her husband Demetrio, age 30. Their relationship has resulted in three children who live with them in their own home in the city of Quimbiri. Adela is a person who works hard at her business of buying and selling local products such as cacao, coffee, annatto, and kindling. She operates her business with her beloved husband, who is in charge of loading the merchandise despite the large amounts of each product that they sell. What she enjoys most about her job is having the full confidence of the farmers with whom she works. Since Adela treats them well and offers them a good price, they in return do not hesitate to supply her with large quantities of their crops. She has been in this business for seven years and has worked with great enthusiasm and dedication. Adela saw this as a great opportunity to generate her own income so that she could provide for the welfare of her family and her children’s education. However, she does not have sufficient capital to acquire more products. For this reason, she has returned to ask for additional loans provided by MFP. Her current plans are to continue growing and to work with the same zeal that she is known to possess.

This will be her sixth loan with MFP. Adela commits to submitting her payments by the deadlines indicated because she wants to access additional loans in the future. In her Communal Bank, she is a member who supports ideas that will help move her group forward. The loan she is requesting will be used as capital for buying the crops that are produced by the farmers.

loans.use: to purchase cacao and coffee beans in bulk from local producers.

loans.name: Airen

texts.en:
Airen is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, bread & eggs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy beverages, biscuits & canned goods.

Airen has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Airen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, biscuits & canned goods.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррина проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 33 года. Разведена, имеет одного ребенка. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Она арендует торговую точку на рынке "Саховат" города, где продает женское нижнее белье. Кредит берет для приобретения новых видов нижнего белья.
texts.en: Zarrina lives in Kulob. She is 33 years old, divorced, and has one child. She has been working in trade for more than five years. She rents a shop in the Sakhovat city market where she sells women's underwear. She is taking out a loan to buy new kinds of underwear.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of underwear.

loans.name: Ma Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofia es de un barrio de su comunidad se llama San Pedro, el barrio esta un álejado del centro de la comunidad y a pesar de estar lejos si es un lugar poblado, la gente es muy sencilla y tambien humilde, no hay transporte para llegar a este lugar debido a la carretera no es transitable ya que se encuentra en muy mal estado, con los tiempos de lluvia hace mucho lodo y amanece demasiado empedrado el camino; doña Sofia tiene seis hijos, 5 de ellos ya trabajan y el mas chico se encuentra estudiando pero tambien se hace cargo de 4 nietos que uno de sus hijos le dejo.
Doña Sofia vive con su esposo, ella tiene 45 años de casada y 64 años de edad, su esposo un trabajo estable no lo tiene, quizá por la edad, pero trabaja en su terreno y tambien como albañil cuando se le requiere, la señora Sofia trabaja vendiendo pescado cocido, el pescado lo consigue ya echo lo que hace la señora es que lo consigue y solo lo revende en su comunidad, tambien trae con ella pan para comer y de esta forma es como tiene algo de ganancias, la señora Sofia tambien en su casa se hace cargo de lechones y les compra alimento, los cria para poder tener mas y poco a poco poderlos vender, no tiene mucho tiempo criando lechones lleva 1 año y es el mismo tiempo que tiene de conocer a FRAC, doña Sofia nos comenta que tiene que hacer la lucha para que la comida no haga falta en su casa, busca la manera de poder tener siempre que comer y de vender todo lo que lleva cargando para regresar a casa sin nada.
texts.en:
Sofía is from a neighborhood in her community called San Pedro.  This neighborhood is very far from the center of the community and despite being distant it’s populated.  The residents are very unassuming and humble.  There is no means of transportation here because the highway is impassable because it’s in very poor condition and when it rains it becomes very muddy and it awakens strewn with rocks in the road. 

Sofía has six children. Five of them work and the youngest one is in school but she also cares for four grandchildren that one of her sons left in her care.  Sofía lives with her husband.   She’s been married 45 years and she’s 64 years old.  Her husband does not have steady employment, perhaps because of his age, but he works in his field and also as a bricklayer when needed.  

Sofía works selling cooked fish.  She gets the fish already cooked so all she does is get it and resell it in her community.  She also brings bread to eat and this is how she earns a bit of profits.  Sofía also raises piglets at home and buys feed for them.  She raises them to have a bit more and gradually be able to sell them.  She hasn’t been raising pigs very long.  She’s been doing it for about a year which is the same amount of time that she’s known about FRAC.  Sofía tells us that she has to make the effort so that her house will always have food.  She looks for ways to always have something to eat and to sell everything she carries in order to return home empty handed.

loans.use: to buy cooked fish.

loans.name: Kenjegul's Group

texts.en:
Kenjegul, 36, is treasurer of this group. 

She has been involved in farming since she got married 11 years ago. The couple is busy with several types of activities from cultivating agricultural products to breeding and reselling livestock. 

The farm is rather big and requires much of Kenjegul’s time and attention. In 10 years she has built a big shed and increased the number of cattle.  

Their monthly income is 5,000 KGS and the entrepreneur plans to further broaden the business and get a rich harvest. The purpose of the loan is to buy fuels and lubricants for hay mowing and paying for mechanic services. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and lubricants for hay mowing and to pay for mechanic services.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Farming is the one business in which it is very hard to earn the income to support a family. But Mrs. Horn and her husband try against the odds every day  to feed their children so that none die and they have a good standard of living. 

Both of them have been farmers since 1999. Horn is also a mixed-goods seller in her house. She can earn about $2 per day. This couple has four children. They are all enrolled in school. 

Mrs. Horn and her husband would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials. She hopes that she will send all of her children to study at high levels, as some other families do. She is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity it provides her. She has taken the photo with her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials.

loans.name: Saliciana

texts.es: Saliciana, de 34 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Teofilo de 40 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos verdes de su pradera han sido en la vida de Saliciana un lugar muy agradable para trabajar, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio, sus cultivos de cacao, café y frutos de plátano, poseyendo en total 02 hectáreas de terreno. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos desde su chacra hasta los centros de acopio situado en la ciudad de San Francisco. Con el crédito solicitado comprará materiales para terminar de acondicionar su vivienda. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras para luego poder heredarlos a sus queridos hijos. Este será su séptimo crédito con MFP y por lo cual necesita el apoyo de los financistas para llevar consigo  su propósito, además se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente y esta agradecida por ser socia de su banco comunal. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará calaminas, clavos y tablones.
texts.en:
34-year-old Saliciana is a very responsible and hardworking mother. She lives in a house she owns with her husband, 40-year-old Teofilo, and her three beloved children, whose quality of life she wishes to improve. In Saliciana's life, the green fields of her land have been a very pleasant place to work. Her parents taught her this kind of labor since she was very young, and now she owns her own land which she works on with great care and sacrifice. She has cacao, coffee and plantain crops and owns a total of 2 hectares of land. What she likes most about her work is to harvest her land, because that is how she feels that the months of hard work are rewarded by the quality of her produce. She has been in the business for 15 years and believes that the hardest part is transporting her crop from her farm to the stockpile centers located in the city of San Francisco.
With the requested loan she will purchase materials in order to finish setting up her house. In time, she hopes to save enough money to buy more land so she can leave it to her beloved children as inheritance. This will be her seventh loan with MFP and because of that she needs the support of the lenders in order to fulfill her goal. Furthermore, she is committed to making her repayments punctually and thankful for being a member of her communal bank. With the 3.000 nuevos soles she requested, she will purchase corrugated metal sheets, nails and wood planks.

loans.use: to purchase corrugated metal sheets, nails and wood planks for her house.

loans.name: Zoila Teresa

texts.es:
Zoila de 33 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Pacasmayo que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad pesquera, agrícola y turismo.

Desde hace varios años Zoila se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.  

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio sea cada vez más grande y tenga productos surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.  Zoila es una persona responsable y dedicada que se preocupa por brindarles lo mejor a su familia, en especial a sus hijos que los quiere ver realizados en la vida.
texts.en:
Zoila, 33 years of age, lives with her family in her own home.  It has all the basic services, and is located in the urban zone of Pacasmayo, which belongs to the department of La Libertad.  This zone is characterized for its fishing, agriculture, and tourism activities.

For several years, Zoila has dedicated herself to selling basic needs products (milk, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, etc.) and beverages.  Her business is located in her own house for security reasons and, with the earnings from the sale of her products, she tries to cover her expenses and improve her family’s standard of living.

In order to implement her business, she has requested a loan of 1200 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more merchandise for her store.  Her goal is to continue growing her business, and to have a supply of products to offer her customers.  Zoila is a very responsible and dedicated person who is preoccupied with giving all the best to her family, especially her children, who she wants to see succeed in life.

loans.use: buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines, where she is married and raising one child. She earns a living by running a shop where she sells vegetables such as cabbage and tomatoes and beverages such as soft drinks. She has been in this line of work for five years and is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI earlier this year and hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
With a desire to improve her retail store, Luz spends most of her time in her business. She buys rice and fish to sell to the local community. Her net profits are just enough to cover their daily expenses. 

Luz is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy stock items such as fish and rice to sell. She wants to expand her business to secure her family's living situation. She hopes that ASKI would give her financial assistance so that she could improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock items such as fish and rice to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rope-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business.

Josephine has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from food vending.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир - бизнесмен из Белой Церкви.Он торгует мужской обувью на центральном рынке уже 5 лет. Обувь, которую он предлагает покупателям - всегда качественная, наценка у него небольшая. Не так давно Владимир приобрел киоск и теперь ему больше не нужно тратить лишние средства на аренду помещения. Было время, когда Владимир ездил на заработки в Россию, но потом понял, что лучше работать в своей стране и стал заниматься развитием своего собственного бизнеса.     

Владимир надеется использовать кредит КИВА в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести 40-60 пар зимней обуви и разнообразить ассортимент своего товара перед тем, как покупатели придут на рынок в поисках добротной и качественной обуви. Владимир хочет и дальше заниматься этим бизнесом, зарабатывая себе на жизнь и обеспечивая свою семью всем необходимым. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Vladimir is an entrepreneur from Belaya Tserkov.  He has been selling men's shoes at the central market for five years.  Shoes that he offers to customers is always of high quality, and his add-on is not high.  Recently, Vladimir bought a kiosk and now no longer needs to spend extra money on leasing a space.  There was a time when Vladimir traveled to work in Russia, but then realized that it is better to work in this country and focused on developing his own business.  He hopes to use the Kiva loan of 20 000 hryvnia to buy 40-50 pairs of winter shoes and expand his merchandise selection prior to customers coming to the market in search of durable and quality shoes.  Vladimir wants to continue running this business, earn a living and provide his family with all of the necessities.

loans.use: to buy 40-50 pairs of winter shoes and vary the merchandise assortment

loans.name: Tariro Group

texts.en: This is 29-year-old Abigal from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is married with four children. One is still in school. She also looks after two other dependents. She runs a business selling airtime. The business has been in operation for two years. Abigal says the main challenge she faces is stiff competition. She has requested a loan of $400 to purchase more airtime for resale. Abigal says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the social well-being of her family. In the future she plans to be a wholesale airtime vendor.

loans.use: to buy airtime for resale

loans.name: 3 De Junio Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es D. la ciudad D. villa elisa, 22 amigas y vecinas se unieron con el propósito D. ayudarse las unas con las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas quieren un mejor futuro para sus hijos y familiares, es por ellos que se sacrifican el día a día.
La señora Adela es una D. las miembros, ella ive en su casita con sus hijos y su marido y trabajan y se ayudan mutuamente. Ella tiene una despensa en su propia casa, el cual está bien surtido. Comenta que le va muy bien, pues ya tiene una clientela bien definida.
Ella solicita el crédito para para poder agrandar su negocio, ya que su espacio físico le está quedando pequeño y quiere seguir creciendo.
Este comité es un grupo que se formo hace cuatro ciclos atrás que a pesar D. tener pequeños problemas supieron salir siempre adelante. La señora Adela al empezar el grupo fue  la  tesorera del grupo y siempre supo llevar muy bien su cargo y es muy responsable en cuanto a los ahorros D. las integrantes .
texts.en:
This Group is from the city of Villa Elisa.  Twenty two friends and neighbors got together so that they could help one-another by working as a team.  They want a better future for their children and families; they are the reason for their daily sacrifices.

Adela is one of the group’s members and she lives in her little house with her husband and children.  She and her husband support one-another.  She runs a small grocery store from her home and it is well stocked.  She says that things are going well for her and that she has steady customers.

She is asking for this loan so that she can expand her business, now that her physical space is getting to be too small and she wants to continue expanding.

This group was formed four cycles ago and despite a few small problems, they always manage to come out ahead.  Adela was the treasure when the group began and she always completed her duties very well and was very responsible with the members’ savings.

loans.use: to buy supplies to stock her store.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: El señor Henry a sus 52 años de edad, se dedica a la cría de pollos de engorde y gallinas en la finca en la cual trabaja como Mayordomo, en ésta su jefe le da el permiso para que realice esta labor hace ya varios años.  El señor Henry desea adecuar el piso y el techo del lugar donde tiene sus pollos y gallinas, esto le permitirá que los animales se críen de forma adecuada, lo cual generará mayor rentabilidad, ya que actualmente sus animales se están enfermando debido a la humedad en el lugar donde permanecen.
