El señor Henry sueña con tener un galpón (lugar donde se crían los pollos y las gallinas) grande y que cumpla con todos los requisitos  y comercializar pollos de engorde y huevos en todos los supermercados del sector; adicional a esto brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Henry is 52 years old.  He works raising chickens and hens on the farm where he works as the steward.  His boss has given him permission to do this work, which he has been doing for several years.  

Señor Henry wants to make improvements to the floor and roof of the space where he keeps his chickens and hens.  This will allow the fowl to be raised properly and generate better profitability, as currently his fowl are getting sick from the humidity in their present location.

Señor Henry's dream is to have a large barn where he can raise chickens and hens, and which would meet all his requirements.  He would be able to sell fattened chickens and eggs to all the area supermarkets; this would also provide a better quality of life for his two children.

loans.use: to make improvements to the floor and roof of the location where he raises his chickens and hens.

loans.name: Fanya Bidii Group

texts.en:
Moses is the facilitator of the Fanya Bidii Group. Moses and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Moses takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Moses had a very good maize yield harvesting 9½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Moses was only able to harvest 1½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Moses will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Fanya Bidii Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The picture shows Moses and his group with the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child. 

Merly has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Merly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Rondera A Group

texts.fr:
George est un commerçant de Bière depuis deux ans, âgé de 33 ans.
Il habite à Rutegama et il est marié à Marcienne. Le couple a 4 enfants, l’’aîné a 8 ans, il est en première année primaire. Georges a étudié jusqu’en 6e année primaire année primaire.
Avant de se lancer dans son activité actuelle, il était agriculteur comme sa femme.
Il a déjà bénéficié 3 crédits avec Turame. Le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, lui permet d’augmenter son capital, il pourra augmenter la quantité de bières à revendre afin d’avoir plus de bénéfices.
Il est membre du groupe communautaire « Rondera A ».
texts.en:
Georges is 33 years old and has been a beer-seller for two years.
He lives in Rutegama and is married to Marcienne. The couple have four children, the eldest of whom is 8 and in his second year of primary school. Georges completed six years of primary school education.
Before starting his current business, he was a farmer, as was his wfe.
He has already benefited from three loans with Turame. The Kiva loan that he obtains will allow him to augment his capital, and he will be able to increase the amount of beer he sells in order to obtain more profits.
He is member of the community group "Rondera A".

loans.use: To augment his capital and increase the amount of beer sold in order to have higher profits.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman, having five children. Elsa is 45 years old, residing at Kinuman, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Elsa owns and operates farm land, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She has been 20 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 12,463 for additional capital to purchase fertilizers. 

Elsa is been a member of GDMPC for almost 3 years. In the future, Elsa wants to make improvements of her house and to finish her children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen, is married and a mother of two children. She 35 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Helen used her last loan to purchase more grocery items to sell. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: The money will be invested in the purchase of products to grow my sales. With more products to offer, the more clients I will have, leading to greater income for my family.

loans.use: Increase selection of food inventory for sale

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en: Vaqif S. owns a small car wash off the main road that passes by Agsu city. He is 38 years old and married with four children. He has owned his business for the past six years. With this loan Vaqif wants to purchase better equipment for his shop.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his car wash

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is a mother of two children and runs a lawn mowing business which helps cater for her family’s needs. With eight people in her family, she earns 200 a week but needs to purchase materials to further develop and expand her business services to meet the high demand of clients.

loans.use: To purchase oil, weed eater & lawn mower

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: A. Akif is 24 years old. He is single and a successful businessman. He is the owner of a small farm and is engaged with animal breeding. He has applied for a 1200 USD loan from Aqroinvest CU to purchase one milk cow and one calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock for his shop.

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
Maria Concepcion is a very hard working woman, she is married and she has three children. Her husband income is very low and it is not enough to cover the family's basic expenses. In order to bring in extra money, Maria decided to sell corn and snacks. With help from her husband, she has made the business grow slowly. They started out selling their products in the streets but now they have modified a room in their house to accommodate a store.

Currently, Maria is requesting a loan in the amount of US$325.00, which will be used to buy equipment that will improve the quality of the service they offer and to improve the store's appearance. She promises to pay it back within 4 months. Be an important part in the life of this family by contributing to their business' growth, they sincerely appreciate it.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Concepción es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene tres hijos. El salario que recibe su esposo es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, para obtener un ingreso extra Maria emprendió su negocio con la venta de elotes y botanas, con la ayuda de su esposo poco a poco han hecho crecer el negocio, comenzaron vendiendo sus productos por las calles y ahora Maria ha acondicionado un lugar de su casa para instalar su negocio.

En estos momentos Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la compra de equipo que necesita para poder mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece y mejorar la apariencia de su negocio, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Forma parte importante en la vida de esta familia contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Equipment Purchase

loans.name: Raoul Komlan

texts.fr:
At 33 years of age, Mr. Raoul Komlan A. is married. After his studies ended with a BTS (a two-year employment-oriented technician qualification diploma) in Commerce and Sales, he did not have the chance to work in the field. Fortunately, he was able to find a place managing a beverage store. With 5 years of experience, he has found that this business is flourishing, and has decided to open his own store, but he sadly lacks the means. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of $800. This will increase his income and allow him to better take care of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Agé de 33 ans, Monsieur Raoul Komlan A. est marié. Après ses études sanctionnées par un BTS Action Commercial et Force de Vente, il n’a pas eu la chance d’avoir un emploi du genre. Mais heureusement, il a pu trouver une place de gérant dans un dépôt de boissons. Avec 5 ans d’expérience, il trouve que c’est une activité très florissante et décide d’ouvrir son propre dépôt de boissons mais les moyens lui manquent cruellement. Pour ce faire il sollicite un crédit de $800. Ceci augmentera ses revenus en vue de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: To open a beverage store

loans.name: Kafia

texts.en: Kafia S. is married and a mother of four: two sons and two daughters. Currently, one of her children attends school, while the others are still too young. Kafia is determined to educate her children, because, although she is not much educated herself, she is aware of the importance of good education. Kafia's husband is a welder and currently needs a loan to help expand his business and be able to take on orders of a larger scale.

loans.use: Expansion of a manufacturing business

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
Paquita is trained as a nurse and currently she has a position as a support person at a health clinic in the afternoons. Nonetheless, in the mornings she sells bijao leaves, limes, chilis and manioc roots, regional products that are eaten frequently. Paquita is 33 years old and is mother to two beautiful children, who have become the light of her life and give her hope of family progress. She, along with her beloved husband Adán, wishes to strengthen their businesses in order to give security and wellbeing to their children. Paquita wants to keep making progress with her business and would like to improve it and in this way increase her financial security. Very recently she decided she would like to open a small store in order to offer essentials and for this she needs capital which will make her goal possible. She awaits your unselfish help from your noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Paquita es técnica en enfermería y actualmente se desempeña como personal de apoyo en un puesto de salud de su ciudad por las tardes, sin embargo por las mañanas se dedica a la venta de hojas de bijao, limones, ajíes y yuca, productos regionales que son consumidos con mucha frecuencia. Paquita tiene 33 años y es madre de dos hermosos niños los cuales se han convertido en la luz de su camino y esperanza de progreso familiar. Ella junto a su querido esposo el señor, Adán, anhelan la consolidación de sus negocios a fin de brindarles seguridad y bienestar a sus hijos. Paquita quiere seguir progresando con su negocio es por eso que quiere implementarlo y así incrementar su sustento económico, muy posteriormente quiere poner una pequeña tienda para ofrecer artículos de primera necesidad y para ello requiere de un capital de trabajo el cual posibilitará su propósito. Ella espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: Increase her capital in order to offer greater quantity of products

loans.name: Sevinj

texts.en:
Sevinj is a 37-year-old local resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with her husband and four children. She breeds cattle together with her husband (shown in picture). They have been in this business for 20 years.

Sevinj raises calves and sells them at the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other dairy products. Cattle breeding is traditional in the region, where there are no other jobs. Sevinj wants to increase her family's herd. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan of $600.

loans.use: To buy calves for her family's cattle-breeding business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana L. lives in Kherson and runs a small business selling men’s clothing at the central city market. She likes to plan her business strategy thoroughly and overcomes all challenges with optimism. Tatyana is a person who always finishes what she starts. Four successful years in this business are the best proof of that, because in this time Tatyana has received and promptly repaid 15 loans from Nadiya Ukraine. Presently, Tatyana's company brings in about $4,000 a month, $1,000 of which is net profit.

Tatyana would like to get a loan of $1,000 to increase her capital. She wants to continue developing her business and gain financial independence and economic freedom. We believe Tatyana’s balanced approach to life, disciplined way of doing things, attention to detail and careful planning will help her continue to be successful in the future.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of items she has for sale.

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.fr:
Born on July 28, 1972 in LOKOSSA, Ms. Nathalie B. is originally from metropolitan LOKOSSA in the south-west of Benin, where she spent her entire childhood before getting settled in Cotonou for some twelve years at her husband's side. Together, they had twins, Daline and Dalina, both in seventh grade, and Sergio, age 8, in second grade. Two years ago, she lost her husband and is now a widow. Since then, she has had trouble finding the necessary financial means to be able to meet her children's needs. Let us recall that Ms. B. is a shoe seller at the DANTOKPA marketplace, the largest market in Benin. She is applying for this loan to restock her inventory in order to achieve her objectives and to meet the expectations of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 28 juillet 1972 à LOKOSSA, dame B. Nathalie est originaire de la cité urbaine de LOKOSSA au sud-ouest du BENIN où elle a passé toute son enfance avant de s’installer à COTONOU depuis une dizaine d’année aux côtés de son mari avec qui elle a eu 2 jumelles Daline et Dalina toutes deux en classe de cinquième et Sergio 8 ans en classe de CEI. Il y a deux ans elle a perdu son mari, donc veuve. Depuis ce temps elle a du mal à trouver les moyens financiers nécessaires pour pourvoir aux besoins de ses enfants. Rappelons que dame B. Nathalie est revendeuse de chaussures au marché DANTOKPA, le plus grand marché du BENIN. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner afin d’atteindre ses objectifs et de satisfaire ses clients.

loans.use: To buy a half bail of shoes

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr:
Born November 20, 1974 in Cotonou, in the Littoral department in the south of Benin, Mrs. Cécile F. is a married mother of three children, who all still live at home. She has a stand at the Dantokpa international market. In order to attract customers and increase her capital, she would like to use one part of the loan money she is requesting to buy spices, milk and sugar and the other part to buy subsistence products in order to diversify her business.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 20 novembre 1974 à COTONOU dans le département du Littoral au sud du BENIN, dame F. Cécile est mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous à sa charge. Elle s’est procuré un stand au marché international DANTOKPA. En vue d’attirer de la clientèle et pour renforcer son capital, elle désire injecter une partie du crédit sollicité dans l’achat des épices, du lait, du sucre et la seconde partie dans l’achat de produits vivriers afin de faire une diversification d’activités.

loans.use: Purchase of two bags of corn, three bags of yams, three bags of beans, five boxes of sugar and six boxes of sweetened condensed milk

loans.name: Marta Angelica

texts.es:
Marta Angelica lives in the county of San Jose Villa Nueva in the department of La Libertad. Her nuclear family is maD. up of her husband and 2 kids who are studying at college.

For many years she has been getting credit through Integral, and these loans have helped her to improve her shop and start her business selling typical foods which she runs with the help of her family. She now wants to dedicate some time to home improvements, especially to repairing the roof and whitewashing and repairing the walls as it is now winter and they get a lot of leaks which can be problematic. This is why she is asking for a loan; so that she can solve the problems that her house incurs each winter.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Marta Angélica, vive en el Municipio D. San José Villa Nueva, ubicado en el Departamento D. La Libertad. Su núcleo familiar esta integrado por su esposo y dos hijas las cuales se encuentran estudiando en la Universidad. DesD. hace muchos años ha adquirido créditos con Integral, los cuales le han ayudado a ir mejorando la tienda e iniciar en el negocio D. venta D. comida típica que administra con la ayuda D. su familia. Hoy quiere dedicar parte D. sus esfuerzos para mejorar su casa dándole prioridad al cambio D. techo, repellos y afinados en paredes, ya que en el invierno sufre D. filtraciones a su vivienda que le generan problemas D. habitabilidad. Por ello se encuentra solicitando un préstamo, que le permita solventar esos problemas que le aquejan en cada invierno que pasa.

loans.use: To repair the roof and whitewash the walls/PARA REPARACIÓN DE TECHO, REPELLO Y AFINADO DE PAREDES EN LA VIVIENDA.

loans.name: Usmon

texts.ru:
Usmon is married and has 3 children. He make Shish-kabob's and sells them at the road service station, he believes that there is a large demand for his product there. His family is located next to him, and his wife serves the clients, while he cooks the Shish-kabob's. He rents an area where after work he leaves his equipment there. He needs a necessary sum to buy the premise, and his friends in the business are finances in Mikroenvisti, have advised Usmon to address Kiva for a loan. He has received a loan for opening one more trading point in a road service station, near himself. In the new trading point his wife will be selling and trading Shish-kabob's as well as other foods and economic goods.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Усмон женат имеет троих детей. Он делает шашлыки и продает в автовокзале, он считает, что там хороший спрос на его продукт. Его семья находиться рядом с ним, жена обслуживает клиентов, сам Усмон готовит шашлык. Он арендует помещение, где после работы оставляет своё оборудование. Ему потребовалось необходимая сумма для выкупа помещения, его друзья по бизнесу кредитуются в Микроинвесте, они посоветовали Усмону обратиться за кредитом. Он получил кредит для открытия еще одной точки в автовокзале, недалеко от себя. В новой точке будет сидеть его жена, кроме шашлыков она будет торговать продуктами и другими хозяйственными товарами.

loans.use: For permission

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is a married father of a beautiful little daughter who is only 4. His family lives in Kamenka where Alexei runs a small grocery store selling food products downtown in his home town. Alexei's store is well known in this neighborhood as he serves his customers well and works late hours which is very convenient for many customers who work late and go shopping after they are done with their work. Alexei has been in this business for 5 years. He has about $10,000 invested in inventory. His net profit is about $600-800 a month.

Alexei is seeking a 5000 Grivna loan to purchase a vehicle which would facilitate his business operations and help him travel to buy additional merchandise from wholesalers. Moreover, Alexei is hoping to spend a portion of the loan to buy insulation materials for his store to prepare it for the upcoming cold season. Alexei has had some struggles as his business was growing and becoming self-sustainable. However, he handled all these challenges pretty well and is looking toward the future with much enthusiasm and optimism.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle to facilitate his business operations

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma is 36 years old. She is married with one child aged 15. She has run her own shop, a general store, since 2005, working from 8am to 8pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Rahma is now looking for a loan to buy more commodities to increase her present stock in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to increase her present stock to improve her business.

loans.name: Mersija

texts.en:
Mersija was born in 1988 and she lives in Odžak, a small city in the north of Bosnia.  She has two jobs with which she supports her family: she repairs shoes and she sells cosmetics out of a catalog.  With these jobs, she makes just enough income to meet her family's daily needs, earning about 400KM/month, roughly equivalent to $290 USD. 

Mersija requests a 700KM ($500 USD) loan from Women for Women International to support both businesses. She will buy new tools with which she can fix shoes, and cosmetic products that she can sell at a profit.

loans.use: To buy cosmeticts and new tools with which to repair shoes

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
La señora Zenaida tiene 58 años D. edad, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Buen Pastor y vive en la calle Hermanos Angulo 521 del distrito El Porvenir, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió Primaria Completa, pero no continuó estudiando debido a la falta D. apoyo D. parte D. sus padres ya que no podían responder económicamente. 
Se casó D. 20 años D. edad, tuvo 4 hijos y ya no tiene ningún hijo a su cargo. Su negocio consiste en la venta D. comida en su propio local, como el ceviche, caldo y combinado.
Con este crédito D. S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará cerveza y gaseosa.
Zenaida sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener un restaurante granD. que pueda atender con las tres comidas diarias.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 58 years old and is part of the group "Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Buen Pastor". She lives in Hermano Angulo Road, in the district of El Porvenir, province of Trujillo, state of La Libertad, Peru. Zenaida completed primary school but did not continue studying due to lack of economic support from her parents. She got married at 20 years old and had 4 children, who are now no longer in her care. Zenaida sells food in her own store, such as ceviche, soup and rice & meat plates. With this loan of 300 soles, which will be paid in 4 payments, Zenaida will purchase beer and soda. Zenaida dreams of expanding her business and having a big restaurant where she can serve breakfast, lunch & dinner.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beer and soda for her store

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo P. is happily married and blessed with two intelligent children. He is 41 years old and is engaged in farming while his wife is making soft brooms for sale in their community. His earnings support the daily needs of his family and he wants to ensure that he can provide a good future for them. However, he is experiencing difficulty with the cost of farm materials such as fertilizer, which have become expensive lately.

To solve this dilemma, Bernardo thinks of converting into organic farming - the traditional way of farming which is a lot cheaper than commercial farming. Such a shift to a healthier method of farming will require additional capital of P15,000 (USD$325), that is why he wants to borrow money from a local institution.

Bernardo always dreams for the health and unity of his family. He also wants his children - Mary Ann, 16, and Mary Jane, 15 - to finish college education because he knows how important it is for his children to have a better future. At the moment, he is so proud of his children who are able to help them in making soft brooms by simply going around the community to collect the materials they need.

loans.use: Additional capital to convert to organic farming methods.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María  es socia del Banco Comunal Teresa de Calcuta. 
María, tiene  37 años y una hija de 16 años que está culminando el colegio.
Su negocio es de venta de chicharrones  que se llama “PORKY 1”, al costado de la comisaría por el  puente Lurín, este negocio lo comparte con otra persona, vende desde hace un año  todos los días, también vende menú.

Desde que entro a Finca se ha superado pues primero vendía productos de belleza, después comenzó a vender DVD, y ahora ya tiene un negocio mayor que es la venta de chicharrones y menú.
María requiere un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne de chancho, gaseosas.
El sueño de María es tener su negocio propio y poder darle los estudios a su hija para que sea profesional.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Teresa de Calcutta Community Bank. She is 37 years old and has a 16-year old daughter who is completing her college studies. María earns her living by selling chicharrones (a traditional pork dish)—her business is called PORKY 1 and is located next to the Lurín bridge police station. She runs the business with another person. She has had the business for one year and works there every day. She also sells fixed menu food. Since she first became involved with Kiva partner Finca, she has done well. At first she used to sell beauty products, then DVDs, and now she has a bigger business selling chicharrones and set meals. María is asking for a loan of 2000 soles which she will use to buy pork and soft drinks. Her dream is to own her own business and be able to provide her daughter with a good education so that she can obtain a good job.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pork and soft drinks

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Como madre soltera Ernestina es una de aquellas personas para quienes el esfuerzo y cansancio no es nada si de educar y alimentar a sus hijos se trata. Cuando vivía en la casa de su hermana trabajaba atendiendo en una tienda de abarrotes. Después de varios años decidió independizarse y mudarse a una casa propia. Por lo que tuvo que abandonar el negocio de la tienda y empezar uno nuevo.

Hace veinte años que decidió vender pan por las mañanas en un paradero cerca a su casa. Sin embargo, hace unos años este ya no le significa un negocio tan rentable como antes, es así que se animó a empezar a vender por las noches gaseosas y cervezas en su casa. Hasta hace unos meses ella también lavaba ropa pero ya no lo hace porque se fracturó un brazo que aún no termina de sanar debido a su constante trabajo.

Gracias a su trabajo ha logrado educar y mantener a sus dos hijos. Por ahora ella desea aumentar la mercadería de su negocio para crecer.
texts.en:
As a single mom, Ernestina is one of those people who will work non-stop in order to put food on the table and provide a good education for her children. When she used to live with her sister, she worked at the local convenience store. After many years, she decided to become independent and buy her own home. This meant that she had to quit her job at the store and start a new one. About 20 years ago, she decided to sell bread in the mornings at a bus stop near her house. Unfortunately, she realized a few years ago that this job wasn't making her enough money as it did before. This is why she began selling refreshments like soda and beer from her home. She was also washing clothes but she broke her arm a few months ago and has yet to heal. Thanks to her job, she has been able to educate and support her 2 children. Currently she would like to increase inventory to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Majed has been working as a car repairer for eighteen years. He repairs cars radiators. Majed requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Majed has requested a loan.

Majed is special in his work because of his experience in cars. His clients are his family members, friends and neighbors. Majed decided on doing his business because he wanted to be independent in his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his garage.

loans.use: Majed will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Lilibeth B., 41 years old and married, lives at Talairon, Oroquieta City, Mis. Occ. Her husband is a private driver of a delivery truck. She has 3 children. With her desire to help her husband, she decided to open a “sari-sari” (variety) store, in front of their house, starting up with a capital of only PHP 500. Her family only rents the land where they live at PHP 500/annum. Her primary customers were her neighbors & friends.

With the increasing demand of customers, she thought of expanding her business and joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in June 2002 to gain access to their credit facilities. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC, that her purpose of accessing additional capital has materialized. Now, she is applying for PHP 14,900 to buy cases of soft drinks & beverages for sale. She dreams of owning a parcel of land someday. She also plans to renovate her store.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Unidas Venceremos 3 Group

texts.en:
The women from group 3 of the Unidos Venceremos Bank of Hope are requesting their 7th loan through Esperanza International. They live in Samana, a peninsuL. located in northeast Dominican Republic. Samana is relatively an isolated and unexploited area of the country. Hence employment opportunities are scarce. The group members have worked very hard to establish their business through their previous micro loans and want to increase their sales volumes by buying new supplies with this loan. 

Maribel A. is the group coordinator. She runs a small grocery store where she sells basic food supplies for daily cooking. She will use this loan to purchase rice, sugar and malted drinks, which are the items she sells the most. She's been sick recently for an extended period of time, which has led to a decrease in her sales. She hopes to recover soon and attend to her business without having to ask for help (she still doesn't make enough profits to hire staff). She also wants to make some improvements in the space where her store is located. She will work hard to continue paying her loans successfully, as she has done so far.

Please help us support these entrepreneurs through this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and malted drinks

loans.name: Nerva

texts.es: Nerva tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus padres y sus 2 hijos. Cuenta con 8 habitaciones construidas en un espacio dentro de su casa, los mismos que los alquila a jóvenes estudiantes o personas solteras. Con esta actividad ya lleva 7 años y le va muy bien, ya que sus inquilinos cumplen puntualmente con sus pagos y no causan ningún problema durante su estadía. Lo que le gusta a Nerva es que  conoce a varias personas, en su mayoría jóvenes  con los que puede conversar y muchas veces darles algún consejo. Para más adelante, también le gustaría acondicionar unos corrales en su casa para poder criar pollos. Este es su préstamo número 11 con MFP, y hasta el momento considera que su trabajo con su banco comunal es muy positivo y satisfactorio, tanto para su crecimiento personas, como para realizar adecuadamente cualquier actividad económica. El dinero que vienen solicitando lo invertirá en la reparación y remodelación de sus habitaciones, para que sus inquilinos se sientan mucho más a gusto.
texts.en:
Nerva is 43 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her parents and 2 children. She has 8 constructed rooms in a space within her house that she rents to young students or other individuals. This activitiy, which she has been carrying out for 7 years, has been going very well. Her renters complete payments punctually and never cause a problem during their stay. What she would like is to meet various people, who on the majority are young, with whom she can converse and give advice. Further on in the future, she would also like to arrange for corrals in her house to be able to raise chickens. This is her 11th loan with MFP, and she has, up to this point, considered her work with her comunal bank to be positive and satisfactory, in that it has helped her grow as a person much as much as it has helped her realize whatever economic activity she engages in. With the money that she is soliciting, she will invest in the repair and remodeling of her rooms, so that her renters will feel more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling her rooms.

loans.name: Galileonides

texts.en:
Galileonides G. is 46 years old and is married with three kids. Her husband is a fisherman. They have come to face the fact that depending solely on her husband’s income is very difficult. Paying for the education of the children is also an expense that they struggle to meet.

When her husband got a big catch last year, the couple decided to buy a motorcycle for hire in order for them to have an additional source of income. It's a matter of "diskarte" (strategies) on how to live life. One has to work hard and make sacrifices.

Galileonides has been a member of Paglaum MPC since March 2007. She and her husband hope that Paglaum MPC will always be there for them in times of need. Today, she is applying for Php 14,900 in order to buy a fishing net, as well as to buy spare parts and tires for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

The Gonzalez family's dream is to build a decent home and to see their children established with their own professions.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and to finance the repair and maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.name: Sang's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people. Its leader, Mrs. S., 43, makes a living selling various grocery products, such as cooking ingredients, plastic products, and sweets (candies). She started the business four years ago, and currently earns approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. Mrs. S. has four children, all four of them are still living in the family home and are attending school.

Currently, Mrs. S. has sold nearly all the grocery items from her store. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to restore the quantity of inventory to her grocery store.

The other three borrowers are:

K., 26, who is a housewife who also needs a loan to buy a motor to replace the existing one;

K., 56, who is a construction worker and needs money to repair her old house;

and S., 24, who is a worker for a fish market and requests a loan to buy a motor for her family's transportation needs.

All of the borrowers live in Chong Kneas Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To restore the inventory of her grocery store

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат Бакаева проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 38 лет. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Каромат по профессии учитель, но ей не работала. Каромат вместе с супругом и с отцом работают портнихами. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы купить новую машинку.
texts.en:
Karomat B. lives in the Rumy district. She is 38 years old, married and has 6 children. Karomat is a teacher by profession, but never worked in that field. Karomat, her husband and her father work as tailors. Karomat is requesting this loan in order to purchase a new sewing machine.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob A. is fifty-seven years old. He is married with ten children, but currently only two of his children are still in school. He is a producer of turpentine. Turpentine is a solvent used for mixing paints. He says the main raw materials for turpentine are kerosene, thinner, and petrol.

Jacob produces turpentine and supplies it to shops where they sell paints etc. However, his production is on the low side as a result of low working capital to buy raw materials for the processing. Jacob wants to use the loan to buy barrels of kerosene, petrol and thinner. He believes the loan will enable him to save more toward his last two children’s education.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make turpentine

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama Y. est couturière de profession à Assahoun. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans. Agée de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. avec ce crédit, Ama souhaite acheter une machine à coudre et des pagnes pour les revendre à la clientèle.
texts.en:
Ama Y. is a seamstress by profession in Assahoun. She has been in this business for five years. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three. With this loan, she wishes to buy a sewing machine and some pagnes (colorful West African cloth) to resell to her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and cloth to resell

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 24 años se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, adicionalmente, todos los días elabora bellos bordados en la comodidad de su casa y los fines de semana, viaja para vender sus productos, los cuales son principalmente lácteos, de esta manera, garantiza para su familia los ingresos necesarios. En todo este tiempo de trabajo y con la experiencia ganada ha podido obtener buenas ganancias necesarias para la manutención de su familia. Este es su crédito número 19 con MFP, ella es muy puntual en sus pagos y su historia crediticia es la mejor carta aval que recomienda su responsabilidad. El dinero que viene solicitando es para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales necesarios para incrementar su producción de bordados y así aprovechar la época de festividades costumbristas de su zona, que es cuando hay mayor demanda de estas prendas.
texts.en:
Claudia is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and their 2 children in their own house. For 24 years she has been dedicated to the sale of edible products. In addition every day she creates beautiful embroidery in the comfort of her home and on weekends she travels to sell her products, which are chiefly dairy products. In this manner, she guarantees for her family the necessary income. In all this time of work and with the experience she has earned, she has been able to obtain good profits necessary for the maintenance of her family. This is her 19th loan with MFP. She is very punctual in her payments and her credit history is the best letter of recommendation for her responsibility. The money that she requests will be invested in the purchase of the necessary materials to increase her production of embroidered goods in order to take advantage of the local period of festival costumes of her zone. That is when there is greater demand for these items.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textile materials for creating embroidered items

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. lives in Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She makes a living by selling flowers to tourists and neighbors. Rose has been in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2007, Rose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her life and her business opportunities. She has successfully repaid five previous loans, and is applying for a new one to build a stall of her own where she could display flowers for sale. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to build a stall where she can display and sell her flowers

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
At the age of 69, Conchita O. is widowed, but continues her life. At her age, she never tires of doing things to make money for everyday living. Her four children, Ludy, Gemma, Joel and Roque, sometimes give her some money from their salaries because they are now employed. But Conchita does not stop working because she knows her children also need income for their own families. She wants to be the one who helps her children's families, especially for her grandchildren. That’s why she decided to join and borrow from Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva field partner, to get the capital that she needed to start her food preparation business and her restaurant. 

Now, her business is still running, but she needs another loan to expand her business and diversify her menu. She will use her second loan from ASHI to buy rice, pork, vegetables, and spices. This will make her business grow.

Conchita has a simple dream. Preventing her family from experiencing the hard things will make her happy. That’s why she will never tire of helping them.

loans.use: To finance her food preparation business

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn N. is the mother of four children, all of whom are presently taking their studies. Her first child is taking his college education, two are in high school and the youngest is an elementary school pupil. Marlyn felt the difficulties in sending her children to school but, with the help of her hog-raising and duck-raising businesses, she is able to support their needs by working hard and having patience in generating income for her family.

Marlyn’s husband, Ronald, is her partner in managing their business well and they also help each other in maintaining their rice and corn field to harvest a good yield. Sometimes, Marlyn also manages to make salted eggs to retail daily. She purchases duck eggs in the market from a wholesaler and then uses them to make salted eggs.

Marlyn is happy for having been a good learner and entrepreneur. She believes that, with her ability, she will be able to succeed in her business endeavors. She therefore wants to seek PHP 5,000 financial assistance from Kiva lenders to use as additional business capital.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Jesus Is The Way Group

texts.en:
Jesus Is The Way is the group name of five borrowers led by Jumah S., who is 28 years old and a single mother of four children ranging in age from 4 months to 12 years old. Their educational levels range from kindergarten to 5th grade.

Jumah is a 7th-grade dropout due to early pregnancy. She lives with her parents in Virginia, a newly built community north of the capital of Liberia, Monrovia, for poor people who can't afford to buy town lots.

Jumah's business is selling charcoal. She buys charcoal wholesale and sell retail to residents of Virginia. She has been running this business for two years and hopes to establish a transportation business in the future.

Jumah parcels her charcoal larger than other vendors and sells dry charcoal to her customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She faces difficulties during the rainy season because when it rains, the charcoal get wet, which causes losses for the business. She needs this loan in order to purchase more charcoal for sale. 

Jumah dreams of improving her and her children's living standards and continuing her education for a better future.

loans.use: She needs this loan in order to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Lucy Wanja

texts.en:
Lucy is a single mother, 40 years old, blessed with two daughters, Margaret and Mary. She was introduced to Kiva partner Kadet through an existing Kadet client. She is applying for her first loan with Kadet.

Lucy has been operating a charcoal selling business for the past three years. She also knits sweaters, which is her other source of income.

Lucy is going to use this loan to increase her stock of charcoal and knitting thread for sweaters. With the extra profits, Lucy hopes to purchase a motorcycle to use as a means of transport for her charcoal. Her dream is to expand her business and to stock highly demanded fuel sources such as  firewood and timber as well as charcoal.

Lucy has been able to single-handedly educate her daughters through the proceeds from her business. She describes herself as a trustworthy lady, faithful and a very hardworking business person.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To puchase charcoal stock and knitting thread for sweaters.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
B. Haidar is married and has four children. He runs a small business selling rice in the local market. His place is located in the main food market where there are many customers every day. Haidar has been in this business for over 24 years. He is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of his business.

Haidar is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni to increase the assortment of his inventory. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Haidar's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase rice

loans.name: Elmera

texts.en:
Elmera C. is from the village of Northern Pob., Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Elmera is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elmera owns & operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Elmera has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elmera joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmera has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Elmera is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elmera from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es una socia trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 39 años, es madre de tres hijos (uno de ellos mayor de edad) y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.
Esther se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y también es físico terapeuta. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las tigresas” desde hace tres años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtió en la compra de cremas para el cuerpo.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 1200.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de cremas para su negocio y en la compra de artículos de belleza. La meta de Esther es tener un un local amplio donde pueda dar mejor atención al público.
texts.en:
Esther, 39, is a hard-working and dynamic woman from the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She and her husband have three children, one of whom is an adult. She can count on her husband to support her efforts at work. She sells beauty products and is also a physical therapist. She has been a member of the "Las Tigresas" communal bank for the last 3 years. Her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy body creams. Currently, she needs 1200 new soles to buy creams and other beauty products for her business. Esther's goal is to have a spacious location from which she can offer better service to the public.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es: Silvia Maria tiene 44 años de edad, con 4 hijos pero solamente 1 hijo que es el menor está a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, entre lo que sobresale la venta de vestuario, calzado, juguetes y cosméticos. La señora ya tiene 12 años de haber empezado con su negocio, ella inicio en coordinación con una tía, la cual en ese tiempo se dedicaba a la venta de ropa usada y poco a poco fue haciéndose de inventario hasta llegar a tener el negocio que hoy en día posee. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercancías, ya que si compra en este momento y vende en diciembre, sus ganancias se incrementan ya que es ahora cuando los precios están bajos. El sueño siempre ha sido realizar mejoras a su casa, con ello pretende invertirle más a su negocio para que sea más rentable y de allí obtener los recursos para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Silvia Maria is 44 years old and has 4 children, but only one son is still a minor under her care. She works selling basic products, the most popular of which are clothing, shoes, toys, and cosmetics. She started this business 12 years ago, and began it with her aunt, who was then in charge of used clothing sales and little by little increased the inventory until making the business what it is today. The loan will be used to buy merchandise, since if she buys right now and sells in December, her earnings will increase as prices are low right now. Her dream has always been to make improvements to her home, and so she hopes to invest more in her business so that it will be more profitable and give her the resources to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Hector

texts.en: Hector N. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 51 years old, is widowed, and has one school-aged child. Hector owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Hector joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Hector is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his 3rd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
La señora Hermenegilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Calceteras” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, se dedica a la venta de comida.

Hermenegilda nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella requiere un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  arroz, papa, fideos, carne, verduras, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es cambiar de negocio, quiere dedicarse a la compra y venta de ferretería. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias
texts.en:
Mrs. Hermenegilda is a member of the “Las Calceteras” Communal Bank for some 3 years, she lives in the in the district of Jualiaca, province of San Román, department of Puno. She is 42 years old, is married and has 3 children. She studied until the fifth year of secondary school and sells food.

Hermenegilda tells us that with the first loan that she received from Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner) was of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles and it helped her increase her working capital.

She needs a loan of S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles and will use it to buy rice, potatoes, spaghetti, meat, vegetables, etc.

Her dream for the future is to change her business, she wants to buy and sell hardware.

What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the savings and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, potatoes, spaghetti, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en: Miguel is 49 years old and married to Emiliana Ruiz.  They have six children together.  Miguel works in construction, building and repairing houses.  Previously, Miguel was an assistant bricklayer to his father. After he learned the trade, he began working on his own. Now Miguel has 18 years of experience in construction.  Thanks to this experience, he is considered one of the best in his area and his business has prospered.  The loan will be used to replace some tools that are in disrepair, such as an electric drill, paint bush, etc.  Miguel's dream is to acquire more cattle, as his wife produces milk and cheese.

loans.use: To purchase tools such as an electric drill, paint brush, etc

loans.name: Mamatova Sveta`s Group

texts.ru:
Маматова Света, ей 22 года. Она замужем и воспитывает двоих сыновей. Клиент проживает в селе Араван, вместе с супругом и его родителями. Супруг работает таксистом в родном селе. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 100 долларов. С раннего возраста  вместе с родителями Света занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно растениеводством. В данное время она готовится к весеннему посеву. В этом году они планируют посеять картофель,  и кредит будет использован для закупа семян и удобрений. 

Тазагул, 24, замужем и проживает вместе с родителями супруга. Ее муж в данное время работает в Казахстане в сфере торговли. Тазагул по специальности швея. Она шьет постельное белье, женские халаты, сарафаны и пр. Кредит будет использован для закупа ХБ ткани для шитья постельного белья. 

Мусаева Сапилахан проживает вместе с мужем и тремя детьми. Ее супруг заниается реализацией пиломатериалов в с. Араван, сама же работает учителем кыргызского языка в одной из селських сел. Кроме этого у них в собственности есть торговая точка по реализации детской одежды на центральном рынке. В торговле ей помогает родная сестра. Кредит будет использован для увеличения товаро обората детской одежды. 

Эрнисбек является 4 участником этой группы солидарности. Ему 22 года. Эрнисбек является студентом ВУЗа, изучает китайский язык. Он проживает вместе с родителями. Семья клиента имеет собственный земельный надел с 1994. В начале они в основном выращивали табак, однако в связи с падением рентабельности продукции, перешли на картофель. Сейчас они собираются приобрести 500 кг семян картофеля на этот кредит. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Sveta M. is 22 years old. She is married and is raising two sons. She lives in the village of Aravan together with her husband and parents-in-law. Her husband works as a taxi driver in this village. The monthly income is around $100. Since she was young Sveta together with her parents has been in agriculture mainly growing plants. At this time she is getting ready for the spring sowing. This year she plans to sow potatoes and will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. Tazargul is 24, she is married and lives with husband and parents-in-law. Her husband at this time works in the retail field in Kazakhstan. Tazargul is a seamstress. She sews bedding sheets, women's robes, dresses and etc. She will use the loan to buy the fabric to make the bedding. Sapilahan M. lives together with her husband and children. Her husband sells materials in the village of Aravan, and she works as a teacher of the Kyrgyz language at one of the local schools. Besides that they also have own stall where they sell children's clothing on the central market. Her sister helps her with the sales. She will use the loan to increase sales of children's clothing. Ernisbek is the fourth member of this solidarity group. He is 22 years old. Ernisbek is a university student, he studies Chinese. He lives with his parents. His family has their own land since 1994. In the beginning they were growing mainly tobacco, but because of the decrease in the demand in the product they have switched to potatoes. At this time they plan to buy 500 kg of potato seeds on this loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Alopino's Group

texts.en: Mercy A. is from the village of Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Mercy is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Mercy is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy owns and operates a "sari-sari" (convenience) store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from this activity. In 2006, Mercy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Mercy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma P. is from the village of Balulang in Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of different products in the local community. Wilma is just starting this business and has joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is requesting her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to purchase products to sell such as dairy products, soap, toothpaste and shampoos. Wilma plans to use the revenue generated from the business to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To open a retail shop.

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nordod

texts.en:
Nordod is 58 years old and lives with her husband and son in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son, Enhamgalan, is eight years old and attends a local primary school. Nordod's husband is a taxi driver. Nordod's other children are grown up, and live separately from their parents. 

Nordod operates a consumer products trading business at a local market. She sells a variety of consumer products including cups, toothpaste, toilet paper and towels. Nordod has been operating her business since 2002. She has steadily expanded her business, and gained much experience as a trader. Nordor's business is in a great location, and this helps keep her profits high. She has received three previous loans from XacBank. Nordod is a very hardworking and optimistic person. Her business and family are both important to her. She says, “I would like to start collecting money for my youngest son's tuition.” Nordod is requesting a 1,550,000 tugrug (~  1110 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of consumer products for her business, including cups, toothpaste, gloves, towels and juniper.

loans.use: To purchase consumer products to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Demetrio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es la  Sr. DEMETRIO,  ella tiene 49 años de edad, es separado y tiene 4 menores hijos, Nuestro socio alterna su trabajo con el comercio minorista, el se dedica a la docencia, él es profesor nombrado, el también es agricultor y ganadero en ancahuasi; Nuestro socio tiene terrenos de cultivo en su tierra natal y ahora el requiere el préstamo para poder comprar las semillas y abono.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Demetrio is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción” (Virgin of the Immaculate Conception). He lives in the District and Province of Anta, Department of Cusco.

Demetrio is 49 years old, separated from his spouse, and has four young children. He divides his time between his job and his small business. Demetrio works as a teacher and is a well-known professor. In addition, he is a farmer and livestock breeder in Ancahuasi. He owns farmland in his hometown and now needs a loan to buy seeds and compost.

Demetrio appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, he commits to submitting his loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & compost

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina P., 27 years old, is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is married and has 2 school-aged children.

To make a living Gina operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

Gina joined HSPFI in 2009 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Gina is requesting her third loan, for 11000 PHP, which she will invest in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family’s income.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi A. est une femme de 46 ans qui vit à Atakpamé une ville située à 100 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est une revendeuse de maïs et elle exerce cette activité il y a 18 ans, avec ce crédit, Essi voudrait acheter du maïs dans les fermes pour en faire le stock. Dans les moments de pénurie du maïs Essi souhaiterait vendre son stock pour avoir beaucoup de bénéfices. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, elle  préférerait prendre soins de sa petite famille et dans l’avenir elle compte vendre à Lomé.
texts.en:
Massi Koumako est une femme de 48 ans qui vit à Atakpamé avec sa famille et ses 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de noix de palme et elle exerce cette activité il y a 20 ans, elle va dans les fermes qui environnent Atakpamé pour se ravitailler. Avec ce crédit, Massi voudrait acheter en gros où le prix du bol de noix de palme est moins cher afin de réalisés beaucoup de bénéfices. Avec les bénéfices réalisés, Massi souhaiterait subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et dans l’avenir elle souhaiterait avoir à Lomé un marché qui lui ferait gagner beaucoup d’argent.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat du maïs pour le stock

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Viriginia M. is a widow who lives in Prk. Santol, Brgy. Jonobjonob, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and buy and sell (bananaque) businesses. 

Viriginia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Viriginia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,700!

This time, for her 4th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 to buy more stocks for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and expansion of her business.  Viriginia M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

---------------------------------------
About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This month, Rosalinda Alejado’s business is at its peak because classes have opened and therefore a lot of students and teachers need school uniforms and/or to have their uniforms repaired.  Just recently she has received a bunch of orders. Timely, the loan she is paying through ASHI has ended and now she is qualified to request another loan. Considering the high demand for her products, Rosalinda would like to request a larger loan. 

For Rosalinda’s previous performance in ASHI, she has maintained a 100% rating in terms of repayment, attendance to weekly center meetings and her business. Aside from proving her competence to other people, Rosalinda has also discovered that she has the ability to grow her business and to be responsible in paying a loan she used as an investment in her business. Although she cannot yet say that her business is sustainable, she is positive that someday it will thrive together with her family life.

loans.use: To buy a large volume of cloth and other supplies for making and repairing school uniforms.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
From the town of Cetro Napu, Tudela Mis. Occ., Jovita M. is a 68-year-old married mother of seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Jovita owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over seven years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jovita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan, her sixth, of 50000 PHP for the same purpose. Jovita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa N. is a charcoal seller in Takoradi. She is a married woman living with her five dependents. She has not received any formal education. Her husband is a palm wine tapper.  

Adwoa uses her returns from her sales to help her husband in providing the basic needs of her family.  Adwoa will use the loan to purchase additional bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwoa plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: purchase additional bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli M. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 49 years old. Noli is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Noli raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Noli has been engaged in farming for over eight years. He now owns a tricycle that he uses when free of farming duties. He transports people around his community with his tricycle.

Noli joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noli has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Noli is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds and for motorcycle maintenance. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Noli from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds and for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Kimiyokhon

texts.en:
I. Kimiyokhon is married and has two grown children. For the last decade, she and her husband have made a living by growing vegetables and raising cattle. Last season, the couple managed to raise a bumper crop, and they would like to continue that success this year by planting an even larger crop and raising more cattle. To make this possible, Kimiyokhon and her family are applying for a loan for $1,500. They hope to use the increased income made possible by this loan to improve their standard of living.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Amiel

texts.en:
Amiel is 43 years old and is married with six children. He is well-known in the business of selling a variety of foodstuffs such as beans, maize, etc. He has been in this business for a long time and his business hours are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Amiel needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to hopefully expand his business through purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs so as to satisfy the demand of his customers. If successful, he will earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to keep reinvesting for better expansion of his business and enable him to continue providing the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs such as beans, wheat, Irish potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan has been practicing mixed farming for 20 years in Kisii town, western Kenya. His farm produces bananas, sugarcane, maize and vegetables, which he sells to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to provide for the basic needs of his family. His biggest challenge has been disease and insecurity in the area. 

Nathan is 60 years old. He is married with six children who are all adults. Four of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested this loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.
